loans.name: Leap

texts.en:
A villager from the Siem Reap Province’s Chi Kreng district, Leap is 30 years old and married with one son, who is still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice and raising pigs. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day. 

Leap has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the loans, which have helped better support her family’s living to another level. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and more piglets to raise. She hopes to increase her crop yields and sell the crop for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap province, Chi Kreng district

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a 48-year-old proud father of nine children. He is a group leader, often described as a very trustworthy person, and is representing his group of 12 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Joseph has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Joseph described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Joseph’s Group will be able to plant a total of 3.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Vano

texts.en:
Vano is a 28-year-old, married man. He lives with his wife, an infant daughter, his brother and parents in the small village of the Mtskheta district. Vano works as a driver and gets a monthly income. 

He decided also to start a husbandry business and has requested a loan. The Start Up Program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2,100 GEL. With the credit he receives he will purchase 2 cows and will start producing dairy products. They will sell the dairy products locally and their family income will be increased. 

Vano awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase two cows

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 57 years old, married and has five adult children. She and her husband work hand-in-hand to earn a living and provide for their daily needs. 

It is hard to make a living, so Erlinda would like to improve their hog raising business and generate a higher income. For this, she needs to obtain additional capital of PHP 40,000 to buy the necessary hog feeds, vitamins and vaccines for the proper growth of her hogs. 

Through their patience and strong determination, they believe that someday they will improve their business as well as their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Fernando Isabel

texts.es: Fernando de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el trabajaba en una empresa privada, hoy se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan tiene panadería propia, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo una galera en donde tiene la panadería en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero como no posee mucho capital solicita nuevamente a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de madera, cuartones y laminas y así poder mejorar su lugar de trabajo.
texts.en: Fernando, 30, lives in his own house with his wife and two children.  He works for a private company and also makes and sells bread from his own bakery business.  With income from sales he is able to cover household expenses.  He wants to upgrade his home by building a galley where he makes the bread (shown in the picture).  Since he does not have the capital for the project he is requesting a new loan through INTEGRAL to buy wood, beams and metal sheeting to renovate his work area.

loans.use: To buy wood, beams and metal sheeting.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica  a la agricultura  al cultivo de maíz y frijol, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
This young man's face is blurred because he is 28 years old and lives in a high risk area.  He works in agriculture and grows crops such as corn and beans.  He sells his produce to neighboring villages and uses the profit from sales to cover some of the household expenses.  

He lives in his own house with his wife and daughter and is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manures, pest control agents, etc. and to improve the land shown in the picture.  This is so he can continue working and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, manures, pest control agents, etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Xiomy Estefany

texts.es:
XIOMY ESTEFANY, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera, actualmente se dedica exclusivamente a sus estudios de Ciencias Administrativas.
Ella se proyecta en tener en un futuro su propia empresa, aún no sabe en que rubro pero confía que en el transcurso de sus estudios podrá definirlo.
Le va bien en los estudios siempre ha sido muy estudiosa y agradecida con el esfuerzo que hacen sus padres para poder brindarle los estudios.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá para tomar algunos cursos adelantados del segundo ciclo de su carrera para poder terminar un poco antes.
texts.en:
Xiomy Estefany, 19, is single and dedicates all her time to her business administration studies.  She plans to have her own company in the future but still has not decided what area she will specialize in.  She trusts she will be able to define it during her course of study.

Her education is going very well because she has always been a very good student and grateful for the effort her parents made to give her an education.  She will use the loan to take advanced courses in the second term of her studies so she can finish a little bit sooner.

loans.use: To pay for the second term of her business administration studies.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a housekeeper and wants to earn a living to support her husband. 

She joined PMPC and was truly grateful for the credit to fully support her business. She is as careful with her PMPC membership as she is with her hog raising business, and she wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always apply for any financing needs. 

Now the loan of PHP 7,000 will help her to build a concrete pig pen that will support sanitation and be environmentally friendly.

loans.use: to build a concrete pig pen

loans.name: Presentation

texts.en: Presentation is 57 years old, separated, and a resident of Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. In order to survive, she earns a living through her sari-sari store. She joined PMPC and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of 3,000 PHP to buy additional stock for her store. Presentation deeply wishes to maintain her good standing with PMPC. She is thankful to PMPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her store

location.town: Sindangan-Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is grateful that she was granted a 25,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 25,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and frozen foods that she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her for it will surely fund their daily sustenance and cover her children's school needs. 

Sabina dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to give her children the best education possible to allow them better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 30-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her 5 children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years, and he is responsible for providing for the needs of the family. Abida also provides sewing services and earns some income to contribute to the household expenses along with her husband.
 
Abida now needs different kinds of goods such as needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to enable her to purchase the above accessories. This loan will help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Abida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Irma Arely

texts.es:
Irma, de 49 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casada, su esposo es agricultor, tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales solo dos viven con ella.

Irma, ha sido agricultora toda su vida, inicio a trabajar a la edad de 15 años, sus padres la llevaban a cortar café y algodón.- También, sus padres eran productores de maíz y frijol, ahí aprendió a sembrar estos cultivos.- Actualmente, se dedica a la crianza de ganado y siembra de 14,000 metros cuadrados de cultivos de sorgo y maíz, todo esto lo hace con ayuda de su esposo y sus dos hijas.

El crédito será invertido para pagar el alquiler del terreno donde sembrará y para comprar insumos agrícolas. 

El sueño de Irma, es mejorar su vivienda y ayudar a que sus dos hijas terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Irma, 49, has a ninth grade education.  She and her husband, who is a farmer, have five children but only two live at home.

Irma has worked in agriculture all her life and started at age 15 when her parents would take her to harvest coffee and cotton.  Her parents also produced corn and beans, so she learned about these crops.  She currently raises cattle and plants 14,000 square meters of sorghum and corn with the help of her husband and two daughters.

The loan will be used to pay land rental where she grows the crops and to buy farm supplies.

Irma's dream is to renovate her house and help her two daughters finish their education.

loans.use: To pay for land rental and buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Carmen Isabel

texts.es: Carmen es un señora emprendedora que a sus 47 años ha logrado superarse por medio de su negocio, ella es propietaria de una pulpería donde comercializa granos básicos además vende ropa esto en su domicilio, ella demuestra que el estar soltera no es impedimento para lograr la superación y que lo único que se necesita es tener las ganas y la motivación, en su caso es su hijo que depende económicamente de ella, es el décimo ciclo que ADIM le brinda el financiamiento y ha demostrado ser una persona responsable con sus cuotas de pago, este financiamiento lo solicita para la compra de una vitrina con seis depósitos por lo que sus clientes tendrán una mejor visión de los productos que ella ofrece. Su meta propuesta es aumentar y diversificar los productos ofrecidos para aumentar la clientela y por ende sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Carmen, 47, is an entrepreneur who has been able to make a living through her business.  She runs a grocery store set up in her home where she sells basic staple goods and clothing.  Despite being single she has proven that this does not stand in the way of getting ahead and the only things needed are determination and motivation.  In her case it is her son who is financially dependent on her.

This is the tenth loan she has received through ADIM and she has shown herself to be responsible paying back the loans.  She plans to use this one to buy a six-section display case so her customers can see her products better.  Her goal is to increase and diversify her products to attract more customers and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy a six-section display case.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 40 years old and a resident of Calatunan, Sindangan, Philippines. She is married with 4 kids. Her husband is a fisherman and they have a little fishing business, from which they earn a living.  

With their business they meet many challenges, but they realized that it is good to face the challenges rather than to get discouraged. Daisy and her husband work hard in selling their catch to the market. Sometimes there are wholesale buyers from other towns and cities who come to buy their fish. With their savings, they welcome the idea of expanding their business. 

They have requested from Paglaum MPC a Php 7,000 loan to purchase fish in bulk to resell at the fish market. They feel assured of Paglaum’s help, should there be a need for working capital in the future. 

Daisy smiles at the thought of seeing their children get their own diplomas one day.

loans.use: to purchase fish in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Phal

texts.en: Phal is a 30-year-old married factory worker with a child. She lives in the province of Kampong Speu, Cambodia. For the past three years, she has worked in a factory. Her husband is a 32-year-old worker and their only child attends school. She and her husband can make around $12 each day. Phal has been building a house but she lacks the money, so would like to request a loan to buy zinc sheets to roof the house. This loan will help her and her family have a proper house to live in. In the future, she is going to support her child through high school.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets to roof the house

loans.name: Taiswa's Group

texts.en:
Taiswa is a 57-year-old proud father of five children. He is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing his group of 14 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Taiswa has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Taiswa described his harvest as poor due to bad weather conditions last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to repair his home.

With this loan, Taiswa’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda is 55 years old and lives in P-2 Carangan, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with five children. She manages her restaurant with the help of her husband. She has had this business for 30 years. She requested a loan to buy additional utensils for her restaurant. She has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Nilda hopes to maintain her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils for her restaurant

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
In 2010, Marisa learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives. Marisa tried her luck with a business focusing on her farming activities. 

She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Marisa now needs another loan to pay for seedlings and compost. 

This will help boost her farming income. Marisa is looking for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Josue David

texts.es: Josue de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el se dedica a la crianza de ganado desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias es como logra salir adelante, Josue esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de terneros para continuar con la crianza y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Josue is 42 years old and lives in a privately-owned house with his partner. Josue has been making a living raising cattle for a number of years. He sells his products in neighbouring towns and uses his profits to move forward in life. Josue is applying for a loan in order to buy calves and continue raising cattle. He can then earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José, de 55 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casado y su esposa es agricultora  y no tienen hijos.
		
José, es una persona con muchos deseos de superarse, a los 12 años ingreso al ejército y permaneció ahí durante 16 años.- Hace 25 años se casó y fue su esposa quien le enseño a trabajar en la agricultura; actualmente trabajan en conjunto y siembran 14,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo de yuca y crían ganado de repasto.- Además, hace 5 años trabaja brindando el servicio de molienda a sus vecinos, de estas dos actividades obtiene ingresos, para cubrir los gastos del hogar.

El crédito será invertido para comprar ganado de repasto.

El sueño de José, es mejorar su vivienda y tener dos hijos.
texts.en:
José is 55 years old and has a sixth-grade education. He is married; his wife is a farmer. The couple has no children.

José would really like to do better in life. When he was 12 years old, he joined the army, where he remained for 16 years. Twenty-five years ago he married and his wife taught him how to work in farming. The couple now works together on 14,000 square metres of land. The couple grows yucca and raises grazing cattle. In addition, five years ago the couple began offering milling services to neighbours. The couple earns an income from this work to cover household costs.

This loan will be used to buy grazing cattle.

José’s dream is to improve his home and to have two children.

loans.use: to buy grazing cattle.

loans.name: Francisco Fabiel

texts.es: Francisco de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz, cuando ya está su cosecha la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, Francisco está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Francisco is 50 years old and lives in a privately-owned house with his wife. For a number of years, Francisco has made a living growing corn. Once ready, he sells his harvest in nearby towns. He has many regular customers. 

Francisco is applying for a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, anti-pest treatments, weed-killers and more, and to make improvements to his land, which is shown in the photograph. With this loan, he can continue to grow his crops, his only source of income, and earn more money.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, anti-pest treatments, weed-killers and more, and to make improvements to his land.

loans.name: Duane Kirby

texts.en:
Duane Kirby believes education is the key to success in life. He wants to earn a degree and become successful. Duane Kirby wants to help his family and his siblings to finish their education also. 

With the loan of Php 6,250, he will be able to pay for his tuition and other school fees. He is about to finish his course, but he needs to fully pay the school fees. 

Duane Kirby sees himself to be in a position to help others in the future.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition and other school fees.

loans.name: Buenos Aire Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Buenos Aires, está integrado por tres mujeres (Alicia, Lumeriana y Maggy), las tres son miskitas que viven en Bilwi, en el municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de venta de fritos y comercialización de pescado; se organizaron hace 8 meses para acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana.

Con el primer crédito otorgado por Pana Pana y financiado con KIVA, le permitió a Maggy, integrante del grupo solidario comprar mercadería: maní, chiverías, chicles, frutas e insumos para elaborar refrescos naturales y con las ganancias percibidas mejorar un poco su calidad de vida.

Lumeriana: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una señora trabajadora de 44 años de edad, casada con 8 hijos: 6 son mayores de edad y 2 adolescentes que estudian su primaria. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de pescado, mariscos, verduras, bastimentos y frutas de manera ambulante y en las paradas de buses, de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar y de los estudios de su hijo. Está solicitando préstamo para comprar: mariscos, pescados, frutas, verduras y bastimentos, para vender e incrementar sus ingresos y atender a más personas que demandan este producto que constituye uno de los alimentos básicos en Bilwi. Ella sueña con llegar a contar con suficiente capital para establecer una pulpería.
texts.en:
The “Buenos Aires” loan group has three members (Alicia, Lumeriana and Maggy). The three women are Miskito, and live in Bilwi, in the Puerto Cabezas municipality. They are enterprising women who work hard every day in order to expand their small businesses where they sell snacks and seafood. Eight months ago the group came together in order to apply for loans with Pana Pana.

The group’s first loan, granted by Pana Pana and funded by Kiva, allowed Maggy to buy merchandise: peanut brittle, dairy products, chewing gum, fruits and supplies for making fresh drinks. Maggy’s profits allowed her to improve her quality of life a little.

Lumeriana is 44 years old, married, and has eight children: six are now grown-up, while two are adolescents in primary school. Lumeriana has been selling fish, seafood, fruits, vegetables and supplies for a year. She works as a street vendor and at bus stops. Lumeriana earns her own income with this work and thereby helps with household costs and her son’s education.

Lumeriana is applying for this loan in order to buy seafood, fish, fruits, vegetables and supplies. She can then sell these on, increase her income, and tend to more customers who are looking for these staple items here in Bilwi. 

Lumeriana dreams of having enough monmey to open her own grocery store.

loans.use: to buy seafood, fish, fruits, vegetables and supplies.

loans.name: Hồng

texts.en:
Mrs Hồng works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Hồng has been involved in this business for 8 years. She is 39 years old and married with 2 children. Hồng lives  in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hồng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
The main hardship that Hồng faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hồng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Peeblon Group

texts.fr:
Mme AWA représente le groupe PEEBLON. Mariée, elle est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 18ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. 04 vont à l'école et elle a 08personnes en charge.
Mme est gérante de kiosque depuis 11ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans les boulangerie et les boutiques.
Elle veut s'acheter 06metres de fer pour élargir les dimensions de son kiosque.
Mme veut agrandir son activité avec ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne construire dans sa parcelle une maison d'habitation.
texts.en: Awa represents the Peeblon group. She is married and mother to five children, the eldest of whom is 18 years old and the youngest two. Four of the children go to school and Awa has eight dependants in total. She has been managing a kiosk for the past 11 years and gets her supplies in bakeries and shops. She would like to buy six meters of iron to expand the dimensions of her kiosk. She wants to expand her business with the profits she makes, and her ambition is to build a house on her own plot of land.

loans.use: to buy six meters of iron to expand the dimensions of her kiosk.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en: Erma is driven by the passion of selling. She is 45 years old, married, and lives with her family in Sindangan, Philippines. She runs a store to provide for her family's needs. Every day she patiently tends her store until 10:00 in the evening. Erma wants to expand her business; she recently applied for a loan from Paglaum MPC, where she became a member in 2011 in order to access insurance and financial assistance. Now she is borrowing PHP 14,900 to buy assorted goods to sell so that she has a better opportunity to increase her income. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store and providing her family with good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods to sell

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en: Isidra is a hardworking mother who runs a vegetable vending business. She has requested a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to buy a greater variety of vegetables to sell. This way, she will be able to sell more products which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ben Group

texts.fr:
MAMOU est la Dame  qui a ses  mains sur les sacs de riz  sur la photo. MAMOU  est une  malienne  qui n’a pas été à l’école. Elle est âgée  de 42 ans, mariée. Son mari est  forgeron  et fait un peu  d’élevage. Elle est mère  de 04 enfants. Mamou  fait le stockage de riz, depuis plus de  07 ANS.  Elle fait recourt au RMCR  pour acheter plus  de riz à stocker afin d’avoir plus de profits. Elle  s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants et revend dans les mêmes marchés. Le profit la  permettra  de prendre en  charges  des frais de  santé et  d’habillement  de ses enfants.
MAMOU rencontre souvent des problèmes  de mévente. Dans l’avenir elle veut  avoir un prêt beaucoup  plus élevé pour  développer son activité  de stockage en construisant  un magasin de stockage et faire le commerce pour satisfaire  plus les besoins de sa clientèle afin de prendre  beaucoup plus de  charges de ses enfants avec le profit.
texts.en: Mamou is the woman who has her hands on the sacks of rice in the photo. She is a woman from Mali who has never been to school. She is 42 years old and married. Her husband is a blacksmith and does a little animal raising too. Mamou is mother to four children. She has been stocking rice for more than seven years and is turning to RMCR so she can buy more rice to stock, in order to make more profit. She gets her supplies in the surrounding markets and resells them in the same markets. The profit she makes enables her to cover her children's health costs and clothing. Mamou suffers frequently from slumps in sales. In the future she would like to get a much bigger loan so she can develop her stocking activity, by building a warehouse, and do more business so she can satisfy customer demand and cover more of her children's expenses with the profits she makes.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cereals to stock and sell afterwards.

loans.name: Heritiana Louisette

texts.fr:
Mariée, sans enfants.Heritiana a 34 ans. Femme débrouillarde et aime améliorer sans cesse son activité. Auparavant, comme activité, elle ne faisait que l'achat et revente des viandes de poulet, mais actuellement, elle élève elle-même les poussins, elle a suivi  une  formations sur l’élevage des poules pondeuses et poulets de chair. 
A cause de cette extension d'activité donc, elle sollicite un prêt pour acheter des provendes et des poussins pour mieux ravitailler son petit poulailler.
Mais elle ne veux pas s'arrêter là pour l'avenir, car elle projette de construire une grande ferme plus tard
L'activité de son mari en tant que commerçant de provendes est complémentaire avec la sienne
texts.en:
Heritiana, who is married with no children, is 34 years old. She is a resourceful woman and likes to keep improving her business. Her previous business consisted purely of buying and selling of chicken meat, but now she raises the chickens herself and she has had training on the raising of egg-laying hens and broiler chickens. As a result of this extension of her business she is requesting a loan to buy chicken feed and chickens to increase the stock of her henhouse. 

She does not want to stop here though and in the future plans to build a large farm. Her husband's business as a merchant of animal feed is complementary to hers.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Admi Gricela

texts.es: Admi, tiene 24 años de edad, un grado de estudio de secundaria graduándose como bachiller técnico agropecuaria. Es madre soltera, tiene un hijo y tiene 3 años de edad viviendo en la casa de sus padres con la mama y otra hermana. Como medio de ingreso económico se dedica a la siembra y cultivo de café con una experiencia de seis años aprendiendo con su padre desde muy pequeña. El terreno ha sido comprado y como desventaja sobre el mismo es la distancia que está ubicado. Sus clientes en este negocio son los intermediarios y beneficios de forma directa. Como desafío las plagas como la roya por lo cual solicita crédito para poder comprar los insumos adecuados que permitan en esta nueva temporada la protección de sus cultivos con abono 12-24-12, foliares, formula 18-46-0, entre otros. La ampliación de su propiedad es una de sus mayores metas y quiere aprovecharlo mediante su carrera la cual le permite aplicar los conocimientos obtenidos en su carrera, así como nuevos métodos de cuidado para la plantación y la tierra por lo cual espera ser apoyada para salir adelante.
texts.en: Admi, is 24 years old, she has an educational level of secondary school, graduating with a agricultural technical diploma. She is a single mother, she has a son and he is three years old, and is living in her parents' house with the mother and another sister. As a means of getting income, she works growing coffee with six years of experience, learning with her father since she was very young. The land was purchased and its disadvantage is the distance at which it is located. Her customers in this business are intermediaries and has direct profits. Diseases such as rust are a challenge, so she is asking for a loan to be able to purchase adequate supplies that allow protection in this new season of her crop such as 12-24-12 manure, liquid fertilizers for leaves and formula 18-46-0 among others. Expanding her property is one of her greatest goals and she wants to make the most of it through her education which allows her to apply the knowledge obtained in her schooling, such as new methods of caring for the plantation and the land for which she hopes to be supported to continue onward.

loans.use: to purchase 12-24-12 manure, liquid fertilizers for leaves and formula 18-46-0 to apply to her coffee crop.

loans.name: Rudys Alberto

texts.es:
Rudys, de 43 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está casado y su esposa es comerciante, tienen una niña de 1 año.
		
Rudys, inicio a trabajar junto a su familia en la agricultura desde la edad de 10 años, también ha aprendido el oficio de cocer zapatos, en el cual trabajó 3 años.- A la edad de 17 años, inicio a trabajar como ayudante de albañilería y ahora realiza muy bien este oficio, cuando hay trabajo.- Actualmente, siembra 3,500 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz y tiene 3 años de estar laborando como vigilante de seguridad en una gasolinera.

El crédito será invertido para comprar materiales de construcción para arreglar su vivienda y así estar en mejores condiciones de vida.

El sueño de Rudys, siempre ha sido mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Además siempre ha soñado con aprender el oficio de estructuras metálicas.
texts.en:
Rudys, 43 years old, went to school up to the second grade. He is married, and his wife is in sales. They have a 1-year-old girl. 

Rudys began to work with his family in agriculture at the age of 10, he also has learned the trade of sewing shoes, in which he worked for 3 years. At the age of 17, he began to work as an assistant to a bricklayer and now he does this job very well, when there is work. Currently, he grows 3,500 square meters of corn and has been working for 3 years as a security guard at a gas station.

The loan will be invested in purchasing construction materials to fix his house and in this way be in better living conditions.

Rudys' dream has always been to improve his family's quality of life. In addition, he has always dreamed to learning to work with metal structures.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to fix his house.

loans.name: Santa Teresita Group

texts.es:
Erika es una mujer de 23 años de edad, casada, tiene una hija de 4 años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional. 
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, comprometida con su trabajo, atenta, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla de forma ambulante en la ciudad, esta se encuentra en un valle de tierra fértil y productiva a 2571 metros sobre el nivel del mar, rodeada por campos de cultivos y valiosos vestigios preincaicos e incaicos, conserva su personalidad virreinal, de clima seco y templado, las temperaturas en invierno no bajan más de 10° grados centígrados y en verano no suben más de 30°grados centígrados; siendo en la actualidad la tercera ciudad en importancia económica del país.
Erika es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, lo usa amarrado, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Quechua que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza(la 3 de la izquierda, usa chompa lila y una chalina alrededor del cuello).  Su necesidad de ayudar a su familia a generar mejores ingresos económicos para satisfacer las necesidades de su niña la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de edredones, taller de reparación de elctrodomésticos, servicio de transporte, venta de periódicos, venta de salteñas, librería y venta de ropa de segunda mano, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional y en esta ciudad se acostumbra al menú según el día, como; Lunes: Ají de flores de chilijchi (Flores de ceibo rehogadas con cebolla, tomate y locoto, y papas blancas), Martes: Conejo lambreado (Cuy rebozado con pan molido y frito, rociado con chorrillana y con guarniciones de chuño p’uti y papa blanca), Miércoles: Chajchu (Filamentos de carne de res, cebolla verde, habas tiernas, chuño picado, tajadas de huevo duro, salsa de cebolla a la juliana, tomate y locoto, y ahogado de ají colorado), Jueves: Chanka de conejo (Cuy tierno cocido y aromado con hierbabuena, cebolla verde, haba tierna, papa blanca y llajua de locoto. También se prepara de gallina), Viernes: Chicharrón de cerdo (Cocido al perol en su propia manteca, con mote de maíz blanco y llajua de locoto), Sábado: Fidius uchú (Ají de tallarines con caldo espeso, colitas de vaca, chuño y papa), Domingo: Phampaku (Versión valluna de la huatía con carnes de pato, lechón, cordero, pollo y lappin condimentadas. Se sirve con papa y plátanos al horno y ensaladas). “la cocina tradicional mayormente se hereda y pasa de generación en generación, no existe ninguna escuela de chef que enseñe lo que cocinamos…” comenta. Su sueño es darle un futuro mejor a su niña, ella desea realizar la compra de un carrito con ruedas para transportar sus ollas, platos, bales, bancos para sentarse, sombrilla y otros, para poder desplazarse a diferentes lugares de la ciudad y conseguir más clientes. Esta es la 4 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de manera independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Erika solicita un préstamo para la compra de un carrito con ruedas para poder vender comida en diferentes lugares de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Erika is a 23-year-old woman, married, has a 4-year-old daughter, and her business is selling traditional dishes. 

She is a good mother, enterprising, committed to her work, attentive, responsible, and hard-working. Her business is carried out as a street vendor in the city, which is located in a valley with fertile and productive land at 2571 meters above sea level, surrounded by fields of crops and valuable pre-Incan and Incan vestiges. It keeps its viceregal personality, has a dry and template climate where the winter temperatures don't go below 10° centigrade and in the summer, don't go above 30° centigrade. It is currently the third city in economic importance in the country. 

Erika has dark skin, long black hair, which she keeps tied up, dark eyes, is short, has a robust physique, her native language is Quechua which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and the work she does (she is the third from the left, with a purple sweater and a scarf around her neck). Her need to help her family generate more economic income to satisfy the needs of her girl brought her to form a bank of people with business such as quilts, appliance repair shop, transportation service, newspaper sales, meat pie sales, book store, and second-hand clothing sales, to ask for a loan and improve their businesses. 

Her business is selling traditional dishes and in this city they are used to a menu depending on the day such as Monday: Ají de flores de chilijchi (ceibo flowers sauteed with onion, tomato and green peppers, and white potatoes), Tuesday: Conejo lambreado (breaded and fried guinea pig and topped with french fries and beef and with garnishes of freeze-dried p'uti potatoes and white potatoes), Wednesday: Chajchu (filets of beef, green onion, tender broad beans, chopped freeze-dried potatoes, slices of boiled egg, a sauce of julienned onions, tomatoes and green peppers, and covered in red chili), Thursdays: chanka de conejo (tender guinea pig cooked and flavored with mint, green onion, tender broad beans, white potatoes, and green pepper llajua hot sauce; it is also prepared with chicken), Friday: pork rinds (cooked in a clay pot in its own lard, with boiled white corn and green pepper llajua hot sauce), Saturday: fidius uchú (noodle chili with a thick stew, cows tails, freeze-dried potato and potato), and Sunday: phampaku (a valley version of the slow-cooked flavored dish of duck, piglet, lamb, chicken and brisket; it is served with potatoes and baked plantains and salads). "Traditional dishes are largely inherited and pass from generation to generation. There isn't any cooking school that teaches what we cook..." she says. Her dream is to give her girl a better future, she wants to purchase a cart with wheels to transport her pots, plates, benches for seating, umbrella, and more, to be able to move to different places in the city and get more customers. This is her 4th loan cycle with the institution in the 6 years she has been doing this work independently. 

It is for these reasons that Erika asks for a loan to purchase a cart with wheels to be able to sell food in different places int he city.

loans.use: to purchase a cart with wheels to be able to sell food in different places in the city.

loans.name: Jose Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casado, es padre de una niña que está estudiando párvularia.

Fidel, es pastor  y presbítero desde hace 2 años, de la iglesia de su comunidad, la cual cuenta con 160 miembros, a su iglesia vino un programa de ayuda para niños de escazos recursos, denominado Centros de Desarrollo Infantil (C.D.I.), ellos le solicitaron construir una sala para reuniones a la iglesia, pero no tienen recursos para construirla.
 
Por esa razón Fidel, está solicitando un crédito para comprar los materiales para la construcción de la sala en la iglesia, ya que la mano de obra la harán los miembros de la iglesia.

El sueño de don Fidel, es poder ver felices y disfrutando de mejores instalaciones a los niños que se beneficiarán con este programa llamado C.D.I.
texts.en:
Fidel, 30, studied up to the ninth grade. He is married and is the father of a little girl that goes to kindergarten.

Fidel has been working as a pastor and a priest for two years at the community church, which has 160 members. The church was offered to host a program aimed at helping children living in poverty, called Centros de Desarrollo Infantil (C.D.I.) [Child Development Centers]. For this, they were asked to build a meeting room, but they cannot afford it.

This is why Fidel is requesting a loan to buy materials and build the room. The church’s members will provide the labor. Fidel’s dream is to see happy children enjoying the facilities and the benefits offered by this program called C.D.I.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a meeting room for his church.

loans.name: Henry Luis

texts.es:
Entre espátulas,  pinzas y batas blancas creció Henry, viendo el gran amor que su madre le ponía a su trabajo de Odontóloga;  pasión  que en poco tiempo, también adquirió él. En la actualidad, cursa el último año en esa carrera y las ansias por iniciar su vida laboral, se hacen cada vez más a flor de piel, pues el recibir una linda sonrisa al final, es la mayor satisfacción que este joven puede tener. 

Henry es un joven apasionado, dedicado y soñador que se esfuerza día a día por cumplir sus metas. Por ello, solicita el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación, el cual lo ayudará a cumplir uno de sus sueños. Entre los planes de  él, está  abrir una clínica odontológica con su mamá,  y al ser egresado podrá estar a un paso más de cumplir esa meta.
texts.en:
Henry grew up surrounded by carvers, clamps and gowns. He witnessed how his mother loved her work as a dentist, something he inherited with time. He is currently studying his last year of Dentistry and cannot wait to start working, since nothing satisfies him more than a beautiful smile.

Henry is a passionate, dedicated and visionary young man who works hard every day to achieve his goals. This is why he is requesting a loan to pay for his graduation course. This will help him to achieve one of his dreams. Henry plans to open a dental clinic together with his mother. By receiving his degree, he will be one step closer to achieving that goal.

loans.use: to pay for a graduation course at the university.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy edible products and traditional fabric.

loans.name: Nueva Opción Group

texts.es:
Los integrantes del grupo "Nueva Opción" habitan en una comunidad mazahua donde la principal actividad es la siembra de maíz. 

Lucía tiene 40 años de edad y está casada con Antonio quien se dedica a la construcción. La pareja tiene dos niñas que actualmente se encuentran estudiando el preescolar. 

Hace 3 años, Lucía comenzó a hacerse cargo de una pequeña tienda de abarrotes. Al momento de casarse y formar una familia, sabía que tenía que apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar pero no quería salir y descuidar a su familia. Lucía, activa como siempre, también sentía la necesidad de hacer algo más aparte de los quehaceres del hogar.  Un conocido de Antonio les ofreció la oportunidad de traspasarles su tienda y la pareja lo vio como la opción perfecta para que Lucía tuviera una actividad extra.

Sin embargo, no contaban con el dinero para comprar toda la mercancía que ya estaba en la tienda, sus ahorros no eran suficientes y fue como se acercaron a VisionFund México. Afortunadamente, reunieron el capital para lograr su meta y con el tiempo la tiendita que al principio se ubicaba en otra calle de la misma comunidad también la terminaron instalando en su casa.

Lucía se siente realmente agradecida con los préstamos ya que no sólo le permitieron conseguir su negocio sino que ciclo tras ciclo puede abastecerse como en esta ocasión que comprará galletas, refrescos, jugos, arroz y fríjol entre otros productos. Además, las ganancias le ayudaron para comenzar a criar y vender pollos y así tener un poco más de dinero para la familia. Lucía percibe un cambio en su vida: tiene su propio ingreso y puede volver a invertir en sus negocios y contribuir para pagar algunos gastos de sus niñas. Actualmente ya no necesita tomar dinero del gasto de su esposo para mantener sus actividades y eso la hace sentir plena.

Al enfrentarse al reto de la competencia, Lucía sigue mostrándose feliz y optimista como siempre "Yo siempre miro hacia adelante" comenta, ya que al ver tantas otras tiendas en la misma comunidad, la impulsan a tener más variedad de productos en la suya. Su meta es comenzar a vender carnes frías muy pronto por lo que necesitará un refrigerador grande.

Los demás integrantes del grupo también aprovecharán la oportunidad del apoyo económico para invertir en sus actividades. Ofelia invertirá en propia tienda de abarrotes; Nancy, en la cría de borregos; Alejandro, en la cría de becerros; Susana y Rosalía, en la cría de pollos.

*En la imagen: los integrantes en la plaza central del municipio donde viven, donde en tiempos de celebración se instala una feria. Muy cerca se encuentra el palacio de gobierno, una fuente, un quiosco y la iglesia católica que dotan de una hermosa vista al municipio. Lucía viste una chamarra negra con franjas blancas.
texts.en:
The members of the group “Nueva  Opción” reside in a mazahua community, where the main occupation is sowing maize. 
Lucia is 40 years old, and she is married to Antonio, who works in construction. The couple have two daughters who currently attent preschool. 
Three years ago, Lucia started to take charge of a small grocery shop. When she got married and had a family, she knew she had to help her husband with household expenses, but she didn’t want to go out and not take care of her family. Lucia, active as always, also felt the need to do something more besides household chores. An acquaintance of Antonio offered them the opportunity to let them take over his shop, and the couple saw it as a perfect option so that Lucia would have another occupation. 
However, they did not have the money to purchase all of the merchandise which was already in the store, their savings were not enough, and that is how they approached VisionFund Mexico. Fortunately, they accumulated the capital to achieve their goal, and with time, the small shop that at the beginning was located in another street in the same community, was also installed in their home. 
Lucia is very grateful for the loans, as they have not only allowed her to start her business, but cycle after cycle she can stock up on cookies, sodas, juices, rice, and beans, among other products. Also, the profit helped her to start breeding and selling chickens, and therefore have more money for the family. Lucia perceives a change in her live: she has her own income and she can invest it again in her business and help out by paying some of the expenses of her daughters. Currently, she does not need to take money from her husband’s income to maintain her occupation, and this makes her feel fulfilled. 
When facing the challenge of competition, Lucia keeps showing her happiness and optimism as always: “I always look forward”, she says, as when she sees so many shops in the same community, it pushes her to have a larger variety of products in her own. Her goal is to start selling cold meats very soon, which is why she will need a large fridge.
The other members of the group will also take advantage of the opportunity of economic assistance to invest in their activities. Ofelia will invest in her own grocery shop; Nancy, breeding sheep; Alejandro, breeding calves; and Susana and Rosalia, breeding chickens. 

*In the picture, the members are in the main plaza of the municipality where they live, when during festive days, there is a fair. Very nearby is city hall, a fountain, a kiosk, and a catholic church which give a great view to the municipality. Lucia wears a black jacket with white stripes.

loans.use: to purchase cookies, drinks, juices, rice, and beans.

location.town: San Felipe del Progreso, Estado de México

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John has been a farmer for 20 years. Although he is pictured alone, he is representing his group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. John has always been described as a very resourceful person, which is largely why he was selected to be the group leader.

John started working with One Acre Fund for the first time in 2014, and this year he decided to not only get farming inputs but also a solar light as part of his loan. He is very excited about this new addition, as now he will be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge his phone. He can’t wait to buy a cow using the profits he earns from this coming season. 

John's Group will be able to plant a total of 4.75 acres using the farming inputs obtained with this loan, and will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 27-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her two children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years, and he is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Asma is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.
 
She needs different kinds of goods such as needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also help her to increase her monthly sales and profits by providing better sewing services.

Asma is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business

loans.name: Hermosa

texts.en:
Hermosa is grateful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her ornamental business. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would now like to apply for another 50,000 loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer and farm inputs (seedlings), pots, wires and nets she needs for  growing her ornaments to sell. It will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her. 

Hermosa hopes for her ornamental farm business to flourish and grow. She aims to improve their quality of life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizer, wires and nets for her business.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig-fattening business and a retail firewood business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Nilda successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is relisting Nilda's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

Suzette successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF in order to buy wheels and other spare parts for her motorcycle passenger business.

NWTF is relisting Suzette's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy wheels and other spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Chitech's Group

texts.en:
Chitech has eight children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Chitech is representing her group of 16 farmers in Kakamega North District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Chitech has been a farmer for more than 20 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting. It will  reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Chitech is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 7.75 acres will be planted by Chitech's Group, and among them they will receive a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new kinds of birds for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized metal roofing, wood, rebar, and so on to repair the roof of her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a perimeter wall to make her house safer.

loans.name: Catachilla Alta Group

texts.es:
Corina es una mujer de 39 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos varones de 10 y 16 años y una hija mujer de 18 años de edad, y su negocio es la confección de pantalones deportivos.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, buena oyente, optimista, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ caracterizada por su crecimiento de un 60 por ciento cada año, y se constituye como el granero de la ciudad por la producción de todo tipo de carnes y verduras, de clima templado similar al de la ciudad, durante el invierno, la gama de temperaturas varía de 1 grado centígrados a 24 grados centígrados y las lluvias son raras; durante la época de verano, la gama de temperaturas varía a partir de 10 grados centígrados a 19 grados centígrados con fuertes lluvias.
Corina es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada a la izquierda, viste una chompa lila, y mangas animal print grises). su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, la hija mayor estudia peluquería en un instituto, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua de pozo y electricidad, su deseo de superación con el fin de ayudar a sus hijos la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con emprendimientos y negocios como; servicio de fotocopias, venta de bisutería, comercio de verduras, fabricación de chicha, venta de jugos naturales, venta de ropa de segunda mano y venta de cd’s de música para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la confección de pantalones deportivos para la venta por mayor, ella se encarga de comprar tela de varios colores, elásticos para ajustar la cintura y otros accesorios como cierres y cintas; para diseñar pantalones deportivos y venderlos por mayor a clientes fijos en diferentes mercados y comercios de venta al detalle. “inicie mi negocio por la necesidad de independizarme y generar mejores ingresos económicos, actualmente trabajo sola y mi negocio solventa todos los gastos de mi hogar…” comenta. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de ropa dónde pueda exponer y vender sus creaciones, ella desea realizar la compra de tela por mayor para la elaboración de pantalones deportivos para colegios y escuelas. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad, es por esos motivos que Corina solicita un préstamo para la compra de cortes de tela por mayor para la confección de pantalones deportivos para escuelas y colegios.
texts.en:
Corina is a 39 year old woman, single, she has 2 sons who are 10 and 16 years old and a daughter who is 18 years old, and her business is the production of athletic pants.

She is a good mother, entrepreneur, good listener, optimist, responsible and hardworking. Her business is built up in the town of "Sacaba," characterized for its growth of 60% each year, and it is becoming the center of the city for the production of all types of meats and vegetables, with a mild climate similar to that of the city, the range of temperatures varies from 10 degrees Celsius to 19 degrees Celsius with strong rains.

Corina is dark skinned, with long black hair she commonly wears tied, dark eyes, short stature, robust physical constitution, her maternal language is Quechua which is spoken in the area and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and because of the business she carries out (seated to the left, wearing a lilac sweater, and grey animal print sleeves). She shares her life with her children who study in school. The older daughter studies hairdressing in an institute. They live in a house constructed from brick with a corrugated iron roof which has well water and electricity. Her wish is self-improvement with the purpose of helping her children. This brought her to lead a group of people with business undertakings such as photocopying service, jewelry sales, vegetable store, chicha production, sale of natural juices, sale of secondhand clothing, and sale of music CDs to request a loan and improve their businesses. 

Her business is the production of athletic pants for wholesale. She is in charge of purchasing fabric of various colors, elastics to adjust the waist, and other accessories such as zippers and ribbons; in order to design athletic pants and sell them wholesale to loyal clients in different markets and retail businesses. 

"I started my business out of the need to become independent and generate more income, now I work alone and my business covers all the expenses of my home..." she comments. Her dream is to open a clothing store where she could show and sell her creations, she wants to purchase wholesale fabric for the production of athletic pants for schools. This is the second in a sequence of loans for the institution in 10 years that is developing this activity, it is for those reasons that Corina requests a loan for the purchase of lengths of fabric wholesale for the production of athletic pants for schools.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale lengths of fabric to make athletic pants for schools

loans.name: Benson's Group

texts.en:
Benson is a 32-year-old proud father of five children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and he is representing his group of 12 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Benson has noticed that he has learnt a lot from farming training.

Benson described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. 

With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Benson’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land and purchase a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 38-year-old married lady who has been employed in a reputable company since 2004. She is well known in her region, with her good reputation and hard work to develop her family's living. 

Mona has a limited monthly salary; she is working hard to help her husband earn their living. That's why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy necessary furniture for her house.

She hopes that she can stay capable of developing her family's social and living situations and achieve a brighter future.

loans.use: To buy necessary furniture for her house

loans.name: John Joel

texts.en: John Joel is 18 years old and comes from Estrella, Rizal, Nueva Ecija. Their family earns an income from farming. This is hard for his parents because they only get an income during harvest. But John Joel is determined to finish his studies; that’s why he wants to access an education loan of PHP15,000. He is hopeful that lenders will approve his loan so he can continue his studies and give his family a better future.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia Bertha se dedica al negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Bertha’s business is handicrafts.  She sells sweaters, blankets, and knitted and woven goods.  She sells different textiles.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  She has had this business for eight years, and it is going very well for her.

Her dream is to expand her business of selling knitted and woven goods.  She is requesting the loan to buy sweaters and knitted and woven goods.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy sweaters and knitted and woven goods.

loans.name: Deday

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Deday works hard to support her family.

She has a businesses selling livestock in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Deday is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy more livestock to sell.

Deday has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money in order to ensure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma con su anterior crédito logró un mayor capital de trabajo, y sus ventas y sus utilidades aumentaron. Ella está muy agradecida por el apoyo de Kiva, porque mejoraron los ingresos de su negocio y con ello los de su familia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, mediante el cual comprará mercancías variadas sobre pedido como calzado ropa etc, y materias primas para hacer manualidades como muñecos de trapo artículos que mucho gustan a niños y adultos y con los cuales augura su éxito.
texts.en: With her previous loan, Norma was able to get more work capital, and her sales and profits increased. She is very grateful for the Kiva support, because her earnings and those of her family increased. Currently, she is requesting a new Credikiva to buy diverse merchandise she has orders for, such as footwear, clothes, etc. She will also buy raw materials to make crafts, such as rag dolls, which girls and adults like so much, and which she thinks will bring her much success.

loans.use: to buy footwear, clothes, etc., and raw materials, such as cotton, thread, fabric, etc. to make handcrafts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for inventory for the office

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is a 32-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. Her husband owns a printing shop; he is the guardian of family and responsible to fulfill the needs of all family members. 

Uzma has been running her own beauty salon for the past five years. She also contributes her income together with her husband to manage the household. 

Uzma needs to buy different types of cosmetics, e.g., creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon but due to financial constraints she is not able to buy these items for her business purposes. 

Therefore Uzma has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purposes so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance Uzma is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her beauty parlor business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for marketing and inventory

loans.name: San Jeronimo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario es uno de los pocos grupos mixtos, integrado por un varón y 2 mujeres emprendedoras (Juan Carlos, Dacia y Yorlene Selena), viven en Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de: salón de belleza, ropa y calzados. Escogieron el nombre de San Jerónimo, porque dos integrantes del grupo solidario son originarios de Masaya.

Con el crédito anterior otorgado por Pana Pana y financiado por KIVA, le permitio a Dacia, coordinadora del grupo solidario comprar mercadería para su pequeño salón de belleza: Pinturas de uñas, tintes, maquillaje, perfumes, cremas corporales.

Juan Carlos: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es un hombre alegre y sociable, originario de Masaya, se trasladó a Bilwi hace 17 años, con el propósito de establecer su propio negocio. Está casado, tiene dos hijos: La mayor de 12 años cursa su primer año de secundaria y la menor de 6 años estudia su primer grado de primaria. Su esposa es comerciante.  Tiene varios años de experiencia como pequeño comerciante de ropa nueva y calzado, gracias a los créditos otorgados anteriormente por Pana Pana y financiado por KIVA le han permitido diversificar su oferta de productos y surtir su tramo poco a poco, actualmente vende en su tramo queso y frijoles cocidos. Está solicitando financiamiento para incrementar su inventario de ropa y calzado, los cuales comprará en Managua y Masaya para poder ofertar a precios más accesibles para la población y clientela en Bilwi. Su sueño es tener su propio capital.
texts.en:
This communal bank is one of the few mixed groups, made up of one man and two enterprising women (Juan Carlos, Dacia and Yorlene Selena). They live in Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. The women are entrepreneurs who are working hard to make their small businesses grow: a beauty salon and clothing and shoe sales. They chose the name San Jerónimo because two members of the communal bank are originally from Masaya.

With the previous loan, provided by Pana Pana and financed by Kiva, Dacia, the group's coordinator, was able to buy merchandise for her small beauty salon: nail polish, dyes, makeup, perfumes and body lotions. 

Juan Carlos is a member of the communal bank. He is a cheerful and sociable man, who originally came from Masaya. He moved to Bilwi 17 years ago, with the aim of establishing his own business. He is married and has two children: the older one, age 12, is in the first year of secondary school, and the younger one, age 6, is in the first grade of primary school. His wife is a merchant. He has several years of experience as a small merchant selling new clothing and shoes. Thanks to the loans granted previously by Pana Pana and financed by Kiva, he has been able to diversify his offerings of products and and stock his business little by little. Currently he also sells cheese and cooked beans from his sales stand. He is requesting a loan to increase his inventory of clothing and shoes, which he will buy in Managua and Masaya so he can offer more affordable prices for the local people and his customers in Bilwi. His dream is to have capital of his own.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of clothing and shoes and to buy beans, cheese and charcoal.

loans.name: Sabit

texts.en:
Sabit is a 27-year-old single man. He is a refugee and lives with his parent in an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) settlement built by the order of the president in Bilasuvar's villages. 

Sabit earns money for the family working on a farm. He helps a farmer take care of cows and has worked on this farm for five years. He has good experience, but his monthly salary is only 190 AZN. This amount is small and doesn't cover the family's needs.

Sabit loves his parents very much and does everything in order to help them and take care of them properly because they are old. Now, Sabit has applied for 1,200 AZN in order to provide his father good therapy in a qualified medical center. He hopes and believes that this money will help his father get treatment and feel better.

loans.use: to provide his father good therapy in a qualified medical center

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 58 years old, married and had three children. She lives at Piat. She is selling grocery items and vegetables to the people in her village. She is extending good services to her customers and wanted to improve her sales. So, she is now asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy sugar, coffee, noodles, canned goods and biscuits to sell. 

Someday, she hopes to continue improving her services and save funds for emergency expenses.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, noodles, canned goods and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow and increase milk production.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 34 years old and married with one kid who is in school. Jenelyn works very hard to provide for the family.

Jenelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of goods to sell in her store.

Jenelyn has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Erland Joel

texts.es:
La sonrisa cálida de Erland, hace confirmar su vocación por ayudar a los demás mediante la medicina. Este joven de 22 años de edad, estudia la carrera universitaria de medicina desde hace cuatro años. Con emoción cuenta que está cumpliendo su sueño desde pequeño, el cual era conocer la función del cuerpo humano y principalmente ayudar la salud de personas. 
Erland desde pequeño miraba a sus padres vestir de blanco al irse a trabajar. Ahora es él quien todos los días alista su bata blanca para seguir ese camino, que le fue inspirado al ver a su madre desarrollarse como odontóloga y a su padre como médico general. En estos momentos este joven sonriente solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora, así también para obtener equipos quirúrgicos y de otoscopio que tanto necesita para desempeñarse como médico.  Además que cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres, esto le permitirá formarse mediante la teoría y la práctica. En sus planes está hacer una especialidad.
texts.en: Erland's warm smile confirms his vocation in helping others through medicine. This 22 year old young man has been studying medicine for four years. He says with emotion that he is fulfilling his child's dream of finding out about the human body, and specially to help people with their health. Since he was young, Erland would see his parents dress in white and go to work. Nowadays, he is the one who gets dressed in his white robe to follow this path, inspired by his mother who is a dentist and his father, who is a general doctor. Currently, this young man is requesting a loan to buy a computer, as well as surgical equipment and otoscope tools, which he urgently needs to work as a doctor. Also, he has his parents' support which will allow him to learn in theory and practice. His plans include to get specialized in a medical area.

loans.use: to buy a computer, surgical equipment and otoscope tools.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 35-year-old woman and mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a food stall; he sells different types of edible items, e.g., samosa, vegetable rolls, chicken tikka, Kabab paratha, etc. Her husband is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Asma's husband needs to purchase different types of edible and other items for his business purpose so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, he is not in the condition to purchase these items for his business purpose.

Therefore, Asma has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business purpose. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's food stall business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy accessories for her solar energy system

loans.name: Wilberforce's Group

texts.en:
Wilberforce, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 14 farmers in Kakamega North District. He is 50 years old, is married and has seven children.

Wilberforce likes to think of himself as a very hardworking individual. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has learnt a lot from farming training sessions. Wilberforce plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Wilberforce’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 7.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Roini

texts.en:
Roini is 42 years old, married, and has three children. He is from Teklati. For lack of economic resources and because he had to start working at a very young age, Roini was unable to study a professional career.  He works hard to generate some income to cover his family's increased needs, but he finds it hard. The family lives under the poverty level and his wife takes social assistance from the local government. 

Roini realizes income from selling milk products to the local government. He wants to expand the agribusiness and requested a loan from Credo for 1,300 GEL, which he will use to purchase pigs to raise and sell. The startup program, which is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables the rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program. Roini plans to sell the pigs at a good price at the local market and earn more significant income than he has been earning. He hopes to see his family's living conditions improve and to more effectively meet daily costs.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Hamda

texts.en:
Hamda is a 47-year-old married mother of six children. She started raising cows 18 years ago to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their beloved family. 

Hamda is a hardworking and sacrificing mother who is trying her best to improve her family's living conditions, thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to cover her son's travel expenses. This loan will build a better future for her son. Hamda hopes to stay capable of providing her family with a better life.

loans.use: to cover her son's travel expenses

loans.name: Reda

texts.en:
Reda is a 35-year-old married man from Khanyounis city. He lives with his wife and two daughters in a a small, simple house. Reda works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. He also has a small farm for raising birds.
 
Reda took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new kinds of birds for his farm. This will increase his sales and his income. 

Reda appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new kinds of birds for his farm.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Chhun is a 31-year-old single factory worker who lives in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. He has been working in the factory for over ten years, making approximately $5 a day. 

Chhun is getting married soon and now he would like to request a loan to cover his wedding expenses. With this loan, he will have enough money to hold a wedding. In the future, he is going to save money to build a proper house.

loans.use: to cover his wedding expenses

loans.name: Zulfiyya

texts.en:
Zulfiyya is 28-year-old gardener. She is married and has a son and two daughters. Though the members of her family are refugees and have lived in an IDP settlement for a long time, they try to live happy lives and provide their children with bright futures. Zulfiyya's husband is a taxi driver. Zulfiyya is a gardener and gets 155 AZN monthly. They have a big garden where she raises seasonal fruit trees but the income from the garden doesn't cover the family's needs. 

Zulfiyya has worked as a gardener for 5 years and has a good experience. She raises her crops and then sells to local groceries, markets, and restaurants because fruit is in high demand in Azerbaijan. Zulfiyya loves her job very much. It gives her pleasure to take care of her trees. She treats them as if they were her children, too. 

Now Zulfiyya has applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to purchase new garden tools and quality fertilizers for her trees. She wants to increase her harvest productivity and the income of her family.
