loans.use: to purchase new garden tools and quality fertilizers for trees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow and increase milk production to meet the increasing demand for milk.

loans.name: Irum

texts.en:
Irum is a 30-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her one son and one daughter; her children are doing their studies. Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for three years; he is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. 

Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Irum is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Irum is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rabbits for his farm.

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is aged 44 years. He is married with six children aged between 1 and 19 years. Four of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been producing rice for 22 years. Also, his wife is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay his laborers. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay his laborers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, pesticides and to pay workers to attend to her coffee crops.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a 40-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years; he is responsible to fulfill the needs of his family. Sumaira is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. 

She needs different kinds of supplies, e.g., needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these supplies. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above supplies and also be helpful for her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Sumaira is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to expand her sewing business

loans.name: Amer

texts.en: Amer, pictured in the photo, is a 21-year-old single man from a village near the city of Hebron. He lives with his family in a small, simple, house. Amer is a worker who earns a very low income. He also has a small poultry farm. It is a very profitable business. Amer would like to improve his business, so he took out a US dollar loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more chicks for his farm. This will increase his productivity and his income.

loans.use: to buy more chicks for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: bring electricity to her home.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es: Karen de 32 años de edad habita con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 6 y 11 años; ella ofrece servicios de peluquería y es muy usual que sus vecinos y referidos, se acerquen a las instalaciones de Karen, ubicadas en su propia casa, para cortarse, tinturarse, peinarse el cabello, maquillarse o hacerse manicure o pedicure. Todo esto lo aprendió cuando estudió en una academia de belleza y puso mucho cuidado en captar las técnicas para hacer su trabajo con mucha calidad y un año después en el 2014 emprendió su propio negocio, en el cual atiende a sus vecinos referidos amistades y familiares. Su meta más adelante, es adecuar su infraestructura y aumentar y fortalecer sus ingresos, pero su gran desafío es lograr un capital de trabajo suficiente para hacerlo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará 2 cepillos de peluquería, un secador, una vitrina secadora y  para comprar productos de belleza y llenar su nueva vitrina. Con esta inversión su negocio se fortalece y  poco a poco resolverá su desafío de inversión
texts.en:
Karen is 32 years old and she lives with her husband and two children who are 6 and 11 years old. She offers hair salon services and she usually gets many referrals. Her business is located in her home, where she provides services like cuts, dyes, styling, make-overs, manicures and pedicures. She learned all of these skills when she went to beauty school and she worked hard to learn the best techniques to provide the highest quality service.

After 2014, she opened her own business where many of her neighbors and friends come for salon services. Her goal for the future is to improve the infrastructure of her business and increase and stabilize her earnings. However, one of her biggest challenges is finding working capital. This is why she is applying for a loan with Kiva.

This is her first loan and with it she will purchase two hair washing stations, a hair dryer, a glass cabinet that she will stock with beauty supplies she will also purchase with the loan. She will be able to strengthen her business with this support and little by little she will resolve her investment challenges.

loans.use: purchase two hair washing stations, a hair dryer, a glass cabinet that she will stock with beauty supplies

loans.name: Jenelita

texts.en:
Jenelita is 46 years old and married with eight children. Four of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from general store.

Jenelita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an additional dairy cow, sheep and poultry.

loans.name: Cyprus

texts.en: Cyprus is 44 years old, married, and has six children who all attend school in Kasese, Uganda. Cyprus's prayer is to see his children attain university degrees. He is a farmer and has been in farming for fifteen years, mainly growing and selling coffee, and that's how he has been able to raise the income to educate his children. Cyprus is applying for a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es: Petrona de 66 años de edad tiene dos tipos de negocios por un lado es comerciante de artículos variados como juegos de cama, ropa en todas las líneas etc, y por otro lado elabora ricos pasabocas para eventos especiales, como cumpleaños, matrimonios,  grados y reuniones grupales donde comparten diálogos además de consumir  deditos de queso, empanadas, quibbes etc.  Su deseo de generar ingresos la llevó desde el año 2012 a emprender su negocio y hoy no se detiene, pues ha encontrado en ella,  una fuente de bienestar apoyando el sustento de su hogar.  Sus ventas las realiza semanalmente, y sus compras las hace con una frecuencia de dos veces por semana, dedicándole diariamente a su negocio 6 horas o más,  para el ejercicio de su comercialización.  Los clientes actuales de Petrona son sus propios vecinos, familiares y los referidos por estos. Hoy su meta es incrementar sus ventas y utilidades y mejorar los ingresos familiares, aunque su insuficiente capital es su mayor desafío para aumentar la productividad. En la actualidad ha acudido a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa femenina y ropa de camas, además de insumos para producir pasabocas y responder a su clientela actual y potencial saliéndole al paso a sus desafíos actuales.
texts.en:
Petrona is a 66-year old woman who runs two different businesses, one selling several linen products and the other one making delicious snacks for special events, such as birthday parties, weddings, graduations and group meetings where cheese fingers, quiches, etc. are consumed. She started her business in 2012 with an aim to generate income and has found the source of her well-being to sustain her household. She sells weekly and buys twice a week, spending approximately 6 hours every day in trading matters. Petrona's current clients are her neighbors, family members and people referred by them. 

Her goal is to increase sales and to improve family income, although her insufficient capital is a challenge to increase productivity. She is requesting a loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for the first time, and will use it to buy women clothing, bed linens, as well as ingredients for the snacks. She expects to be able to respond to her current and potential demand, facing her current challenges.

loans.use: to buy women clothes and bed linens, as well as ingredients for snacks.

loans.name: Jeannete

texts.en:
Jeannete is 35 years old. She is married and has three children, from 8 to 15 years old. Two of them go to school. She is a farmer who has been producing rice for 17 years, while her husband is a businessman. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers. The profits from the business will be uses to pay school fees for her children and to improve her welfare.  

The agricultural sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of all Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition, because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay farm workers.

loans.name: Johnathan's Group

texts.en: Johnathan is the group leader of his group, from Kakamega North District. He is representing 14 farmers, including himself. He is married and the proud father of two children. Johnathan joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but he has been a farmer for four years.  Like many other farmers, Johnathan decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to have access to quality training and learn new farming methods. He hopes that, by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer he will get with this loan, he can join the ranks of the One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. He plans to use the profits he earns from this year’s harvest to buy more land to farm.  Johnathan's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 10.5 acres of land. One farmer in the group has also chosen to acquire a solar lamp as part of the loan package.

loans.use: to gain access to cost-effective hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Segundo Juvencio

texts.es: El señor Segundo nació en un lugar llamado Datanlí en el municipio de Jinotega, en el año de 1965. Comenta que fue poco tiempo que el estudio y mejor se dedico a trabajar en actividades de campo ayudándole al papa a trabajar,actualmente esta casado y tiene 4 hijos mes de edad,y  trabaja en agricultura, tiene sembrado café trabaja con sus hijos mayores. La madre de don Segundo vive cerca de donde él vive y de vez en cuando la va a visitar, pero en la comunidad que la madre vive no hay luz eléctrica es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un panel solar y este será instalado en la casa de la madre ya que quiere que la madre y el padre vivan con luz el quiere mucho a sus padres y quiere que por las madrugadas o por las noches solo enciendan la luz y alumbrarse, agradecería mucho si le dan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este panel solar.
texts.en: This gentleman, Segundo, was born in a place called Datanlí in the municipality of Jinotega, in 1965. He reports that he only went to school for a short time; he spent more time in agricultural work, helping his father. Currently he is married and has 4 children. He works in agriculture. He grows coffee with the help of his older children. Segundo's mother lives close to the place where he lives, and sometimes he goes to visit her. However, the community where his mother lives does not have electric light. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy a solar panel which will be installed at his mother's house. He wants his mother and his father to live with light. He loves his parents very much, and he wants them to be able to turn on the switch and have light in the early mornings and in the evenings. He would be very grateful if he is given the opportunity to receive this loan to buy this solar panel.

loans.use: to buy a solar power system.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo, de 39 años de edad, está acompañado y su esposa lo apoya en las labores de la casa y la agricultura, tiene 1 hija de un año de edad. 


Pablo, tiene mucha experiencia como agricultor, en todo se caracteriza por ser muy trabajador y últimamente se dedica  al transporte de carga con su camión, tiene mucha experiencia en su trabajo, ya que también es comerciante de ganado y cerdos, estas actividades comerciales las realiza desde hace mucho tiempo.


El préstamo será utilizado para comprar ganado para vender.

Pablo, desea seguir luchado para darles lo mejor que pueda a su esposa e hija
texts.en:
Pablo, 39 years old, is married, and his wife supports him in housework and agriculture. He has 1 daughter who is 1 year old.

Pablo has a lot of experience as a farmer. He is characterized by being very hard-working in everything, and recently he has made a living through the transportation of cargo with his truck. He has a lot of experience in his work since he is also a merchant of livestock and pigs. He has performed these commercial activities for a long time.

The loan will be used to purchase livestock to sell.

Pablo wishes to continue fighting to give the best that he can to his wife and daughter.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 53 years old. She is married to Simon and blessed with two children. She has had a maize business for 15 years.

Mary has asked for her third loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 100,000, which she will use to add stock of dried maize in order to expand her business and provide for her family. She successfully repaid her previous loans.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to educate her children by paying for their school fees. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to educate her children and see to it that they live prosperous lives.

loans.use: to add stock of dried maize in order to expand her business and provide for her family

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es: Fanny de 43 años de edad, se dedica al alquiler de apartamentos de su propiedad y vende mercancías variadas. Su hogar lo conforma con su cónyuge y su hijo de 20 años, con quien sueña ver convertido en un profesional de éxito y esto es el motor de su vida e impulsa su actuar productivo. Hace 4 años, cuando inició su negocio, tenía experiencia en arrendamiento de bienes raíces y esta actividad la llevó a pensar en crear en este mismo marco su propia alternativa generadora de ingresos, mientras simultáneamente se vinculara a empresas, como asesora comercial de sus productos,  mediante catálogos, o guías especializadas, para venderlos. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito y para ello trabaja de lunes a domingos, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, con el fin de atender toda la demanda que realizan los habitantes del sector donde habita, quienes son sus principales clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materiales constructivos, para adecuar sus tres apartamentos los cuales requieren mantenimiento en sus baños y cocinas. Su meta más adelante es comprar nuevos bienes y ampliar el surtido de sus mercancías, para lograr mayores ingresos que le permitan conseguir pagar  estudios  de calidad para su hijo y esto es justamente el gran sueño de Fanny.
texts.en:
Fanny, 43 years old, makes a living from renting apartments on her property, and she sells a variety of merchandise. Her household is made up of her husband and her 20-year-old son, whom she dreams of seeing become a successful professional, and this is the driving force of her life and drives her productive performance.

Four years ago, when she began her business, she had experience in renting real estate, and this activity got her thinking of creating in this same period her own alternative income generator, while she will simultaneously connects to businesses as a commercial consultant of their products, selling them through catalogs or specialized guides. She makes her sales on credit, and for this she works from Mondays to Sundays, from 8 in the morning until 6 in the evening, with the goal of attending to all of the demand that comes from the inhabitants of the sector where she lives, who are her main customers.

Currently, he is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that she is requesting from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will purchase construction materials to improve her three apartments, which require maintenance in their bathrooms and kitchens.

Her future goal is to purchase new real estate and increase the supply of her merchandise to make a higher income that will allow her to pay for a quality education for her son, and this is exactly Fanny’s greatest dream.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to improve her rental apartments.

loans.name: Bano

texts.en:
Bano is 30-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her three sons who are in school. For the past seven years, her husband has been running his own business selling clothes. Bano’s husband is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothing in bulk to resell, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to do so. 

Bano is requesting a Kiva loan from the field partner BRAC Pakistan to assist her husband to purchase bulking clothing. Her husband will also be able to increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of her loan. Bano is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for her husband's business

loans.name: Peninah.

texts.en:
Peninah is a 28-year-old hardworking and shrewd married woman with two children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. Since 2011, Peninah has been operating a general store and she also has a mobile money shop, rentals, and a salary for additional income. She is faced with the challenge of limited capital which affects her businesses. 

Peninah is requesting a loan to buy bricks, stones, and sand to construct her commercial house. Her loan will help her fulfill her dream.

loans.use: to buy bricks, stones, and sand to construct her commercial house

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 44 and is married with five children between the ages of three and 21. All of her children go to school. For the past 18 years, Vestine and her husband have been rice farmers. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

Vestine is requesting a loan to pay workers on her farm. She will use the profits from her loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay workers

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Joseph's Group is comprised of 13 farmers in Kakamega North District. The group is being represented by Joseph, who is pictured above. He is 44 years old and married with four children. Joseph has been a farmer for 20 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Joseph isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family since then. This year, Joseph will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this because now he will be able to reduce his family’s consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Joseph's Group will purchase a total of 13 solar lights and use farming inputs received to plant a total of 4.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, hybrid seeds, and fertilizer to improve maize harvests

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 40 years old woman, and she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her five children. Her husband has been working in public sector organization for many years, he is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Nazia is also providing sewing services and earn the income to contribute with her husband to manage the house hold. 

She needs different kinds of goods like needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil and other materials for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above accessories and also be helpful for her in increasing monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Nazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase materials to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 29-year-old married father of one child. Three years ago he started selling lingerie and linens to cover the needs and expenses of his family.
Khaled is an ambitious man who has a good reputation among his customers. 

He is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to develop his business and increase his business merchandise with a new collection of lingerie and linens to satisfy his customers' needs in the upcoming spring season.

Khaled hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with new collection of lingerie and linens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy machinery for his carpentry shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is a 63-year-old single woman from Senaki district. She lives alone and earns a living with only an age pension that she gets from the local government. It's hardly enough for Leila to meet all basic needs and daily expenses.

Leila has requested a Credo loan for the start-up of a trading business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's poor people, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

Leila will use the requested loan amount 1,000 GEL for purchasing stock of clothing in the capital of Georgia, where the country's worldwide market is located, and will sell in her region with price mark-ups.

This will give her a chance to earn income and become financially independent. Thanks to the Start-Up Program, she will be able to make savings and provide a better future for herself. Leila awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: to start a trading business with clothing.

loans.name: Elieth De La Concepcion

texts.es:
A sus 35 años de edad Elieth ha logrado salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha conseguido abastecer su pulpería con mayor inventario de nuevos productos; lo cual le ha ayudado para cubrir la creciente demanda de sus clientes. 

En esta ocasión, solicita un crédito para ampliar su negocio, con la compra de vitrinas y estanterías, que le permitirán ofrecer más productos. En consiguiente, Elieth tendrá más ingresos para ayudar a la economía de su hogar, y poco a poco podrá seguir evolucionando hasta convertirse en una miscelánea.
texts.en:
At 35 years old, Elieth has managed to get ahead. With a lot of effort and dedication, she has managed to stock her grocery store with a large inventory of new products, which has helped her to meet the growing demand of her clients. 
This time, she is asking for a loan to expand her business, with the purchase of display cabinets and shelves, which will allow her to offer more products. Therefore, Elieth will have more income to help the economy of her home, and little by little she will be able to keep growing until it becomes a general store.

loans.use: to expand her business, with the purchase of display cabinets and shelves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Guram lives in Mestia, in the Caucasus mountain region of Svaneti. He makes a living mainly from potato cultivation. The fields in the mountains are too steep and too small to use machines, so the men do most of the work by hand. Guram had the idea to plow and remove pest plants with the help of a horse. Even though his current horse and the equipment are old, the results are very encouraging.

With the help of the loan, Guram will buy a younger horse, a new horse harness, and a better plough. He will be able to practice sharecropping, too. This means he will cultivate other people's fields, and pay the landowners with a share of the harvest. For this activity Guram will buy seed potatoes.

loans.use: to buy a horse, a plough, and seed potatoes

loans.name: Otende's Group

texts.en:
Otende, featured in the above picture, is representing her farming group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She is 26 years old and a married mother of 6 children, often described as a very friendly person. 

Although Otende has been a farmer for 15 years, she is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because she really wanted to earn enough to send her children to school. Even though she is new to the program, Otende wanted to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Otende hopes to be able to send her children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 8 solar lights, as, even though Otende decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Gurban

texts.en:
Gurban is married and has three children. He lives in the Baku region. He is a master and a plumber. 

Gurban requested his second loan for 1,300 AZN, which he will use to buy new materials, such as pipes, connectors, tools for pipes, etc. He wants to increase his business.

loans.use: to purchase new materials, such as pipes, connectors, tools for pipes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase 50 pounds of cheese.

loans.name: Enalba

texts.es: Enalba de 47 años de edad,  tiene su propio restaurante desde hace 5 años, cuando después de ser empleada de una panadería, decidió generar ingresos con un negocio propio, dirigido a la preparación de comidas. Ella vende refrescos y prepara almuerzos que comercializa en el sector donde habita, produciéndolos desde su local y también ofrece el servicio de domicilios. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito, trabajando desde los lunes hasta los sábados, de 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, comprando de contado en graneros,  para obtener precios ajustado a la realizad de su mercado. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos alimentarios al por mayor, como víveres, cereales, verduras, cárnicos etc. Con esta inversión sus inventarios aumentan y también su productividad, lo que le permitirá lograr unas mayores ganancias y esto es justamente el éxito de su crédito mediante Kiva.
texts.en:
Enalba, at 47 years of age, has had her own restaurant for 5 years. After being a bakery employee she decided to generate her own income with her own business, dedicated to preparing food. She sells refreshments and prepares lunches that she sells in the area where she lives. She produces them from her home, where she also offers a place to stay. 

She makes her sales in both cash and credit, working from Monday to Saturday, from 8 in the morning until 5 in the evening. She buys her materials in cash from granaries in order to get prices adjusted to the market demand. She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, by way of which she will purchase food inputs in bulk such as grains, vegetables and meat. 

With this investment her inventory will increase, as will her productivity, which will allow her to achieve greater earnings. This is precisely the success of her loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy food materials in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a large water pump

loans.name: Edinson

texts.es: Édison de 44 años de edad, habita en el suroccidente de la ciudad,  con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 12 a 17 años. Él genera ingresos y sostiene su hogar desde su propio taller de confecciones, donde también fabrica manualidades en icopor., actividades que venía desarrollando desde que cumplió 15 años, en su natal municipio desde donde llegó a Barranquilla, la capital del departamento del Atlántico. Inicialmente comenzó trabajando el oficio de albañilería y su capacidad artística le permitió aprender a elaborar trabajos en icopor, como adornos para fiestas, publicidad etc, además de las tareas propias de la confección de ropa femenina, operación con la cual genera otros ingresos de manera simultánea. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito, de lunes a domingos, desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde comprando de contado en el centro dela ciudad de Barranquilla, donde hay proveedores que le ofrecen precios competitivos, para que compre los insumos con los cuales trabaja. Su meta más adelante es hacer mejoramiento a su local y también optimizar sus condiciones habitacionales. En la actualidad necesita mejorar el surtido y aumentar sus ventas, y por eso ha acudido a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas, icopor, y pinturas, además de telas hilos, etc, con el fin de incrementar su productividad y poder responder a su mercado, haciendo de su credikiva una exitosa inversión.
texts.en:
Édison is 44 years old and he lives in the southwest part of the city along with his partner and his three children, who range from 12 to 17 years old. He makes a living by running his own workshop where he makes crafts from a Styrofoam base. He has been making his crafts since he was 15 years old in his home town of Barranquilla.

He began working as a brick layer, but his artistic abilities allowed him to learn other skills, specifically how to work with Styrofoam, to make decorations for parties, advertisements etc. He also makes women's clothing, which also helps him supplement his income.

He sells much of his work on credit, every day from Sunday to Saturday from 7am to 6pm. He purchases supplies in cash in the center of the city where there are vendors of the materials he needs that they sell to him at reasonable prices.

His goal for the future is to improve his stand and to optimize his living conditions. He currently needs to purchase supplies with the end goal of increasing sales, so he is applying for a loan with Kiva. It is his first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the loan to purchase supplies like Styrofoam, paints and fabric and thread so he can increase production and respond to market demand, making the Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: purchase prime materials like primers, paints, Styrofoam, fabric and thread.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 28-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband owns a printing shop. He is the guardian of the family and responsible to fulfill the needs of all family members.

Maria has been running her own beauty salon for the past five years. She also contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics such as creams, hairbrushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints, she is not capable to buy these items for her business purpose. Therefore, Maria has applied for a Kiva loan.

This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also be helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance, Maria is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her beauty parlor business.

loans.name: Carmen Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Carmen, está integrado por 3 mujeres (Ermelinda, Rosibel y Yordina), viven en Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. Las tres se han propuesto luchar para hacer crecer sus pequeños de negocios de pulperia, con el deseo de llegar a tener una mejor calidad de vida personal y de sus familias; se organizaron hace 8 meses para poder acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana.

Con el primer crédito otorgado por Pana Pana y financiado por KIVA, le permitió a Edelmira coordinadora del grupo solidario comprar inventario para su pequeña pulpería y elaborar repostería artesanal.

Yordina: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una mujer trabajadora, casada con 6 hijos: La mayor de 24 años estudia técnico en secretaria, el de 22 años estudia técnico en construcción, tres adolescentes que estudian su secundaria y una pequeña de 5 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja como cocinero en las embarcaciones. Desde hace 3 años estableció su pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su casa de tambo de madera, de esta manera contribuye con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos. Solicita financiamiento para comprar: Chiverías, granos básicos entre otros productos. Ella sueña con comprar una máquina de coser, para confeccionar ropa.
texts.en:
The group Carmen is made up of 3 members (Ermelinda, Rosibel and Yordina), who live in Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. The three have been helping each other to grow their small grocery stores. They hope to one day have a better quality of life thanks to their efforts. They formed their cooperative 8 months ago in order to gain access to the loans provided by Pana Pana.

With their first loan through Pana Pana, and financed by Kiva, Ermelinda, the coordinator of the group, to purchase inventory for her grocery store and to make baked goods.

This loan goes to Yordina. She is a member of the group and is a hard working woman. She is married and has 6 children. The oldest is 24 years old and is studying to be a secretary. Her 22 year old is studying construction and three of her adolescent children go to secondary school while the youngest is only 5 years old. Her husband works as a cook on boats. She began her business 3 years ago, a small grocery store run out of her wood framed home. Her business allows her to supplement the costs of household needs and her children's education. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase yogurts, basic grains and other inventory. She dreams of purchasing a sewing machine so she can make clothing.

loans.use: purchase para comprar: yogurts and basic grains

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фирузе 34 лет. Она жительница города Конибодом. У нее не большая семья. Мама, муж и дети. Они живут вместе. Муж находится за границей. Мама дома ухаживает за детьми. Фируза более 1 год работает в салоне красоты. Она делает различные причёски, занимается окрашиванием волос и много разных услуг. У нее есть свои клиенты. Ей нравиться зарабатывать каждый день. Фируза решила улучшить процесс работы. Она собирается купить новые инструменты для работы, в том числе расчески, средства для укладки волос и разное другое. Для приобретения всех принадлежностей и инструментов она обратилась за кредитом. Фируза верит и надеется на поддержку с Вашей стороны.
texts.en: Firuza is 34 and lives in the city of Konibodom. She has a large family: mother, husband and children. They live together. Her husband lives abroad and she takes care of the children. Firuza has been working in a beauty salon for over a year. She does a variety of hairstyles, hair coloring and many other services. She has her own clients and likes to earn every day. Firuza decided to improve her work process. She is ready to buy new tools for the job, including combs, hair styling products and various other things. She applied for a loan to purchase these accessories and tools. Firuza trusts in and relies on your support.

loans.use: to buy combs and other tools for hairstyling

loans.name: Beknazar

texts.en:
Beknazar is an active man. He was born in 1970. He is living in a remote district in the southern part of the country. He is married. He has six children. His wife helps him in his business. 

Beknazar is an agrarian person. He is busy with buying and selling cattle. He buys cattle from rural areas and feeds them. Than he sells cattle in a domestic animal market. With the profits, Beknazar feeds his family and pays for family expenditures. 

He wants to buy cattle for the enlargement of his business. He requested a 5,000 TJS loan for buying cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a small-holder farmer based in the Kitale region of Kenya. Being a mother of 6 children, Mildred decided 20 years ago to get into farming to help her husband, John, provide for the family. Today, she runs their 5 acre farm where she makes a killing selling milk and eggs.

In order to grow the business and expand their product offering, Mildred is seeking a KES 65,000 loan investment from Kiva lenders to purchase a high-yielding dairy cow, 3 sheep and 10 hens. From this investment she expects to greatly increase her milk and eggs supply. Over a small period of time, Mildred also expects to start reaping big time from sheep farming. This will give her an opportunity to reach more markets and sell more products and improve her family's livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow, 3 sheep and  10 hens

loans.name: Sreyrath

texts.en:
Sreyrath is a 27-year-old married woman living in Ponhea Leu district of Kandal province. She does not have any children yet. Her husband and she are working at a factory as an admin manager and an accounting assistant. They have been working there for four years now.

This is her third loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is seeking a loan in order to pursue higher education in business administration. She hopes to have a better job in the future with a higher degree.

loans.use: to pursue higher education in business administration.

loans.name: Noeun's Group

texts.en:
40-year-old Noeun is married with four children. Three of her children are still living with her in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. 

To make a living, Noeun has been planting cassava for 22 years. She is also a rice farmer. 

Noeun is leading her group, which consists of two members. This is her first cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is requesting a 1,400,000 KHR loan to buy cassava stems and to hire workers to plough her field. 

She hopes that she can expand her cassava business.

loans.use: to buy cassava stems and to hire workers to plough her field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Noureen

texts.en: Noureen is 29 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three children. Her husband has worked in the public sector for many years, and he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Noureen provides sewing services to contribute to the household income. She needs supplies such as needles, thread, cloth, machine oil, etc for her business, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these supplies. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the supplies, which will help her to increase monthly sales and profit. Noureen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her tailoring business

loans.name: Shahida Perveen

texts.en:
Shahida Perveen is a 42 year old woman, and the mother of 3 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband runs a food stall, selling different types of edible items e.g samosa, vegetable rolls, chicken tikka, Kabab paratha, etc. He is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Shahida Perveen's husband needs to purchase different types of edible and other items for his business purposes so that he can increase the size of the business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. Due to his unfavorable financial position her husband is not in a position to purchase these items for his business purposes.

Shahida Perveen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase these items for business purposes.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy supplies to increase her husband's food stall business.

loans.name: Talat Bibi

texts.en:
Talat bibi is a 45 year old woman, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her 4 children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Talat bibi also provides sewing services and earns an income to contribute to managing the household with her husband.

She needs different kinds of goods e.g needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories. It will also enable her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Talat bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase purchase sewing supplies to improve her tailoring business.

loans.name: Los Hijos De Qolquewasi Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS HIJOS DE QOLQUEWASI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marisol ella es soltera y tiene 37 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maiz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,la socia es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora y por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a su hijo, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.
Los que estan pegados a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “LOS HIJOS DE QOLQUEWASI” communal bank which is located in the district of Cusco, Cusco province, in the department of Cusco.

Marisol is 37 years old. single and has one son. She works in her business selling grains. She sells wheat, corn and quinoa. She works from 8 am until 5 pm. She has been in this business for 5 years and things are going well for her as she is a hard-working woman and a fighter. Through her work she brings up her son. Her dream is to have a place to sell her cereals. Marisol is requesting a loan to buy wheat, corn and quinoa.

The members in the inserted photo had their picture taken after the meeting as they were absent due to work commitments. The other members work in selling cereals, a clothing business, a grocery store, and a restaurant. The members thank those who form part of this dream through this loan and promise to pay their installments within the established time.

loans.use: to buy wheat, corn and quinoa.

loans.name: Zamzam Group

texts.en:
Anissa is the featured borrower of Zamzam group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends. They work hard to develop their businesses and families' living standards.

Anissa is a 54-year-old married mother of five children who has been working as a tailor for 21 years from her house. She has proved to be a highly talented person.

Anissa's acquired loan will be invested in buying newly released spring and summer textiles for her new designs. She is very anxious about this loan and is working hard to develop her business and open her atelier in the future.

She is the lady standing second from the right side of the picture. As for the other group members, Sanaa is the first from the left, Darine is the second from the left, while Ghinwa is the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy newly released spring and summer textiles for her new designs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes for selling.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 33 years old. He is married to Lucy and they support six people in their family. He has had a butchery business for the last 14 years earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

He has requested his 6th loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 94,158 which he will use to buy a motorcycle to transport meat to/from the butchery as well as offer transport services to clients.

With the anticipated profits, he will be able to repay his loan as well as pay school fees for his children. His hopes and dreams for the future are to better the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to transport meat to/from the butchery as well as offer transport services to clients.

loans.name: Jean Marie

texts.en:
Jean Marie is 32 years old. He is married with 4 children aged between 1 and 6; one of them goes to school. He is a farmer and he has been producing rice for 14 years. His wife is also a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay his workers. The profits from the business will be used to pay more workers.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay his workers.

loans.name: Sokkhoeun

texts.en:
Sokkhoeun is 43 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom attend school. She is a resident of Kratie province. She has been a farmer for 24 years. To earn extra, Sokkhoeun opened a small grocery store at home. 

Sokkhoeun requested her first loan from VisionFund, which she will use to buy a solar panel. She believes it will help cut down on her spending for batteries.

loans.use: to purchase a solar panel

loans.name: Lath

texts.en:
Lath is 41 and married with four children. She is a villager of the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. Three of Lath’s children are living with her and two of them are still in school. For the past 21 years, she has been a rice farmer and she also raises pigs to sell. Lath earns around 6.5 USD each day.

Lath is requesting a 3,000,000 KHR loan to build a house. This will be her first loan with the Kiva partner VisionFund. Lath hopes her family’s life will be easier with a better house.

loans.use: to build a house

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Kimsrean's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province, Kimsrean is a 45 year old divorcee with five children. Four of her children are still living under her roof. For 25 years, her main source of income is from her rice farm. She also earn extra by raising pigs.

Kimsrean has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund twice, including this loan. She is currently leading her group and is applying for aloan of 800,000 KHR to buy pigs and pig feed as well as fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that she can earn more money to support her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Chanthoeun

texts.en:
Chanthoeun, 49 years of age and married, is living in a rural village of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She has three children who are her dependents.

Her main sources of income are from rice farming and a banana plantation. She has been doing this for 31 years. Her secondary source of income is from her children being construction workers. They manage to save around 4 USD a day.

This is her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She plans to buy fertilizer and hire a tractor to plough her field. She wishes that her rice farm and banana plantation will be productive.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and hire a tractor to plough her field.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Tin

texts.en:
42-year-old Tin is married with seven children. They are living in a remote village of Kratie province. 

To finance the family budget, Tin has been a rice farmer. This is Tin's first loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She plans to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her rice farm. She hopes that her rice plantation will be productive so that she can improve their living standard. 

*Note: the man in the photo is her husband.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Saeeda Yasmeen

texts.en:
Saeeda Yasmeen, age 52, is a mother of two children. Her husband owns a jewelry shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. Saeeda Yasmeen’s husband needs to purchase new varieties of jewelry designs to sell. However, due to lack of money, he finds this difficult. 

Saeeda Yasmeen is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase jewelry and designs for her husband’s shop. Her loan will help her husband to offer more variety to his customers and continue his work efficiently and professionally. Saeeda Yasmeen feels happy that her loan will be able to help her husband. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry and designs for her husband’s shop

loans.name: Then

texts.en:
Then is an elderly villager of Dambae district, Kampong Cham province. Her husband passed away leaving her with five children that are her dependents. Two of the children are attending secondary school.

For 33 years, Then has been growing cassava to support the family. She is also a rice farmer. She is able to save around 7 USD per day. Then has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for 4 cycles now. She is seeking a 4,000,000 KHR loan to buy a rice mill and fertilizer as well as to hire workers to plough the field and harvest the rice yield.

She hopes for her rice farm to be more productive so that she can earn more money.

loans.use: to buy a rice mill and fertilizer as well as to hire workers to plough the field and harvest rice.

loans.name: Deodata

texts.en:
Deodata, who is in her early 30s, is single with two kids who are still in school. She has been selling fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices for five years now. She works from 6am to 11pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Deodata's 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her genge business (grocery stall) and has paid back her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan. She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy the fast moving fuits and vegetables and sell at wholesale price. She dreams of being an international business woman.

Deodata, will make sure she repays her loan within the loan scheduled time.

loans.use: to buy the fast moving fruits and vegetables and sell at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a married 26-year-old Kenyan lady with two children. With nine years of experience in mixed farming, she runs a 1-acre farm where she conducts dairy, poultry, and crop farming. Currently, she owns one dairy cow named Maua (Swahili for "flower"), three heads of poultry, and a tomato farm. Tomato farming is a lucrative business, and it is her main income source. 

Loice's family has a bright future, which seems to be dependent on the success of her tomato farm. To safeguard quality production, Loice is seeking a loan to pay for modern farm implements that are well-designed, versatile, durable, and more effective compared to traditional tools. Loice is confident that replacing outdated tools with modern ones will also play a role in increasing tomato yields. Having an increase in tomato yield at the end of the season will enable her to meet growing demand in the market.

loans.use: to buy farm implements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chairs for her customers.

loans.name: Wilmer Nahum

texts.es:
Wilmer, de 28 años de edad, está casado y su esposa se dedica unicamente a los oficios domésticos, vive unicamente con su esposa y su único hijo.

Wilmer, es seguridad en una empresa, sus días laborales son 3 semanalmente y 2 de descanso, tambien, se dedica a la venta de pan en sus días libres.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar una motocicleta para salir a vender el pan y así facilitar la venta y aprovechar más su tiempo.

Sus sueños es satisfacer las necesidades de su pequeña familia y trabajar muy duro, para poner su propio negocio de panadería.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 28 years old, is married and his wife works solely doing housework. He lives with his wife and only son. Wilmer works as security in a company. He works 3 times a week and has two days of rest.

He also works selling bread on his free days. He needs the loan to buy a motorcycle to go out and sell bread to make his sales easier and to take better advantage of his time. His dream is to satisfy the needs of his small family and work very hard to be able to open his own bakery business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to go out to sell bread.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao is a 34-year-old married woman with four children. Three of her children are in primary school and the youngest one is still under the age of six. Mao lives in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. For 16 years, she has been growing cassava to support her family. 

Mao is requesting a loan with the Kiva partner VisionFund to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to hire workers on the plantation to help with the harvest. This will be her second loan with VisionFund. Mao wishes to buy another piece of land to plant cassava in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to hire plantation workers to help with the harvest

loans.name: Eilena

texts.en:
Eilena is 30 years old. She is married with six children aged between 13 and 32 years. Four of them go to school. 

She is a farmer and she has been producing rice for 30 years. Her husband is also a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay her workers. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of her children and to improve her savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay her workers.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 45 years old. She married with 7 children aged between 3 and 26; they all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been producing rice for 22 years, while her husband is a businessman. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay labourers. The profits from the business will be used to pay for her children's school fees.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labourers for her rice farm.

loans.name: Shabnam

texts.en:
Shabnam is a 43 year old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 2 children. Her husband is a retired civil servant and her elder son is running his own business by providing medicine sales and supply services.

Shabnam's son wants to purchase different types of medicines for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means he is not in a position to buy these medicines for his business. Therefore Shabnam has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will help her son to purchase these medicines and enable him to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn a profitable income. He also plans to make savings with the income from his business to meet uncertain events in future.

Shabnam is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy medicines and supplies to increase her son's pharmaceutical business.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is 38 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband owns a printing shop. He is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all the family members. Noreen has been running her own beauty salon for the past 5 years. She also contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics i.e creams, hairbrushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon. Due to financial constraints she is not capable of buying these items for her business. Therefore Noreen has applied for a Kiva loan.

This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also helpful for her to earn the maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.
Noreen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy supplies to increase her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en:
Shahin is a 29 year old refugee. He is divorced and has a daughter and two sons. He lives with his children and parents in Bilasuvar IDP settlement and takes care of his family. His father helps with earnings, working as a bus driver but their main income comes from husbandry. Shahin keeps sheep. He raises them, fattens them and then sells the meat to local cafes, restaurants and bazaars. He also sells wool at the local bazaar too. His mother makes gloves, blankets and jackets from wool and also sells them.

Shahin's income is 207 AZN monthly but this amount doesn't cover the family's needs. His children are small and they need education in the future. Shahin wants to expand his business and provide his children with a good education and a happy life. He applied for an 800 AZN loan in order to make payment for his children's kindergarten.

loans.use: to payment for his children's kindergarten.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 43 years old. She is married and has three children between the ages of 5 and 12. They all go to school. She is a farmer, and she has been producing rice for 19 years. Her husband is a business man. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers.

loans.name: Herena

texts.en:
Helena is a 44-year-old married mother of seven children ages 4 to 21 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and he has been producing rice for 25 years. Her husband is a businessman. With the loan from Kiva, she would pay her workers. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers for her rice farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seed for crops and fertilizer

loans.name: Jean D'amour

texts.en:
Jean D`amour is a 35-year-old married father of three children, ages 1 month to 6 years; one in school. He is a farmer and he has been producing rice for 23 years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would pay his laborers. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay his laborers.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 40-year-old mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a restaurant selling different types of food such as beef and chicken karahi. He is the sole supporter of his entire family and manages the household.
Nasreen's husband needs to purchase different types of food items for his restaurant so that he can increase the size of business and improve sales to earn maximum profit. Due to his unfavorable financial position, Nasreen's husband is not able to purchase these items so Nasreen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. A loan would help her husband purchase the items for his business. 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's restaurant business

loans.name: Benjamin's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Benjamin, often described as an extremely friendly person. He is 28 years old and is representing his group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.  He is married and has two children.

Benjamin is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Benjamin says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he joined in 2014, he has been able to save more money, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Benjamin will use the profits from this season to send his children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seed and fertilizer to plant a total of 5.5 acres. Some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, receiving a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Yeun

texts.en:
49-year-old Yeun is married and has three children, two of whom are her dependents. She is living in a rural village of Kratie province. 

Her main source of income is from raising pigs to sell. It is a business that she has been doing for 5 years. Her secondary sources of income are from growing sesame and being a paid worker. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is seeking a loan to buy a solar panel for her house. 

She hopes that there will not be any disruption of the electricity flow and that she does not have to waste time and money on battery.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel

loans.name: Gulsoro

texts.ru: Это Гулсоро. Ей 35 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое сыновей. Муж работает мастером по ремонту домов. Она вместе со своей семьей проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Они живут скромно. Гулсоро занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она начала заниматься шитьем 7 лет назад.  Ее второй сын родился инвалидом, а другие сыновья заразились гриппом. У них постельный режим. Гулсоро старается, чтоб дети по скорее выздоровели. Ей сейчас очень нелегко ей надо покупать дорогие лекарства, но у нее нет достаточно средств, и она решилась обратиться за кредитом.  Ей некому обратиться. Он надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: This is Gulsoro. She is 35 years old, married and has three sons. Her husband works as a residential repairman. She lives with her family in the town of Qurgan-Tube. They live modestly. Gulsoro is involved in sewing women's clothing. She became involved in sewing 7 years ago. Her second son was born with a disability, and the other two contracted a flu. They are on bed rest. Gulsoro tries to make sure that her children recover soon. It is very difficult for her now because she has to purchase expensive medications, but does not have enough money, so she decided to request a loan. She has no one to turn to. She relies on Your support.

loans.use: to purchase medications for her children

loans.name: Mehrubon

texts.en:
Mehrubon is 46 years old, widowed, and has two children. She lives in remote district. Mehrubon is responsible, honest and kind person. She tries to be helpful and useful to her family. 

Mehrubon is an entrepreneur. She has a place of work in the center of a domestic market. She attracts a lot of satisfied clients. She sells cookies, sweets, and candies. Mehrubon is planning to enlarge the assortment of her sweets and requested a loan, which she will use to buy candies and chocolates for her store.

loans.use: to purchase candies and chocolates

loans.name: Palmis Eneji S.a

texts.en: Watch this loan's video profile In Haiti, 93% of households depend on charcoal for cooking and 75% have no access to grid electricity. PALMIS Enèji is a social business initiated by French NGO Entrepreneurs du Monde. It provides vulnerable households suffering from energy poverty with clean, modern and affordable cooking and lighing solutions. PE's range of solar lights, solar home systems and clean cookstoves have been designed to maximize health, economic and social impacts for users: less noxious emissions inhalated by women and their children while cooking, less money spent on charcoal and kerosene, less trees cut to produce charcoal, brighter and more comfortable homes. More than 12,000 households have already benefited from these products since 2013. PALMIS Enèji partners with local microentrepreneurs such as Marie-Waseline (picture) in order to distribute its products in the poorest communities of Haiti. Its network of franchised entrepreneurs brings together more than 50 resellers who generate an extra income from the sale of solar lights and improved cookstoves. In order to scale-up its activities and support more entrepreneurs such as Marie-Waseline, PALMIS Enèji is seeking 49,950 USD in working capital, which will be used to import and stock clean energy products to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to import and stock clean energy products such as solar lights or improved cookstoves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bags of water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to boost the milk supply to her customers, as well as to increase her income in her farming activities.

loans.name: Ado Group

texts.en:
Ado Group is composed of three members as seen above: left to right, Zahiya, Mona and Houeida. They have always been neighbors and friends, and they work hard developing their businesses and families’ living standards. The three have come together to obtain a 2,100 USD loan through Al Majmoua to be divided among themselves.

Zahiya is the featured borrower of Ado group. She is a 47-year-old widowed mother of three children, who has run a bakery to cover her family's living and educational needs ever since her beloved husband passed away three years ago. She is a hardworking woman who has put much effort into developing her business and increasing her income.

Zahiya will use her loan portion to perform necessary maintenance on her bakery and pizza parlor to keep it in good condition and so continue attracting new customers.

loans.use: to perform necessary maintenance on her bakery and pizza parlor

loans.name: Rawaa Group

texts.en:
Rania is 41 years old, married, and has two children. She is employed in a shop where she sells towels, which she has been doing for three years.

Rania is the featured borrower of the Rawaa group. She and the two other group members have always been neighbors and friends and they work hard on developing their living. The group requested a loan from Al Majmoua. Rania will use her loan to start her own business selling towels. She is a hard working woman who puts so much effort on developing and improving her family's living. With the earned income, she will be able to support her husband n covering their increasing living needs.

Rania is on the right in the photo; Layla is at the center; and Rawaa is on the left.

loans.use: to start her own business selling towels

loans.name: Ural

texts.en:
Ural is a businessman. He was born in 1955. He is living in a remote district. He is married and has two children. 

Ural is an experienced and challenged person. For almost ten years he has been keeping and trading horned cattle. He buys and sells animals at animal markets. Now he is keeping small-horned cattle. He is planning to keep big-horned cattle for the further benefit of his business. 

He is asking for financial support from Kiva to widen his business. Ural hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: To buy horned cattle.

loans.name: Wellars

texts.en:
Wellars is 33 years old. He is married, with four children between the ages of 1 and 7 years. They all go to school. He is a farmer, and he has been producing rice for 14 years, while his wife is a businesswoman. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land for farming.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers.

loans.name: Mayramoi

texts.en:
Mayramoi is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1967. She is living in a small town. She is married. Her husband is an emigrant. She has two children. 

Mayramoi is a teacher. She is well known among teachers and friends. She has thirteen years' experience working with students. Besides, teaching at school she wants to have her own additional income for improving her standard of living. 

She is planning to buy horned cattle and feed and sell them in the domestic market. Mayramoi requested 4,000 TJS loan to start up her business. 

She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy horned cattle

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a salary earner living in Kasese, Uganda. He has a responsibility of looking after his four children. He gets additional income from a general store shop. 

He has a dream of buying land and settling his family, but is faced with the challenge of a long distance to reach his work place. 

Nelson is requesting money to buy land and meet his dream of settling his family.

loans.use: to buy land and meet his dream of settling his family.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is 42 years old and is a married woman. 

The man shown in the photo is Khalida’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Khalida has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires with some tools for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

Khalida is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires with some tools for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen has successfully built her business of a lace selling shop in her area with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. Her husband is also shown in the photo. By this time, she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her 4th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more material such as ribbons, lace, and thread. This will enable her to increase her sales to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more material such as ribbons, lace, and thread.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 24-year-old single Palestinian refugee who has been working as a house painter since 2010, and is trying to improve his living as much as he can.

Ibrahim is building his own home, but unfortunately his income isn't enough to cover his extra requested needs; this reason he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy his necessary house rooftop needs to finish building his own future house.

He hopes that one day he can move both his business and house outside the refugee camp and spread his services wider.

loans.use: To buy his necessary house rooftop needs for his house

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: Саида 27 летняя жительница района Бохтар. Она в районе проживает вместе мамой и двумя детьми. Муж находится за границе. Саида дома занимается шитьем женской одежды на заказ. По ее словам ей удобно шить на дому, так как она дополнительно может делать работу по домашнему хозяйству и присматривать за детьми.  Саида уже 6 лет занимается шитьем. В швейном деле ей нравится ежедневный доход.  Ей в работе помогает мама. Она берет кредит, для покупки новой вышивальной машинки и машинки оверлок, чтобы увеличить ежедневный доход и приобрести много клиентов.
texts.en: Saida is a 27-year-old resident of the Bohtar district. She lives in this district with her mother and two children. Her husband is abroad. Saida is involved in sewing women's clothing to-order at home. According to her, it is convenient to sew at home because she can additionally do house work and look after the children.
