Saida has been involved in sewing for 6 years. She likes the daily income from her sewing business. Her mother helps her with the work. Saida is requesting a loan to purchase a new embroidery machine and overlock machine in order to increase her daily income and attract more clients.

loans.use: to purchase new embroidery and overlock machines

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en:
Yusif is a 55-year-old farmer. He is married and has three beautiful daughters. His wife stays home and takes care of the family.

Despite the hard work it takes, Yusif loves being a farmer. He gets up early in the morning to tend to his crops, then takes some to sell at the local bazaar. He also gets additional money from selling his chickens there.

Yusif’s monthly income is approximately 175 AZN, but this amount doesn't cover all of his family's needs. He has many customers, but for the last half year his crops’ productivity has fallen because of the lack of water available in his district. He has now applied for a 1,200 AZN loan through Aqroinvest and will use this to sign a contract to install an irrigation system for his crops.

loans.use: to install an irrigation system for his crops.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a generous woman. She was born in 1955. She lives in a remote district. She is from the southern part of the country. She is married. She has four children. 

Halima is busy with planting agricultural products and keeping livestock. For the further benefit of her business, she is planning to increase her activity. She likes her work. 

She needs to renovate her apartment. She is asking for 5,000 TJS loan to renovate her apartment and make a better standard of living. 

She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to renovate her apartment

loans.name: Jesenia Maribel

texts.es:
En la pila de Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía elaboradas por sus habitantes.
En este lugar vive la señora Jesenia, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 22, 21, 13 y 12 años de edad, las dos menores estudian en colegio. Su esposo es empleado privado.
Doña Jesenia para poder valerse por sí misma y con esto ayudar con  los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, ella compra y vende  artesanía hechas en tagua y barro, tiene un local en el cual vende sus artesanías que compra en Portoviejo o en Los Bajos de Montecristi ya que allá realizan muy buenos trabajos, ella también además de vender en su local envía estos productos a los Estados Unidos lugar donde desde hace muchos años vive su papá que es el encargado de recibir y distribuir estos objetos los cuales se venden a muy buen precio. Lleva 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo y contribuye al bienestar de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar artesanía de todas las formas y modelos para exportar y vender al público. Lleva 10 años en el  Grupo de Crédito  y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the Para el Futuro de la Mujer communal bank meets in La Pila de Montecristi. It is a place well known for its rich traditional culture, where one can find a large variety of crafts made by its residents.

Jesenia, who is 38 years old, lives here. She is married and has four children from this relationship, ages 12, 13, 21 and 22. The two youngest attend high school and her husband is employed in the private sector.

In order to be self-sufficient and to help with the household expenses, Jesenia works in trade. She buys and sells crafts made out of tagua nut and clay. She has a store where she sells the crafts she buys in Portoviejo or in Los Bajos de Montecristi, since they do a very nice job there. In addition to selling in her area, she also sends these products to the United States where her father has lived for many years. Her father is in charge of receiving and distributing the products which are sold for a very good price. For six years she has been doing this work, where she earns her share and she contributes to the well-being of the family.

This loan is to buy crafts of all shapes and sizes to export and sell to the public. She has been with the communal bank for ten years and she likes it, because she started her business with one of the loans. Her dream is to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy crafts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheet metal, wood, and iron to replace his roof.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow for milk production, and also to expand her small retail shop business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy replacement parts for air conditioners

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is a 30-year-old hardworking married man with four children, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been in agriculture for the last thirteen years and he sells cassava flour, groundnuts, beans, millet, and many other items in order to increase his family income. 

He has a dream of expanding his business which will enable him become a great businessman: owning a food store in town, which can continuously supply his customers all year round, despite bad debtors. 

Timothy is requesting money to buy beans, cassava flour, and rice for selling.

loans.use: to buy beans, cassava flour, and rice for selling.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is a 49-year-old married woman. She lives in Tianeti with her husband and daughter. She earns a small monthly income as a teacher at the local school. Her husband works as a driver.

Maia has decided to build a dairy in order to increase her family’s income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, will enable her to get a loan of 6000 GEL. With that she will build a shed, buy cows and start producing dairy products to add to the family’s income.

Start Up is a sound program for families like Maia’s. With an eye to the future she awaits your support.

loans.use: to build a cow shed and buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a hardworking married man who lives in Kasese, Uganda with his ten children, six of whom attend school. Jackson has been selling coffee for seven years and this is how he has managed to get money to pay his children's school fees. He is also a farmer, who grows mainly coffee and cotton. He is requesting this loan to buy more coffee to sell,and  is looking forward to selling finished, processed coffee so that he can increase his income.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: José Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio, de 56 años de edad, es agricultor, estudio hasta segundo grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 2 hijos, en su casa solo vive un hijo y su nuera, su hijo trabaja en el cuartel militar.

Lucio, toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, fue herencia de sus padres hacer esta practica, así como también cultiva café.

El préstamo lo necesita para el fortalecimiento de la plantación de café, ya que en el tiempo actual es necesario combatir plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos.

Su sueño como agricultor es, poder tener la plantación bien cuidada, para obtener una buena producción, para poder procesar el café y venderlo para generar ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Lucio is a 56-year-old farmer. He has a second grade education. He is married and his wife is a homemaker. They have two children, but only one of them lives at home with them along with their daughter-in-law. His son works at the military station.

Lucio has been a farmer his whole life. He learned the trade from his parents and he grows coffee. He needs this loan in order to strengthen his coffee plantation, since nowadays it is necessary to fight off pests and crop diseases.

His goal as a farmer is to be able to adequately care for his crops in order to obtain a good harvest, process the coffee beans, and sell them to earn an income.

loans.use: to strengthen his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Kanizan

texts.en:
Kanizan is a 39-year-old married woman. She has 7 children; one of her sons (also shown in the photo) has been running a business of milk selling for many years. He sells the milk in her area and earns enough to pay for his family’s expenses. 

For the improvement of her son's business, she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR. It will help him to buy stock of good quality milk along with containers for storage. It will increase his sales and earnings also. 

Kanizan dreams of providing good quality living standards to her family members.

loans.use: to buy stock of good quality milk along with containers for storage.

loans.name: Sarwar

texts.en: Sarwar  is 55 years old and a widow. She earns a living to support her family by selling milk, and raises buffaloes and cows to produce her milk. Sarwar has a good client list and makes enough money to care for her family. To improve her business, she has requested a 40,000 PKR  loan to buy one more buffalo so she can serve more customers, increase her income and provide a better standard of living to her family.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Pathani

texts.en: Pathani has successfully built her business of selling animals with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She now has a good number of customers and makes enough income to contribute to the family's support. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. She is now in her fourth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy more animals to raise and sell. This will allow her to increase her sales to gain more profits. She is shown in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: to buy more animals to increase her sales and gain more profits.

loans.name: Eugenio Santo

texts.es:
Eugenio, de 58 años de edad, es agricultor y micro empredor, unicamente estudio hasta segundo grado de educación básica, actualmente está soltero, pues su pareja falleció hace muchos años.

Eugenio, se dedica a la caficultura, esta labor la ha practicado por más de 30 años, debido a que es la base fundamental de sus ingresos, en esta labor se involucran sus hijos mayores.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas y para pagar el mantenimiento del criadero de café, el préstamo mejorara su calidad de vida.

Sus sueños más grande son darles oportunidad que estudien a sus hijos y que se formen profesionalmente, así como también, sueña con tener su cafetal en buen estado para una mejor producción.
texts.en:
Eugenio is a 58-year-old farmer and micro entrepreneur. He only has a second grade education. He is currently single, since his partner passed away many years ago.

Eugenio works growing coffee, and has been doing so for over thirty years. This is his essential basic source of income, and his older children are also involved in the business.

He needs this loan to purchase farm supplies and to pay for the maintenance of his coffee plantation.

His main goal is to give his children the opportunity of getting a higher education. He also wants to keep his coffee crops in good condition in order to increase production.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and pay for the maintenance of his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 48 years old, a married woman and a mother of five children. She is working hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health and clothing.   She, together with her husband, have been doing work of agriculture for some years. She grows different vegetables and fruits, and sells them in the local market.  She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

In order to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides, currently Nasreen has applied a loan of 40,000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops, which ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Alizamin

texts.en:
Alizamin is a 49-year-old hardworking farmer. He is a refugee living in the Imishli region with his family. He is married and his wife is a housekeeper. They live in a small house and have a daughter and two sons. Alizamin is a very positive man and he does everything for his family. He is ready to do any job, day and night, in order to provide for his family. He helps them to meet their demands. He raises crops such as wheat, barley and corn and other kinds of crops and then sells them to local bazaars or crop suppliers. Additionally, his wife makes flour, bread, cakes, and cookies. They sell them too. 

Alizamin has worked in this sector of agriculture for 10 years but his income is only 210 AZN. This income doesn't cover his family's needs. One of his daughters is preparing for a wedding and the whole family is preparing too. Wedding preparation takes a lot of time and is expensive. Alizamin loves his children. He applied for a  loan of 1200 AZN in order to cover a part of the wedding costs because he is ready to do everything for his children. He wants to see his daughter happy and have a nice wedding.

loans.use: to cover a part of the costs of his daughter's wedding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and materials to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase products wholesale such as sugar, fruits, soft drinks, juices, perfumes, and body creams, among other items.

loans.name: Khayala

texts.en:
Khayala is a 50-year-old gardener. She is married. Her husband is a laborer and they have three daughters and one son. Her son helps her in her garden to raise seasonal fruits, vegetables and greens and sell them at their own grocery next to their house. Khayala has been a gardener for 10 years and she has a good experience but the income is very low. It's only 150 AZN monthly.

Khayala's family is big and it's hard for her and her husband to meet demands with such income. Now she wants to expand her business because she has no other choice. She wants to sell groceries at the bazaar because there she can meet more customers and increase the income of her family. She applied for a loan of 1500 AZN in order to buy a place for her grocery store at the local bazaar and sell their harvest.

loans.use: to buy a place for selling groceries and their harvest at the local bazaar.

loans.name: Hatunchaskas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “HATUNCHASKAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Catherine ella es soltero y tiene 47 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja como profesora del nivel primario, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un negocio para vender la ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un televisor para su casa.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de carpintería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank Hatunchaskas. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Catherine is one of the members of this group. She is 47 years old, single, and has three children. She works as an elementary school teacher. Her work schedule is from 8:00 am to 2:00 pm. She has been doing this for eight years now, and things are going very well for her. Her dream is to open a store to sell clothing. She is requesting this loan to buy a television set for her home.

The rest of the members work selling crafts, selling clothing, running a grocery store, and running a carpentry shop.

This member is thankful to all who participate in making these resources possible and promises to comply with her payment terms.

loans.use: to buy a television set for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the maintenance of his pick-up

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 26 years old, married, and has three children.  She is from Leyte and operates a sari-sari store, which she has been doing for more than one year.  

Arlyn requested a loan, which she will use to buy more stocks such as canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, bread, biscuits, condiments, and cooking oil. This loan will enable her to improve her inventories thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, Arlyn hopes to expand her store so that it will generate more revenue.  She also wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, bread, biscuits, condiments, and cooking oil

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is 55 years old, married, and has five children. She is a merchant living in Matag-ob, Leyte. Aurea earns a living through retail sales of bananas, which she has been doing for more than 10 years. 

Aurea is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more bananas and other crops such as potatoes. Aurea hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas and other crops

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is a 62-year-old fruit and vegetable vendor from Matag-ob, Leyte. She is married and has eight grown up children. 

Celestina has been in this business for more than 5 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Celestina is asking to take a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables like bananas, cabbage, and others. A loan will help her improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables like bananas, cabbage, and others

loans.name: Yenny Maribel

texts.es:
En la pila de Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía elaboradas por sus habitantes.
En este lugar vive la señora Yenny, tiene 49 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tiene un hijo de 14 años el mismo que estudian en colegio. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. 
Doña Yenny para ganar su sustento y el de su hijo se dedica al comercio, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, allí también tiene un bazar en el cual vende ropa, zapatos, bisuterías y ciertas cosas para regalos,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h30 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde. Gracias a su negocio ella sale adelante y no descuida la educación de su hijo ya que está atenta a sus necesidades. Tiene 12 años con esta actividad con la cual se gana la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres, ropa, zapatos y otros artículos de bazar. Lleva 8 años en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta la gran ayuda para seguir con su negocio.  Sus metas son darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The members of the "Para el Futuro de la Mujer" communal bank meet in the parish of La Pila, in Montecristi, every two weeks. This place is well known for its rich traditional culture. A wide variety of handicrafts made by the inhabitants can be found there.

This is where Yenny lives. She is 49 years old, is divorced, and has a 14-year-old son, who attends high school. She lives at her parents' home.

In order to provide for her and her son, she works in commerce. She has a small grocery store at home, where she sells all kinds of essential products. She also has a variety store there, where she sells clothes, shoes, costume jewellery, and gift items. She works from 6:30 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. every day, and sometimes even later. 

Thanks to her business, she gets ahead and doesn't neglect her son's education since she can be attentive to his needs. She has been making a living following this occupation for twelve years now. 

She will use this loan to buy groceries, clothes, shoes, and other items.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 9 years, and she likes it because of the great help she has received to stay in business. 

Her goal is to give the best to her son.

loans.use: to buy groceries, clothes, shoes, and other  general goods.

loans.name: Narcisse

texts.en:
Narcisse is 25 years and married. He is a farmer and he has been producing rice for seven years. His wife is also a farmer. 

Narcisse requested a loan from Urwego Opportunity Bank, which he will use to pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to buy seeds for rice production.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers.

loans.name: Alegre Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por cuatro mujeres luchadoras de la etnia Miskita (Medolina, Isolda, Sonia y Eteldina). Son mujeres alegres y dinámicas que viven en Puerto Cabezas. Se organizaron hace seis meses, con el propósito de acceder a créditos con garantía solidaria con PANA PANA y tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños de: Pulpería, venta de mariscos y productos de belleza y contribuir a mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. 

Con el primer crédito recibido de Pana Pana y financiado por KIVA, le permitió  a Medolina, coordinadora del grupo solidario diversificar los productos que oferta en su pequeña pulpería, actualmente vende pollo, carne molida y a las demás integrantes surtir de inventario sus negocios.

Eteldina: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una mujer jovial, originaria de Waspan Rio Coco, llegó a vivir a Puerto Cabezas en el período que evacuaron a toda la población del Río Coco en los años 80. Tiene 49 años de edad, está casada, tiene 7 hijos: 4 son mayores de edad e independientes y tres en edad escolar. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de frito que elabora en su vivienda de tambo de madera, con el propósito de contar con su propia fuente de ingresos para apoyar con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar insumos e ingredientes para la elaboración de fritos: repollo, tomate, vinagre, cebolla, chiltoma, pollo y aceite. Su sueño es establecer una pulpería
texts.en:
This unified group is made up of four women, who fight to get ahead, who are from the Miskita indigenous ethnic group. They are Medolina, Isolda, Sonia and Eteldina.

They are happy, dynamic women who live in Puerto Cabezas. They got together 16 months ago with the goal of accessing loans with the guaranteed support of PANA PANA and in order to improve their small businesses, such as a little corner store, shellfish sales and cosmetics to then improve the quality of life of their families.

With the first loan from PANA PANA, financed by KIVA, Medolina, who is the coordinator of the group, was able to diversify the products she offered in her corner store. She now sells chicken, ground beef and the other members were able to stock up their businesses.

Eteldina: A member of the solidarity group. She is a jovial woman, originating from Waspan Rio Coco. She came to live in Puerto Cabezas when the entire population of Rio Coco was evacuated in the 80s. She is 49 years old, married and has seven children: four are older and independent and three are still in school. For the last year, she has been running a fried food business from her house made of wood, which she started so she could count on her own income to share the household costs and her children's studies. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies and ingredients to make her fried foods: cabbage, tomato, vinegar, onion, pepper, chicken and oil. Her dream is to open a store.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients to make fried foods: cabbage, tomato, vinegar, onion, pepper, chicken and oil.

loans.name: Eva  Del Carmen

texts.es:
Medio siglo tiene Eva de dedicarse a la venta de mariscos, en el mercado de su comunidad. Esta mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, desde niña se involucró en este negocio, tanto que a  sus 17 años, se animó a vender por su cuenta, lo cual resultó ser un éxito  y lo que le ha permitido subsistir durante toda su vida y sacar adelante a sus seis hijos. 

Hoy a sus 59 años, Eva solicita el crédito para la compra de  pescado seco, pues es la temporada donde más se consume y  esto le da la oportunidad incrementar de sus ventas y en consiguiente ganar más dinero. Ella espera poder ampliar su negocio y convertirse en proveedora de mariscos para algún hotel de la zona.
texts.en:
Eva has been working selling seafood at the local market for half a century. This hardworking and enterprising woman has been involved in this business ever since she was little. So much so, that at age seventeen she decided to set up her own business, which turned out to be a success and has allowed her to make a living her whole life and provide for her six children.

Today, at age 59, Eva is requesting a loan to buy dried fish. This is the season with the highest demand for this product, so this loan will allow her to increase her sales and, in turn, make more money. She hopes to expand her business and become a seafood provider for one of the local hotels.

loans.use: to buy dried fish.

loans.name: Tanzeela

texts.en:
Tanzeela is a 28-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all of their household expenses, so she started her milk sales business. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality.

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 57-year-old married woman. She is the mother of seven children. She has an animal purchase and sales business, which she has been running for many years. Along with her husband, she is working very hard to provide her children with the basic necessities of life.

Now she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all of her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Patrick's Group

texts.en:
Patrick is 35 years old, married, and has three children. He is often described as an extremely resourceful person. He is a group leader, representing his group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Patrick is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund as this means that he is able to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, which is why he decided to join originally. Patrick is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2012, he has been able to save more money, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Patrick will use the profits from this season to send his children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 4.75 acres. The group will also receive a total of two solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Khayriniso

texts.en: Khayriniso is 23 years old. She lives in  the Shahrinav district with her family.  She is engaged in selling. For the last two years, she has been selling baby clothes. Her mother is sewing women’s scarves .Her father is a builder. Khayriniso is a very kind and caring girl. Soon her sister is going to celebrate her son's rite of circumcision, but they do not have enough money. So Khayriniso is asking for the loan. She wants to organize it. For Muslim people, it is very important. She is hoping for your support and help.

loans.use: To celebrate the rite of circumcision

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabrics for sewing and embroidering "chakan" dresses

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.ru: Башорат молодая жена и мама годовалого ребенка. Она вместе с большой семьей проживает в городе Куляб. Она живет вместе со свекром, свекровью, мужем и сыночком. Мужу 23 года, вместе с отцом работает строителем. Свекровь работает медсестрой ей 57 лет. Башорату 19 лет, она дома занимается шитьем женской одежды. Башорат научилась шитье у сестры мужа. Башорат шьет платья на этой швейной машинке, производства СССР. Она хочет купить новую, более современную модернизированную, но машинка стоить дорого и она обратилась за кредитом. Она решила купить швейную машинку и другую часть кредита потратить на ремонт дома. Башорат верит, что вы ей поможете
texts.en: Bashorat is a young woman and the mother of a one-year old child. She lives in the town of Kulob with her extended family. She lives together with her in-laws, husband and young son. Bashorat’s husband is 23 years old; he works in construction together with his father. Her mother-in-law, who is 57 years old, works as a registered nurse. Bashorat is 19 years old. She sews women’s clothing at home. She learned this trade from her  sister-in-law. Bashorat sews clothing using this old sewing machine [seen in the photo] from Soviet times. She would like to buy a new modern sewing machine, but this is expensive, and so Bashorat has applied for a loan. She decided to buy a sewing machine and spend the rest of the loan for home renovations. Bashorat trusts you will help her.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and renovate her home.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Matag-ob, Leyte. 

She is engaged in a retail sales business. She has been running a small sari-sari or retail store for more than 4 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Demetria is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, cooking oil and condiments among other items. This loan is what Demetria needs to improve her business as well as her income. 

Demetria dreams of improving her livelihood in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, cooking oil and condiments, among other items

loans.name: Eilyn

texts.en:
Eilyn is married and has four children. She lives with her family in the town of Matag-ob, Leyte. She is engaged in hog raising business, which she has been doing for more than a year. Her husband works as a construction worker. 

Eilyn is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more piglets and animal feed. This loan will help her improve her hog raising business as well as her income. In the future, Eilyn dreams of improving her way of living and saving money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Fedadelfa

texts.en:
Fedadelfa is a 53-year-old married woman from Matag-ob, Leyte. For the past twewnty years she has sold bananas to earn money for the family.

Fedadelfa is applying for a 4,000 PHP loan through CEVI to buy more bananas to sell. This loan will help her improve her business as well as increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is a married woman and a mother of a one-year-old child from Leyte, Philippines. 

She is engaged in a motorcycle transport business with her husband. This is the source of their income. She also earns additional income through her snack food vending business. 

Genelyn is asking to take a loan to buy spare parts for the motorcycle, such as tires, nuts and bolts, chains, and fuel; and also to buy additional ingredients for food vending, such as flour and sugar. 

A loan will help Genelyn improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the motorcycle, such as tires, nuts and bolts, chains, and fuel; and also to buy additional ingredients for food vending, such as flour and sugar.

loans.name: Nehema

texts.en:
Nehema is a 30-year-old married woman with 2 children, one of whom is in school.  

Nehema is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Nehema has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nehema would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto es un hombre casado  de 49 años de edad, tiene una hermosa familia de 6 hijos de las edades entre 12 y 26 años de edad, vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Alberto desde muy pequeño trabajaba con su padre en un pequeño negocio de venta de bananos, fue donde adquirió mucha experiencia, por lo que no dudo en independizarse ahora él desde hace  30 años se dedica a la venta de banano en la plaza de su comunidad, él lo hace con el único fin de obtener sus ingresos para mantener a su familia, para este padre de familia no hay nada más importante que su familia es por eso que desde hace algún tiempo se ha percatado a ver las necesidades primordiales, y una de ellas es que no cuentan con suficiente terreno, pero hace poco se le presentó una oferta de terreno y él ha considerado que este es la oportunidad de  comprar un terreno, pero una de las limitaciones de Alberto es que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la compra, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar un terreno.
El sueño más grande de Alberto es poder brindarle a su familia una mejor vida brindándoles un mejor lugar donde puedan vivir.
texts.en:
Alberto is a 49 year old married man. He has a beautiful family of 6 children aged between 12 to 26 years old. He lives in a community of Sololá.

Alberto from a very young age worked with his father in a small business selling bananas. This was where he acquired much experience. Because of this, he is independent and has now worked 30 years in the sale of bananas in the plaza of his community. He does so with the sole purpose of obtaining income to support his family. For this parent, there is nothing more important than his family. 

For some time he has managed to see to the basic needs and one of them is that they don't have enough land. Recently he was presented an offer of land and he considered that this is the opportunity of buying land. However, one of the limitations of Alberto is that he does not have the money necessary to make the purchase. For this reason he is asking for a loan to use for the purchase of land.

Alberto's biggest dream is to give his family a better life and give them a better place to live.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en: Maia is a 31-year-old widowed woman. She lives in the small village of Khashuri district. She has 3 children (3, 7 and 10 years old). They are provided with an orphan pension from the government. Maia trades perfumes, but the income is not enough to cover expenses and she decided to start an additional business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 800 GEL. With the received credit, she will purchase stock of different materials to sew clothes. She has already purchased a sewing machine. Maia is very motivated to improve the living conditions of her 3 children and the Start Up loan will be a great support for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of materials and get orders to sew clothes.

loans.name: Otipa's Group

texts.en:
Otipa is a 50-year-old proud father of 5 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and he is representing his group of 15 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Otipa has noticed that he has been able to save more money.

Otipa described his harvest as excellent last year, but he believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, as well as fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Otipa’s Group will be able to plant a total of 8.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en: Ekaterine, who is 37 years old, lives in small village named Shua Khorga. She is married and has a husband, a daughter and a son. The only breadwinner in the family is her husband, who works as a private artisan and gets approximately 200 GEL monthly. Ekaterine was unable to find any stable job so she has started an agribusiness. She is engaged in cattle breeding, cultivating family-owned land and harvesting nuts seasonally. She generates a small income from this business, but wants to make a greater contribution to her family's welfare. She received credit from the joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - the Startup Program - that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. Ekaterine will start a trading business of various home products, which she will purchase with the capital at wholesale prices. She will sell the products with price mark-ups and make additional income. The loan will be a great support to this hard-working woman and her family, as they will be able to tackle their financial difficulties and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to make her own business and start trading with home products.

loans.name: Pedro Edmundo

texts.en:
Pedro Edmundo is a small dairy farmer, whose main source of income is the sale of the milk his cows produce. He decided to invest in a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester in order to reduce his operating costs, as he used to spend a significant amount of his revenue in LP gas and chemical fertilizers. With his biodigester, he will not only be able to use his cows' manure to produce biogas to cook and heat water, but also a nutrient-rich organic fertilizer to apply on his corn field. In addition, his wife will no longer have to cook with wood, thereby eliminating the toxic smoke she was inhaling on a daily basis. In addition to saving money, Pedro Edmundo will reduce his carbon footprint by reducing greenhouse gas emissions and protecting underground water sources as the manure is being treated inside the biodigester. With his savings, Pedro Edmundo plans to increase his cow herd, buy a tractor and other tools for his farm.
This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to acquire a 16 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to improve the floor of her home, install grey water ducts, and pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes to expand his business

loans.name: Banco Del Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “BANCO DEL DESARROLLO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Miriam Laura ella es casada y tiene 45 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su  negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maiz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.
Las socias que están pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunión porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de lavandería, negocio de internet, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Banco del Desarrollo" communal bank. This bank is located in the Cusco district, in the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Miriam Laura, who is 45 years old. She is married and she has one child. She works at her business where she sells grains such as corn, wheat and quinoa. She works from 8:00 am until 5:00 pm. She has had this business for five years and things are going well for her. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell grains. She is requesting a loan to buy wheat, corn and quinoa. 

The members that appear to be added in the group photo, took their photos after the meeting, as they asked permission for work related reasons. The other members work in businesses such as; a laundromat, an internet cafe, a grocery store, and a restaurant.

Miriam Laura expresses gratitude to those who are part of this dream, through this loan, and she promises to pay her fees in the time frame allowed.

loans.use: to buy wheat, corn and quinoa.

loans.name: Algerica

texts.en: Algerica is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of seven grown-up children. She is from Matag-ob, Leyte. Algerica has been earning a living through her hog raising business for more than 3 years now. Algerica is asking to take a loan to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed. Algerica believes that a loan will help her improve her hog raising business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 55-year-old married woman and a mother of four grown up children from Matag-ob, Leyte. 

She has been engaged in the hog raising business for more than 15 years now. This is her source of income. 

Helen is asking to take a loan to buy more piglets to raise, and animal feed. A loan will help Helen in improving her hog raising business, thus generating more income and revenue.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise, and animal feed.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is from Matag-ob, Leyte. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than 6 years now. This is the source of her income. Amalia is asking to take a loan to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed and to pay for the labor to repair the pigpen. Amalia believes that this loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed and to pay for the labor to repair the pigpen.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza is a 33-year-old married woman from Leyte, Philippines. She is engaged in a  rice retail business. This is her source of income. Analiza would like to obtain a loan to buy more rice to sell to her customers. Analiza hopes that this loan will help her improve and augment her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is a 34-year-old married father of two children, aged two and five, the latter of whom goes to school. Married to a farmer, Gilbert is also a farmer who has been producing rice for 18 years. This loan from Kiva will help him to pay his workers. Gilbert will use his business profits to buy a piece of land and improve his welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers.

loans.name: Janece

texts.en:
Janece is a 31-year-old married woman from Leyte, Philippines. 

She makes an income through her hog raising business. Janece has raised pigs for more than 4 years now. This is her source of income. 

Janece is asking for a loan to buy more piglets to raise, and animal feed. A loan will help her improve the productivity of her pig raising business as well as her income and profit. 

Janece dreams of improving her livelihood and saving money to send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise, and animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plant crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm implements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a cowshed that will allow future expansion

loans.name: Wanzetse's Group

texts.en:
Wanzetse, pictured above, has 5 children and is always described as a very friendly person, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. Wanzetse is representing his group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District and he is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Wanzetse has been a farmer for 20 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Wanzetse is planning to send his children to school.

A total of 5.5 acres will be planted by Wanzetse's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuation in the  number of clients, hence her goods perish, leading to losses.

With the Kes 20,000, she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en:
Betty's Group is formed by 13 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Betty, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 42 years old, is married, and has 4 children. Betty has been a farmer for 20 years and is often referred to as a very trustworthy person.

Betty isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to save more money ever since. This year, Betty will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but she will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition, since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Betty's Group will purchase a total of 10 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Zviadi

texts.en:
Zviadi, who is a 34-year-old young man, lives in a village called Guripuli. He has three family members, and their only source of income is from small agricultural activity. The family is living in really poor conditions, as they have no source of significant income. Their income isn't enough even for basic needs.

Seasonally, they sell harvested laurel (bay leaves) and nuts and also milk the cow that they own and sell milk products locally. Zviadi has a great desire to build a greenhouse so that he can generate income in the off-season. He requested a loan from Credo to realize his purpose. His loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo.

The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural people living with poverty, who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With the received credit, Zviadi plans to purchase all of the necessary equipment and tools and set up the greenhouse. He will take care of the new business with the help of his family members and will get the chance to generate additional income to improve their living conditions.

Zviadi will be thankful for the help and will highly appreciate it.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse and expand his agribusiness

loans.name: Layali Ghaza Group

texts.en:
Layali Ghaza is a group consisting of four hardworking women who are striving to improve the living conditions of their families. All live in Hodiedah city, Yemen. They have applied for a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB.

Jabara is the leader and coordinator of the group. She is a married mother of six children living in an extremely poor area in the middle of Hodeidah. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family until he suffered a thrombus which left him unable to work. Now, she takes care of him as well as the children. 

Jabara works as a cleaner at the Hodiedah public university for a very small salary that is insufficient to meet household expenses. Seven years ago, she decided to seek an additional source of income by selling women's clothes in her area door to door. Now, Jabara wants to enlarge her business and so has applied for a loan portion of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase stylish new women's clothes to resell.

Jabara looks forward to opening a small shop to display her goods.

loans.use: To purchase stylish new women's clothes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the school fee for his children.

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Joseph is 34 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. He has three children and is married. As a group leader, Joseph is representing his group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District in Kenya. He is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Joseph's desire to earn enough to feed his family. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow.

Joseph and his group will receive a total of six solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 6 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizer and pay laborers to help with coffee growing.

loans.name: Gulbuta

texts.en:
Gulbuta is a 61-year-old woman. She is widow. She has two sons and one daughter. She lives with her children in IDP settlement because they are refugees. The family is poor, and Gulbuta earns money for the family by raising seasonal fruits. She raises pomegranates and sells them at the local bazaar. She has worked in this area for 34 years, and earns 124AZN monthly. 

Pomegranate is a very usefull and delicious fruit. People use it to make different souces for kebab and other national dishes. Or they dry them and use them in a dried fruit lavashana, which is also very delicious and useful for health. 

Gulbuta has a small garden and can't rise more fruit. She applied for 1,500AZN loan in order to buy seeds of other trees and raise them too. This will increase the assortment of Gulbuta's grocery, and her monthly income, too. She hopes that this will help her to provide family's needs.

loans.use: to buy the seeds of other trees and raise them

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 28-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and one small son in a simple house in Jenin city. Two years ago, he opened his own business, which is a workshop for making furniture. The demand is high for his products because he gives a very good quality.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy raw materials for his furniture workshop, like textiles and sponges. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to increase his production and also his income. 

Mohammad appears in the photo in his workshop.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for his furniture workshop, like textiles and sponges

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 48-year-old married woman and the mother of four grown children from Leyte, Philippines. She earns a living through snack food vending and has been in the business for more than a year now. She sells her home-cooked snack foods to the people in her place.

Jocelyn is asking to take a loan to buy more ingredients like flour, sugar, cooking oil, milk, butter and others, which she can cook and sell to her customers. Jocelyn hopes to improve her livelihood in the future.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like flour, sugar, cooking oil, milk, butter and others

loans.name: Yousra

texts.en:
Yousra is a 44-year-old married mother of four children. She has been working as a chef with a limited salary for seven years to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Yousra is a hard worker and sacrificing mother who is trying her best to provide her children with good living conditions. Thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her kitchen and buy a new bedroom for her children. Yousra hopes to stay capable of providing for her family's needs.

loans.use: to renovate her kitchen and buy a new bedroom for her children

loans.name: Maria Melrose

texts.en:
Maria Melrose is 51 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Maria Melrose works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Melrose runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like beverages, eggs, canned goods, etc..

Maria Melrose has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Maria Melrose would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like beverages, eggs, and canned goods.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 59 years old and married with nine children. Lilia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc..

Lilia has been in this business for 5 years now. 

In the future, Lilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Dolores

texts.en:
Ma. Dolores works hard to support her family. Ma. Dolores has a coconut and banana farming business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ma. Dolores has been in this business for 10 years, and earns additional income from raising livestock.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.  Ma. Dolores would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Silvia Emperatriz

texts.es: Silvia es una señora muy alegre, se encuentra divorciada, tiene dos hijas, una de 15 y la otra de 17 años de edad y asisten al colegio, Silvia se  dedica  a la venta de ropa y también a sembrar pequeñas  huertas de productos propios de su zona, el crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de ropa para ofrecerla puerta a puerta y a sus amigas, la aspiración de Silvia es  mejorar su negocio, sus ventas y  por ende sus ingresos para terminar de pagar de una casita que esta comprando y también le gustaría que sus hijas culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Silvia is a very happy woman.  She is divorced and has two daughters, 15 and 17, who attend college.  Silvia makes a living selling clothing and she also plants small orchards of products appropriate to her zone.  
She will invest the loan in the purchase of clothing to offer door to door to her friends.  Silvia's aspiration is to improve her business, her sales and her income in order to finish paying for a house she is buying and also she would like to see her daughters complete their studies.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Xaveline

texts.en: Xaveline is 32 years old. She is married with four children aged between one and thirteen. Three of them go to school. She owns a  shop in which she sells maize flour, rice and Irish potatoes. She has been in this business for the past seven years, while her husband is a business man. With the loan, she would like to buy items such as sugar, rice and millet to sell. With the profits from the business she plans to build her own house. In future she hopes to make more profits in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice and millet to sell.

loans.name: Al- Sa'ada Group

texts.en:
Al- Sa'ada is a group which consists of four women. They live in Hodeidah city, Yemen. This community is hardworking and they work as much as they can in order to improve their living conditions. They applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB.

Roeda is the leader of the group. She is 31 years old and lives with her children in one of Hodeidah's poor areas, in Yemen.  She is a mother of two children who are one and two years old. She is a hardworking woman who works hard to provide her children with better living conditions, so she decided to start her own humble business through selling perfumes and incense door to door in the area where she lives with her family. 

The income from this humble business is very weak and limited and is not enough to cover the main expenses of the family. Roeda doesn’t have the sufficient money to increase her business. Therefore, she applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB. She will use her portion of the loan to purchase traditional incense and perfumes to resell in her area.

Roeda hopes to raise her children in a suitable environment and dreams to provide them with better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase traditional incense and perfumes to resell in her area.

loans.name: Pamela's Group

texts.en:
Pamela's Group is formed by 7 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Pamela, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 42 years old, is married, and has 4 children. Pamela has been a farmer for 12 years and is often referred to as a very resourceful person.

Pamela isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Pamela will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have an overall improved quality of life.

Using this loan, Pamela's Group will purchase a total of 5 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 2.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Yuth

texts.en:
A resident from Preah Vihear province, Yuth is a mother of one dependent son. Her main sources of income are from rice cropping and a sweet selling business. 

This is the third loan for Yuth with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She has fully repaid her past loans wisely. For this cycle, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can gain a better income than before.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en: Jameela is a 48-year-old married woman. She is the mother of three children. She has been doing a business of animal sales and purchase with her husband for many years. Jameela makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle to resell in the market. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell in the market.

loans.name: Kastriot

texts.en:
Kastriot is a 44-year-old  married man with two children who are 14 and 12 years old.  One child is ill.   They live in the suburbs of a little town. He has a cart that is pulled  with horses and he wishes to purchase another horse. 

Kastriot uses the cart for transportation and he also has one dairy cow, two pigs and fifteen chickens. He  owns about 1,500 square meters of agricultural land and plants fodder, shamrocks for the animals, and seasonal veggies for his family’s use.

He and his family receive disability income and other support that amounts to $214/month.

loans.use: to buy a horse.

loans.name: Hassen

texts.en:
Hassen is a 37-year-old married man and a father of four children who lives with his family in Sana'a city, Yemen. He studied till the secondary education level, but he couldn't complete his studies. 

Now he is the sole provider of his family. His wife works as a housewife and she finds that her kitchen lacks a lot of the necessary house wares and appliances. Unfortunately, the income of Hassen, who is her husband, is not enough. 

For this reason, he decided to take a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase some of the necessary house wares, such as a new oven and other items for his house.

Hassen hopes to provide his house with all its needs, and he hopes to send his children to a private school.

loans.use: To purchase some of the necessary house wares, such as a new oven and other items for his house.

loans.name: Catarina Viviana

texts.es:
Catarina es una mujer de 21 años de edad, tiene un lindo hijo de un año, ella vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Catarina en una muchacha admirable porque trabaja de sol a sol para ganar su pan de cada día para poder mantener a su hijo, para ella vender es algo que siempre le ha gustado realizar, pues ya lleva 15 años de dedicarse a la venta de banano en una pequeña plaza de su comunidad, pero para Catarina no hay nada más importante que su hijo es por eso que ella ahora se ha visto a la necesidad de comprar un terreno donde pueda construir su casa para brindarle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para comprar un terreno.
Catarina su gran sueño es poder comprar su terreno y empezar a construir su casa para que a ella y su hijo tengan una casa propia.
texts.en:
Catarina, aged 21, has a cute one year old son, and lives in a community in Sololá.

Catarina is a remarkable young woman, as she works from sunrise to sunset to earn money she needs to look after her son. She has always enjoyed selling, and has spent the last 15 years selling bananas in a small local square. But for Catarina, nothing is more important than her son, which is why she feels it necessary to buy land on which she can build a home, giving her son a better quality of life. So, she is requesting a loan of 3,000 Quetzales to buy the land. 

Catarina's greatest wish is to be able to buy land and to begin building a house so that her and her son can have their own home.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 30-year-old, married man from Khanyounis city. He lives with his wife and two children, one son and one daughter, in a small, simple house. 

Five years ago, Ahmad opened a grocery store in the city, where he sells basic grocery products to the local clients.

Ahmad took a USD Murabaha loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy more grocery products for his store. This will improve his business and increase his sales.

Ahmad appears in the photo, in his store.

loans.use: to buy more gropcery products for his store.

loans.name: Zebinniso

texts.ru: Зебиннисо вместе с дочкой живет в городке под названием Куляб. Куляб славится своим несравнимым гостеприимством и вежливостью своего народа. Зебиннисо тоже не отличилась он своих земляков. Она прекрасная хозяйка и умелая мастерица. Не смотря на тяжелый развод с мужем, Зебиннисо смогла взять все в свои руки и жить дальше. Она одна растет 8 летнюю девочку. Только дочка не дала ей отпустить руки. На сегодняшний день Зебиниссо жизнерадостная, добрая и миролюбивая женщина. Она принимает заказы на шитье женской одежды и этим зарабатывает себе и своей дочке на жизнь. Зебиннисо давно хотела иметь новую и удобную швейную машинку, чтобы шить гораздо быстрее и качественнее, но достаточно денег не могла собрать. Она сделала выбор и обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить машинку своей мечты и надеется, что ее поддержат в ее выборе.
texts.en:
Zebinniso and her daughter live in the small town of Kulob. The town is known for the hospitality of its people. Zebinniso is likewise very welcoming. She is a wonderful hostess and skilled professional. Despite a difficult divorce from her husband, she has been able to take control of her life and move on. 

She is independently raising her eight-year-old daughter, who wouldn't let her go. Zebinniso is a happy, good and kind-hearted woman. She supports herself and her daughter by taking orders to make women's clothing. 

Zebinniso has long wanted a new, more convenient, sewing machine to be able to sew faster and better. However, she has not had the money to buy one. She has made a decision to take a loan to buy the sewing machine she has dreamt about, and hopes that she has your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Rihab

texts.en:
Rihab is a 40-year-old Lebanese married woman. She is a great mother to four adorable children, and a helpful wife that is doing her best to support her family. 

She earns her living by working in agriculture. With the loan requested from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l, she will purchase seeds and fertilizers. 

Rihab says that these purchases will certainly help her crops grow and increase her business productivity. 

Rihab is very positive and hopes that this loan will help her earn more profit and therefore she will be able to save money for the future to insure good living conditions for the whole family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Iltaf

texts.en: Iltaf is a 45-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children. Thirteen years ago, she started to prepare food at her house which she sells to numerous neighboring customers. Currently, she seeks a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase supplies needed, specifically containers, bottles and jars so she can produce more and better store her provisions. In the future, Iltaf looks forward to borrowing additional Kiva loans to build her business to a greater extent.

loans.use: purchase supplies needed for her food business, specifically containers, bottles and jars.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leonora is 45 years old and has two children who are in school.

Leonora has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Leonora requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Leonora has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Leonora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Qurotul

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Qurotul.  Qurotul lives in South Tangerang, located about an hour's drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her two children. Qurotul owns a stall where she sells daily consumer products and provides mobile payment service for her community. She joined Ruma in 2012. This is the second time she is asking for a loan from Kiva. As a woman, she wanted to join Ruma because she wants to learn about how to improve her business, as well as make more contributions to her community. 

As the business grows, Qurotul is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Qurotul improve her business and accordingly, her community which needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Qurotul is the one who is standing in her own small stall. She will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile payment services

loans.name: Merushe

texts.en:
Merushe wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan, which has helped her to renovate her stable and purchase a cow. Unfortunately, the cow that she purchased with the loan was unable to produce milk and she had to sell it. Although her husband is still working in construction, his salary remains low and she needs the assistance of the lenders for the purchase of the cow. 

Now, for the second time, she is requesting a loan so that she can purchase another cow and be able to continue to sell milk and dairy products in her neighborhood. She is very happy for this second opportunity and hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her farm and her business, being able to provide better living conditions for her family and better education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase another cow and be able to continue to sell milk and dairy products in her neighborhood.

loans.name: Jyostna

texts.en:
Jyostna is a 32-year-old widowed woman. She lives with her son in a small colony of Rourekela city of Sundergarh district, Odisha. Her son is 12 years old, and he is in school. Jyostna's husband passed away more than four years ago in an accident.

Jyostna owns a tailoring shop/small ladies’ fashion cloth shop where she gives service to clients for tailoring, picot, embroidery, etc. She earns 6,000 INR per month from this business. She wants to open a tailoring training center, and for that she needs financial support.

Jyostna has requested a loan of 40,000 INR to purchase four tailoring machines for opening a tailoring training center.

She has a dream to educate her son. She is thankful to Kiva and its lenders for this support.

loans.use: to purchase four tailoring machines for opening a tailoring training center.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.ru: Это Фатыма. Ей 55 лет. Она замужем и у нее одна дочка и один сын. Муж и сын работают преподавателем в университете Энергетики. Фатыма сама тоже работает учительницей. Она вместе семьей проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Фатыма 15 лет продвигает свою деятельность. Ей нравится своя работа. Она любит обучать детей, по этой причине она выбрала профессию учителя. Фатыма скоро выдает замуж своею дочку и по традиции она должна купить ей приданное и потратиться на свадьбу. Она очень любит свою дочку и хочет, чтобы ее свадьба прошла по правилам и традициям, но к сожалению ей не хватает денежных средств, чтобы  совершить задуманное. И она приняла решение обратиться за кредитом.
texts.en:
Fatima is 55 years old and married with one daughter and one son. Her husband and son work as lecturers at the Energy Institute. Fatima is also a teacher. They live in the town of Qurgan-Tube. 

For 15 years, Fatima has enjoyed her work. She chose teaching as a profession because she loves children. 

Soon, Fatima will be giving her daughter in marriage. According to tradition, she is responsible to buy her daughter a trousseau and pay for the wedding. Fatima loves her daughter very much and wants to provide all this, but can't afford to do so. She has decided to take a loan to pay for these expenses.

loans.use: for her daughter's wedding and trousseau.

loans.name: Emiro

texts.es: Emiro de 34 años de edad realiza varias actividades,  al mismo tiempo que vende equipos de tecnología como controles remotos, discos compactos,  ofrece el servicio de alquiler de lavadoras en su barrio, ubicado al suroccidente de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde habita con su cónyuge y su hijo de 4 años de edad. Desde sus 13 años Emiro, está trabajando pues sus padres siempre se dedicaron a la actividad comercial, especialmente  de sabanas, calzado, y todos los artículos que su clientela les solicita. Emiro inicia su actividad, desde las 11 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, comprando de contado en el centro de la ciudad y vendiendo de la misma manera a clientes ubicados en los barrios aledaños; el visita a sus clientes y le hace la oferta y muchos de ellos también llegan a su negocio a comprar. Su meta mas adelante es tener un local con vitrinas y hacer mejoramiento a su vivienda. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará u nuevo surtido de artículos electrónicos, memorias con música, controles remotos etc.  Con esta inversión ampliará el surtido  y con ello se prevee el impacto sobre sus ventas, lo que es justamente el éxito de un credikiva.
texts.en:
Emiro, aged 34, follows various occupations. He sells technology equipment, including remote controls and CDs, and he also rents washing machines in his neighbourhood—located to the southwest of the city of Barranquilla—where he lives with his wife and their four-year-old son.

Emiro has been working since he was 13 years old as his parents used to make a living working as merchants, mainly selling blankets, shoes, and all the products requested by their customers. 

Emiro works from 11:00 am to 6:00 p.m. He buys the products downtown and sells them to his customers in the bordering neighbourhoods. He does door-to-door sales, and many of his customers also go to his shop to buy. Since he pays for his products in cash, he requests his customers to pay cash too. 

His future goals are to have a shop with display cases and to make some home improvements. 

Currently, he is applying for a loan from Kiva. This is his first loan with field partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use it to buy an assortment of electronic devices, music CDs, remote controls, and the like. 

With this purchase, he will expand the range of his products—an investment he foresees will make an impact on his sales, which is precisely what a Kiva loan success story is.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of electronic devices, music CDs, remote controls, and the like.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a 44-year-old married woman from Matag-ob, Leyte. She has been running a hog-raising business for more than three years now. This is her source of income.

Juanita is asking to take a loan to buy more piglets to raise and to buy animal feed. A loan will help Juanita improve her hog-raising business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Safarmoh

texts.en:
Safarmoh is 43 years old, living in Bohtar. She lives with her husband and three children. Her husband is working abroad in Russia, while Safarmoh is home working in agriculture. She has been farming for 25 years. Every year she plants potatoes and onions. She likes this honest work. 

Safarmoh would like to take a loan to finish repairs on her house. She has managed to renovate four rooms, but has more left to complete. She wants to use the loan to buy building materials (cement, plaster, paint, doors and windows) and finish the repairs.

loans.use: to buy building materials (cement, plaster, paint, doors and windows).

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla vit à Wonyomé. Agée de 39 ans et mère de quatre enfants, Abla est mariée et cohabite avec son mari dans leur maison. Abla a pour commerce la restauration grâce aux plats de foufou et de pate qu’elle prépare pour ses clients. Abla s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché d’Adidogomé et réalise un bénéfice grâce à cette activité. Pour acheter des bols de maïs, Abla demande ce crédit pour réaliser ses objectifs et accroitre sa rentabilité.
texts.en: Abla lives in Wonyomé. 39 years old and the mother of four children, Abla is married and lives together with her husband in their house. As her business, Abla has a restaurant serving plates of foufou and pasta that she prepares for her clients. Abla stocks up once a month at the Adidogomé market and makes a profit thanks to this business. To purchase some bowls of corn, Abla is asking for this loan to reach her objectives and increase her profitability.

loans.use: to buy 67 bowls of corn.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara  es una madre de familia de 53 años de edad, tiene 8 hijos de las edades entre 9 y 37 años de edad, vive en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Clara es una madre de familia que trabaja todos los días para que a su familia no le haga falta nada es por eso que para generar sus ingresos ella se dedica a la compra y venta de pollos, esta actividad lo realiza ella desde su casa desde hace 15 años, Clara cuenta que este negocio es bastante rentable para ella, porque ella misma va criando los pollos en su casa para luego venderlos, pero en estos días Clara se ha visto a la necesidad de remodelar su casa ya que se encuentra en mal estado, pero el problema de Clara es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder realizar esta remodelación, es por ello que solicita un préstamo de  Q 5000.00 para comprar cemento, arena y hierro.
El anhelo de Clara es poder remodelar su casa este año para que su familia tenga una mejor casa, y que ella pueda mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Clara is 53 years old, she is the mother of a family with 8 children aged 9 to 37. She lives in a community in Suchitepéquez.
