She is a mother who works everyday so that her family wants for nothing.  That is why to generate an income she works from home buying and selling chicken. She has had this occupation for 15 years. Clara says that this business is quite profitable for her, since she breeds the chickens at home herself and then sells them.

Clara's house is in poor condition and lately she has realized that she needs to remodel it. But the problem is that Clara does not have enough money to go through the renovation. That is the reason why she is requesting a 5,000 GTQ loan to buy cement, sand and iron.

Clara's wish is to be able to remodel her house this year so that her family has a better place to live in and she can improve her business.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and iron to remodel her house

loans.name: Candelaria De La Paz

texts.es:
Candelaria, de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, vive con su mamá y un hermano.

Candelaria, se dedica a apoyar a su mamá con los oficios domésticos después que salió de la escuela en el 2010 y con su familia trabaja la agricultura, para el consumo familiar.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar alambre para cercar nuevamente el terreno donde cultiva, ya que cada año es necesario hacerlo, antes de cultivar, para evitar que el ganado de los vecinos, se pase al terreno de los cultivos.

Ella sueña con retomar sus estudios intermedios, el objetivo principal de ella es superarse y tener mayor capacidad intelectual, para apoyar al grupo de jóvenes de la iglesia a la que asiste.
texts.en:
Candelaria, who is 20 years old, studied through the ninth grade. She lives with her mother and brother.

Candelaria has helped her mother with household chores since leaving school in 2010. She works with her family growing food for her family to eat.

The loan will be used to buy wire to rebuild the fence surrounding the land used for cultivation. It is necessary every year to do this before planting to keep out the neighbors' chickens, who roam the fields.

She dreams of resuming her intermediate studies. Her principal objective is to succeed and to have a greater intellectual capacity in order to support the youth group at the church she attends.

loans.use: to buy wire for rebuilding the fence surrounding cropland.

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.ru: Хосияту 51 год. Она проживает на районе Чилинкул. Хосият замужем. Ее муж пастух. Ее дети находятся на заработках заграницей. Хосият уже 10 лет работает в торговой деятельности. Она занимается продажей растительных масел. От этого заработка она кормит семью. Хосият хочет хоть немного расширить бизнес и продвинуться чуть выше. Она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить больше товара на продажу и соответственно увеличить доходность от бизнеса. Без кредита она не сможет осуществить задуманное. И она надеется на Вас.
texts.en:
Khosiyat is 51 years old and lives with her husband, a shepherd, in Jilikul. Her children are migrant workers abroad. 

Khosiyat has been working for ten years in commerce. She resells vegetable oils. With her income, she feeds her family. 

She would like to expand her business a bit. She wants to take a loan to buy more goods to sell and increase her income. She is not able to do this without a loan. Khosiyat hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy vegetable oil for resale.

loans.name: Ruzigul

texts.ru: Рузигул проживает на районе Чилинкул. Ей 51 год. Рузигул замужем. С ней и ее мужем также живут дочь и сын с женой. Все ее члены семьи давно занимаются земледелием. Рузигул унаследовала эту  деятельность от своих родителей. Она родилась в семье дехканинов. Рузигул каждый год сажает сельскохозяйственные культуры и этим приносит в дом доход. В этом году у нее возникли финансовые проблемы, по которым она не сможет посадить огурцов и дыню. Она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить семена и минеральные удобрения для посева урожая. Рузигул лишится дохода, если не успеет посадить урожай и ей остается только надеется на Вас.
texts.en: Ruzigul lives in the Jilikul district. She is 51, married, and lives with her husband, daughter, son, and daughter-in-law. All the family members have been planting crops for a long time. Ruzigul was born into a family of farmers and learned from her parents. Ruzigul plants crops every year and earns income this way. This year she has had financial problems and she will not be able to plant cucumbers and melons. She applied for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers to plant for the harvest. Ruzigul will lose income if she cannot plant crops.

loans.use: to purchase melon and cucumber seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es una mujer de 38 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos varones de 18 y 6 años y una hija mujer de 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de artículos para vehículos.
Ella es buena madre, atenta, paciente, buena oyente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘16 de julio’ un área estratégica porque se desarrolla un alto flujo comercial; es una muestra de la producción de la pequeña y mediana empresa, panorama típico comercial e industrial de esa ciudad, se encuentra a una altitud de 4070 metros sobre el nivel del mar, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre  0-16 grados centígrados.
Paulina es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y con algunos clientes y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al comercio y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y adobe con techo de calamina y que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de artículos para vehículos, como; limpiaparabrisas, cargadores de celular con adaptador para auto, tapa aros, y otros artículos que los conductores siempre compran como; música, cables, etc. “mi actividad la realizo de forma ambulante en las paradas de transporte, estaciones de servicio, cualquier lugar donde existan autos estacionados…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda fija de repuestos y accesorios para autos, ella desea realizar la compra de variedad de mercadería para ofertar a sus clientes constantes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Paulina solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedad de artículos para vehículos para ofertar a sus clientes y aumentar sus ventas
texts.en:
Paulina is a 38-year old woman, who is married and has 2 sons, ages 18 and 6, and a 12-year old daughter. She makes a living selling car items. She is a good mother, caring, patient, good listener, responsible and hard-working. Her business is located in "16 de julio", an strategic area where a lot of trading activity takes place and where the typical commercial and industrial outlook of the city is represented. The city is located at 4,070m over the sea level and has cold and dry weather, with temperatures varying between 0 and 16ºC during the day. 

Paulina has tanned skin, long dark hair in a braid, dark eyes, short height, medium complexity and a traditional clothing style (hat, blanket and traditional one-piece skirt). Her mother tongue is Aymará, which she uses with her family and some clients. She also speaks Spanish for general culture and to be used in her business. She shares her life with her husband, who works as a salesman, and her children, who attend school. They live in their own house, made of brick and adobe, which has drinking water, electricity, gas and sewage system. 

She sells car items, such as windshield wipers, cell phone chargers, music, cables, etc. "I sell in bus stops, gas stations and any place where there are cars parked", she says. Her goal is to have a store of replacement parts and accessories for cars. She now wants to buy products to offer to her clients using this first loan with the institution after 6 years of activity. 

This is why she is requesting a loan to buy a variety of car items for her clients and to increase sales.

loans.use: to buy a variety of car items to offer to her clients and to increase sales.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru: Нодира молодая девушка. Ей 27 лет. Она пока не замужем. Она проживает в районе Бохтар с мамой и папой. Ее брат работает за границей. Нодира занимается шитьем женской одежды на заказ. Нодира работает дома, и параллельно ведет домашние хозяйство. Нодира талантливая девушка. Она шьет разную и стильную одежды. Она улучшить процесс работы, это окажет влияние на качество ее услуг, и привлечь себе больше клиентов. Она просит кредит для приобретения новой модернизированной швейной машинки. Из-за нехватки денег она обратилась за кредитом
texts.en:
Nodira is a 27-year-old young woman who is not yet married. She lives in Bohtar with her mother and father. Her brother works outside the country. 

Nodira makes women's clothing to order. She works at home, where she also does household chores. She is a talented woman who sews various fashionable styles. Nodira would like to improve her work process and product, which will attract more customers. She is asking for a loan to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a 51-year-old married woman and a mother of four grown-up children from Matag-ob, Leyte. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Luzviminda has been in the business for more than four years now.

Luzviminda would like to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries, condiments, cooking oil, and snack foods. This loan will enable her to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store.

In the future, Luzviminda hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries, condiments, cooking oil, and snack foods.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a 28-year-old married mother of 2 children from Leyte, Philippines. She is engaged in cooking and selling snack foods to the people in her community. 

Marife is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients such as flour, sugar, cooking oil, baking soda, butter, milk, etc. A loan will allow her to cook and sell more food to her customers, thus augmenting both her sales and income.  

Marife dreams of a brighter future with her family.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as flour, sugar, cooking oil, baking soda, butter, milk, etc.

loans.name: Asaf Group

texts.es:
Los integrantes del grupo "ASAF" habitan en una comunidad de comerciantes por excelencia. Los habitantes siempre buscan el tipo de mercancía que más se vende dependiendo de la temporada y viajan hasta otras ciudades dejando sus hogares durante semanas o incluso un mes completo. El nombre que eligieron los para identificarse es de origen bíblico y significa "Unión". 

Angélica es una mujer muy alegre y responsable, tiene 32 años y está casada con Enrique. Angélica es madre de 3 niños, 2 ya se encuentran estudiando, mientras que la menor aún no tiene la edad para asistir a la escuela. 

Ella aprendió la actividad de comerciante gracias sus padres, desde muy pequeña veía a su padres acomodar la mercancía y prepáranandose para salir a vender. El tipo de producto que más vende son controles remoto para aparatos elecrtónicos y en temporada de invierno, medias y ropa. Actualmente sigue vendiendo sus productos caminando por las calles, en pequeños mercados y en las plazas de las comunidades cercanas. Para Angélica no es una opción asentarse en un local para vender, ella siempre ha preferido llegar hasta donde están sus clientes en lugar de esperarlos, ya está acostumbrada a la actividad. 

Las dificultades a las que se enfrentan los comerciantes ambulantes como Angélica es al clima, a las autoridades que no los dejan vender fácilmente en cualquier lugar y que les exigen cuotas. También se encuentran las temporadas de ventas bajas que ya tienen bien identificadas. Los próximos cuatro meses serán un poco difíciles para Angélica, sin embargo necesita prepararse y comprar más controles para seguir vendiendo y obtener un poco de ingresos para su familia.

Angélica se siente muy agradecida por los préstamos ya que han permitido invertir en mercancía y aumentar sus ganancias. Con sus ahorros logró mejorar su casa. Ella sigue soñando con hacer crecer su actividad y le gustaría poder ofrecer empleo a más personas en su comunidad para que le ayuden a vender su mercancía en los puntos donde ella aún no ha ido o para cubrir sus rutas con mayor facilidad. 

*En la imagen: las integrantes sentadas al pie del quiosco en el centro del municipio donde viven, cerca se encuentran también una fuente, el palacio de gobierno y la iglesia católica. Angélica viste un suéter rosa.
texts.en:
The women of the “Asaf” group are a great community of merchants. They always seek the merchandise that is in highest demand depending upon the season, and they sometimes travel to other cites leaving their homes for weeks, sometimes a month at a time. The name they chose for themselves is of biblical origin, and means “unity”.

Angélica is a happy and responsible woman. She is 32 years old, and married to Enrique. Angélica is the mother of three children. Two of them are already in school, while the youngest is not yet of school age. She learned how to be a business person thanks to her parents. From a very early age, she watched them as they arranged merchandise and prepared to go out and sell it. The products that are sold the most are remote controls for electronic devices, and in the winter, socks and clothing.

She currently still sells her merchandise walking along the streets, in small markets and in the squares of neighboring communities. For Angélica, settling in one place to sell her products is not an option. She has always preferred going to her customers rather than waiting for them to come to her, since she’s used to it this way.

Traveling vendors like Angélica face difficulties caused by weather and authorities who do not permit them to sell their wares freely in some places, or demand that they pay fees. They also face periods of low sales, which they know well how to anticipate. The next four months will be a bit difficult for Angélica, nonetheless, she needs to prepare herself and buy more remote controls in order to keep selling and earn some small amount of income for her family.

Angélica is very grateful for the loans, which have helped her invest in merchandise and increase her earnings. With her savings, she has been able to make improvements on her house. She continues to dream of being able to grow her business. She’d also like to be able to offer employment to more people in her community so that they can help her sell her merchandise in places she has yet to reach, or help her cover her routes more easily. In the picture, the members of the group are seated at the foot of the kiosk in the center of the town where they live. Nearby are a fountain, the governmental palace and the Catholic church. Angélica is wearing a pink sweater.

loans.use: to buy remote controls.

location.town: San Agustin San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a 36-year-old married woman and the mother of eight children. She is from Matag-ob, Leyte. She makes a living through her sari-sari (small retail store business), selling various goods and foodstuffs to the people in her place. Lilibeth has been in the business for more than four years now.

Lilibeth is asking to take a loan to buy more merchandise to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and snack foods, cooking oil and condiments. A loan will help her to improve her inventory, thus attracting more buyers to her store.

Lilibeth dreams of making her business more successful and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and snack foods, cooking oil and condiments

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is a farmer, a wife, and the mother of four children ranging in age between 9 and 24 years. Her husband owns a 2-acre piece of land in Mitheru, Kenya. Doreen made use of her 15 years of experience in farming by introducing dairy, poultry, tea and banana farming on her 10-acre piece of land. Her main incomes come from tea and milk.

Doreen is seeking a loan investment from Kiva lenders to grow her dairy business. She will use the money to buy a grade dairy cow, which will increase the volume of the milk she supplies by nearly 50%. Income generated from this investment will boost their family income and afford them a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ana Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa, de 59 años de edad, está casada, no estudio porque era la mayor de sus hermanos y tenía que apoyar a su mamá a cuidar a sus hermanos menores, está acompañada y vive con sus tres hijos,

Josefa, trabaja la agricultura como medio de subsistencia, para sembrar tiene que pagar mano de obra que le ayuda con algunas tareas más pesadas, lo demás lo hace ella con sus hijas.

Con este préstamo comprará de toda talla de ropa, para que su hija mayor salga a vender por las casas de su comunidad.

Josefa, desea que sus hijas sean independientes y sepan afrontar cualquier dificultad en la vida.
texts.en:
Josefa is 59 years old, married and lives with her three children.  She didn't go to school because she was the oldest of her siblings and had to help her mother care for the younger children.

Josefa works in agriculture as a means of subsistence.  To plant she has to pay for labour to help her with some of the heavier tasks.  The rest she does with her daughters.

With this loan she will buy all sizes of clothing for her oldest daughter to sell house-to-house in the community.

Josefa wishes that her daughters be independent and know how to deal with whatever difficulties they encounter in life.

loans.use: to buy all sizes of clothing to sell

loans.name: Phoebe's Group

texts.en:
Phoebe, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 30 years, and she is now proud to represent her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She is 74 years old and is married with 7 children.

Phoebe likes to think of herself as a very experienced farmer. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. She plans to use the profits from this coming season to repair her home.

In total, Phoebe’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 4.75 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve maize harvests.

loans.name: Umesh

texts.en:
Umesh is a 31-year-old differently able man who lives with his parents, wife, and one child in a small village of Sundergarh district, Odisha.

He owns a small grocery shop in his house. There are only two grocery shops in his village, so the demand for goods is very high, but he has not any other financial support to enhance this business. He wants to expand his grocery shop by adding new products so that he can cater to the demand of the customers.

Umesh has requested a loan of 30,000 INR to purchase a fridge and add cold drinks in his grocery store. He hopes to do well in this business, and he is thankful to Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge and add cold drinks in his grocery store.

loans.name: Karunakar

texts.en:
Karunakar is 47 years old and is a differently able man. He lives with his wife and two children in a small colony of Rourekela city of Sundergarh district, Odisha.

He owns a grocery shop near to his house where he sells basic household items such as sugar, biscuits, edible oil, flour, rice, chocolates, spices, packaged food, etc. He also sells vegetables and earns 7,000 to 8,000 INR per month. His current income is not sufficient for his family’s expenses, as his two children are in school, and his family lives in a city.

Karunakar has requested a loan of 40,000 INR to purchase a big fridge to keep perishable goods and also add more products in his grocery store.

He hopes to do well in his business. He is grateful to the Kiva lenders for this support.

loans.use: to purchase a big fridge to keep perishable goods and add more products in his grocery store.

loans.name: Fatima Yuditza

texts.es:
Fatima es una mujer de 20 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de 2 hijos de las edades entre 3 y 4 años los pequeños aún no están estudiando, viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Fatima es una señora que ama a su familia y para que no les haga falta nada ella trabaja para generar sus ingresos, Fatima se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su propia casa pues en el lugar donde ella vive mucha gente compra su tortilla, esta labor lo realiza ella desde hace 2 años, cuando se vio a la necesidad de hacerlo, pues con lo que gana el esposo no les alcanzaba ya para mantener a su familia, pero gracias a este pequeño negocio, ha mejorado sus ingresos, Pero Fatima se ha visto a la necesita de un pequeño cuarto, pero lamentablemente ella no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder construir su cuarto es por eso que ella solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar laminas, y tendales para construir su pequeño cuarto.
Para Fatima no hay nada mejor que poder construir su pequeño cuarto pues tanto para ella como su familia es muy importante.
texts.en:
Fatima is a 20-year-old woman who is married and has a lovely family with two children between the ages of three and four years. The children are not studying as yet. They live in the community of Solola.

Fatima is a woman who loves her family and to assure that they lack nothing essential, she works to generate added income. Fatima sells tortillas in her own home, as in the location where she lives, many people buy tortillas. She has done this work since two years ago, when she realized that it was necessary. What her husband earned was insufficient to maintain the family. Thanks to Fatima's small business, their income has increased. 

And now, Fatima sees the need for a small room, but, lamentably, she lacks sufficient money to construct it. That is why she is requesting a loan to be utilized to purchase sheet metal and roof supports for the construction of her small room.

For Fatima, nothing would be better than constructing this small room. Fatima and her family consider it very important.

loans.use: buy metal sheeting and roof supports for the construction of a room.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of five grown up children from Leyte, Philippines. She is  engaged in retail sales of bananas. 

Patricia has been in the business for more than 20 years now. Patricia is asking to take out a loan to buy more bananas to sell. 

Patricia has hopes of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a 37-year-old married woman from Matag-ob, Leyte. She is engaged in the hog raising business. This is the source of her income. Rowena’s husband works as a construction worker. 

Rowena is asking to take out a loan to buy more piglets to raise and to buy animal feed. A loan will help her improve her hog raising business, thus augmenting her profit and income. 

In the future, Rowena dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Johana

texts.en:
Johana is 37 years old. He is married with four children. He has had a retail shop business for eight years.

Johana has applied for his sixth loan of KES 60,000. He will be using the loan to purchase more stock of assorted retail goods to add to his stock and sell to his customers. He hopes this will help him educate his children.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to grow his business and be financially stable, and to be able to educate his children to a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of assorted retail goods to add to his stock and sell to his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer so she can plant more maize and vegetables.

loans.name: Ebby

texts.en:
Ebby is a 31-year-old single woman who has operated a transport service as well as a retail shop for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of KES.30,000. 

Ebby has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya for KES. 110,000 to purchase a new motorbike. She hopes this will help her to increase her stock of retail goods as well as ply new routes to offer more transport services to her clients. 

Ebby's hopes and dreams for the future are to be financially stable and self-sufficient.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Rubirosa

texts.en:
Rubirosa is a 44-year-old married woman, and a mother of three grown up children from Leyte, Philippines. Rubirosa earns a living through her retail sales of gasoline. Rubirosa has been in the business for more than 10 years now. 

Rubirosa is asking to take out a loan to buy more gasoline to sell. In the future, Rubirosa has hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more gasoline to sell.

loans.name: David's Group

texts.en:
David is a proud 55-year-old father of five children. A group leader described as a very hardworking individual, he is representing his group of 13 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, David has been able to consistently feed his family.

David described his harvest last year as good, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, David plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, David’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land and purchase a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Basyam1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Basyam1 est formé de 5 femmes qui exercent plusieurs activités en vue d'assurer un bien être économique et social et celui de leur famille. Mariam est la responsable de ce groupe, elle est veuve et mère de 5 enfants dont 1 marié, 2 travaillent et 2 continuent d'aller à l'école. Cette brave dame fait des frites de la banane plantain pour vendre. Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter la banane pour ses frites. A l'issue de ses ventes, ses bénéfice lui permettront de s'occuper de ses  enfants, d'assurer la provision quotidienne et de soigner ses enfants en cas de maladie.
texts.en: The Basyam1 group is made up of five women who run several businesses in order to assure the economic and social well-being of their families. Mariam is the leader of the group. She is widowed and the mother of five children, one of whom is married, two of whom work and two of whom continue to go to school. This brave woman makes banana plantain fries to sell. She needs this loan to buy bananas for these fries. From these sales, her profits will allow her to take care of her children, ensure her daily stock, and care for her children in case of illness.

loans.use: to purchase banana plantains in order to make fried plantains to sell.

loans.name: Justine's Group

texts.en:
Justine is 26 years old, and is often described as a very friendly person. She has three children, and is married. As a group leader, Justine is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Justine's desire to earn enough to feed her family. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

Justine and her group will receive a total of nine solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 5.75 acres."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Varazi

texts.en:
Varazi, 31 years old, lives with his wife and little daughter in the village of Nokalakevi,  Varazi earns his family's living as an artisan, generating 200 GEL monthly. His wife also helps him by taking care of cattle. 

Because the family doesn't have enough income to cover all daily costs, Varazi needs financial support to purchase a stock of products and start a food-production business. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan will greatly assist Varazi in improving his economic situation and giving his family a better style of life.

loans.use: To increase the family's income and start a food production business.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
BAKARY est l’homme  sur la photo qui a la  main sur la brebis. BAKARY est un  malien  non scolarisé. Il est âgé de 41 ans, marié. Sa femme est  ménagère. Père de 06 enfants dont  02 scolarisés.
Il fait l’élevage et  vend une boutique (farines,  l’huile,  sucre, des boites de  lait, des bonbons... etc.). Depuis 10 ans il exerce ces  activités. 
Il prend le prêt avec RMCR pour acheter  les moutons et beaucoup d’articles de boutique  pour revendre. Il s’approvisionne dans un marché loin de son village et revend dans sa localité de résidence,  qui lui permet de satisfaire ses  clients. Le profit lui permet de prendre en charge les frais de scolarité et de santé de ses enfants…etc. Il rencontre  des problèmes d’impayés souvent de la part de certains de ces clients. Dans l’avenir BAKARY  veut  avoir un prêt plus élevé pour développer ses  activités  de commerce, d’élevage et  satisfaire plus les besoins de la clientèle et celle de sa famille.
texts.en: Bakary is the man in the photo with his hand on the ewe. Bakary is a Malian who did not attend school. He is 41 years old and married. His wife is a housekeeper. He is the father of six children, two of whom are in school. He raises animals and sells goods in a shop (flours, oil, sugar, bottles of milk, candies, etc.) He has run these businesses for ten years. He is taking a loan with RMCR to buy sheep and many items for his shop in order to resell them. He stocks up in the market far from his village and resells in his home location, which allows him to satisfy his clientele. The profit will allow him to take care of his children's educational and health costs, etc. He often meets with problems of nonpayment on the part of some of these clients. In the future, Bakary wants to have a higher loan to develop his business activities, raise his animals and meet the needs his clientele and his family.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and merchandise for a shop in order to resell them.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 32 years old, and he is married with 1 child. He has been running his retail shop business for 3 years, which has been profitable. 

Amos will be using his loan to purchase retail goods such as flour, cooking oil, rice, and sugar to sell to his customers and earn more income. He will also use part of his loan to pay his child's school fees. 

Amos hopes this will help him meet his customers' demands and needs as well as increase his income and be able to continue paying his child's school fees. 

Amos' hopes and dreams for the future are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, cooking oil, and sugar to meet his customers' needs and demands.

loans.name: Innocente

texts.en:
Innocente is 36 years old.  She is married with two children ages six and eight.  They both go to school.  

She is a farmer, and she has been producing rice for 18 years. Her husband is a business man. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land for farming and to increase her savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers.

loans.name: Irma Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela, de 24 años de edad,  estudio hasta noveno grado,  está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, es madre de dos hijos 4 años de edad y de 6 meses de nacido.

Mariela, tiene un puesto en el mercado, vende pan orneado, tiene 4 años de dedicarse a esta actividad.- Ella analizo y se dio cuenta que no había un puesto de venta de pan en el mercado, por lo tanto tomo la decisión de colocar este negocio.- También, tiene otro negocio propio en donde hace pasteles y panes con pollo para vender.

El préstamo será invertido para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de los pasteles y los panes, ya que ha tenido otros gastos y se ha quedado sin dinero para trabajar.

El deseo de Mariela es, hacer crecer sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mariela is 24 years old.  She went to school up to the ninth grade.  She is in a relationship and her partner works in agriculture.  She is the mother of two children, a four-year-old and a six-month old.

Mariela has a stall in the market.  She sells baked bread.  She has been doing this for four years. She had analyzed and realized that there wasn't a stall selling bread in the market and thus made the decision to locate this business there.  She also has another business where she makes pastries and breads with chicken to sell.

She will invest this loan in buying raw materials for the making of the pastries and the breads since she has had other expenses which have left her without money to work.

Mariela's wish is to increase her sales and to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy the raw material to make pastries and breads

loans.name: Frederick

texts.en:
Fredric, aged 32 years,  is married with one child, who is two years of age. He is a farmer, and he has been producing rice for 13 years.  His wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers.

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 49 years old. He is married with six children ages between four and 26 years. They all go to school. He is a farmer, and he has been producing rice for 25 years. His wife is also a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land and to improve his welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers.

loans.name: Virginie

texts.en:
Virginie is age 28. She is married with one child, 2 years old. She is a farmer and she has been producing rice for 11 years. Her husband is also a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, she wants to pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land for farming

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Masindi-Uganda. She is married with 3 children. She operates a beauty salon, a business she started to provide for her family's needs. 

Inadequate capital is still a challenge that hinders her dream of making it a modern salon, to be able to even offer bridal services. 

Harriet needs a loan to buy cosmetics to use in her salon and to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to use in her salon and to sell.

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John is 74 years old and, as the group leader of his group, he is representing 10 farmers in Kakamega North District. He is looking forward to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year, as this means he will earn enough to feed his family. 

John has been a farmer for more than 40 years and is often described as a very friendly person. He decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. With the profits he will earn from this coming season, John would like to buy more land to cultivate.

Between the 10 farmers in John’s Group, a total of 6.75 acres will be planted using the inputs from this loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve his harvests of maize.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah, pictured above, has been a farmer for 15 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 13 farmers in Kakamega North District. She is 37 years old, married, and has 5 children.

Sarah likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Sarah plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Sarah’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 9 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve her harvests of maize.

loans.name: Ulalo Group

texts.en:
Sarah is 37 years old. She has four children and looks after three orphans. 

Sarah used to be a housewife and obtaining loans helped her to start up a new business. She sells chickens and depends on this business for her daily needs and for the provision of her children’s welfare. 

She started this business in order to be economically empowered and independent. She will use the loan to expand her business by purchasing more chickens and chicken feed.

Sarah plans to hire someone to help her in running her business and hopes to start selling wholesale. The loans have helped her to become independent, and she is now able to pay school fees for some of her children without facing any challenges.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: 21 De Septiembre Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “21 DE SEPTIEMBRE II” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Margarita es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de comida, servicio de construcción, venta de salchipapas, venta de frutas. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Margarita es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años al estudiar en una institución y posteriormente trabaje en un domicilio, ya con experiencia decidió ahorrar para implementar su negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra refrigerador y garrafa) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la facilidad de la obtención del crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “21 DE SEPTIEMBRE II” communal bank will begin its third cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Centro Focal Panamericana. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors of which Margarita is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied. Among them are selling blankets, selling food, construction services, selling salchipapas, and selling fruit. 

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-business women, including Margarita. She says that she joined Pro Mujer eight years ago at the invitation of a friend, who is a client of the institution. Right now, she has a business selling food. She says that she started this business several years ago after studying in an institution and later working in a home. With experience, she decided to to save to open her independent business.

The loan she will take out now is to increase capital by buying a refrigerator and a gas tank. She will acquire them from sellers in the city of El Alto and later install them in her sales space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to help her family financially, since she is a widow and has four children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the ease of taking out loans in the institution.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and a gas tank.

loans.name: Flores De Ventilla Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLORES DE VENTILLA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cinturones y cordones, venta de pan y empanadas, venta de banderas, venta de cosméticos, venta de refrescos y salteñas, venta de accesorios, venta de material de plásticos, venta de salteñas y humintas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lidia es integrante, ella indica que es el primer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia, al observar que estos productos eran ampliamente comercializados en el mercado. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cosméticos por mayor) que adquirirá de empresas distribuidoras de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará a solicitud del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "FLORES DE VENTILLA" will begin its second loan cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the regional office of Santiago II. It is comprised of 8 members and led by a board of directors where Lidia is president. The businesses that the members carry out are varied, among them being: the sale of belts and cords, the sale of bread and "empanadas" (turnovers), the sale of flags, the sale of cosmetics, the sale of soft drinks and "salteñas" (baked turnovers), the sale of accessories, the sale of plastic materials, and the sale of "salteñas" and "humitas" (traditional baked corn tamales).

The loan they are taking out will benefit the small microenterprises where Lidia is a member. She states that this is the first year that she has been a part of Pro Mujer, having been invited by a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a cosmetic sales business. She informs us that she started this business several years ago by her own initiative, upon seeing that these products were being sold widely.

The loan that she will take out is part of a capital increase (buying wholesale cosmetics) with which she will acquire the products from distributors in La Paz and later sell them upon customer request.

Her way of working allows her to generate revenue to support her family financially, since she is married and has two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale cosmetics

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 41-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District. 

Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Elizabeth has noticed that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Elizabeth described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 

She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. 

With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Elizabeth’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for milk production so as to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Featured in the above picture is Joseph, who has been a farmer for more than 20 years. Although he is pictured alone, he is actually representing his group of 9 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Joseph has always been described as a very hardworking individual, which is largely why he was selected to be the group leader.

Joseph started working with One Acre Fund for the first time in 2014, and this year he decided to not only get farming inputs but also a solar light as part of his loan. 

He is very excited about this new addition, as now he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. He can’t wait to send his children to school using the profits he earns from this coming season. 

Joseph’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6 acres using the farming inputs obtained with this loan, and will also receive a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve his harvests of maize.

loans.name: Anastase

texts.en:
Anastase is 33 years old. He is married with four children between the ages of 1 and 9 years. Two of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been producing rice for 13 years. His wife is also a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land and to improve his welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers.

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en:
Augustin is 29 years old. He is married with 2 children, ages 3 months and 3 years. He is a farmer and he has been producing rice for 11 years. His wife is also a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers. The profits from the business will be used to pay more workers.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Elda

texts.es:
Elda madre de dos niños de las edades de entre 1 y 6 años de edad, tiene 28 años es casa vive junto a su esposo en una comunidad de Santo Tomás la unión.
Elda a pesar de ser una madre de familia muy joven lucha día a día por darle lo mejor a su familia, la situación económica de su familia es bastante critica, y su esposo con lo que gana no logra mantenerlos es por eso que ella desde hace 1 año busco trabajo y ahora es una facilitadora en una ONG de su comunidad, para ellas esta actividad es bastante rentable porque con lo que gana apoya a su esposo al mantenimiento de su familia,  ella desde hace algunos meses ha visto la necesidad de una cocina porque ella no tiene un lugar adecuado donde pueda preparar los alimentos para sus hijos, entonces ella y su esposo sean puesto de acuerdo para solicitar un préstamo para poder comprar cemento, bloc, arena, piedrín y hierro.
El gran sueño de Elda es poder tener su cocina donde ella pueda cocinar adecuadamente y sanamente la alimentación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elda is mother to two children aged 1 and 6. She is 28-years old and lives with her husband in the community of Santo Tomás La Unión.

Despite being a young mother, she works hard every day to give the best she can to her family. The financial situation of the family is extremely difficult; Elda’s husband does not earn enough to support the family. For this reason a year ago Elda looked for work and now has a job as a facilitator for a local NGO. This has been very beneficial because with what she earns, Elda can help her husband support the family.

A few months ago she saw the need for a kitchen because she doesn’t have a suitable place to prepare food for her children. Now she and her husband are in agreement about seeking a loan to buy cement, concrete blocks, sand, gravel, and metal bars.

Elda’s greatest wish is to have a kitchen where she can properly and safely cook food for her children.

loans.use: buy cement, concrete blocks, sand, and metal bars

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
Valentin es un hombre de 35 años de edad es casado tiene una linda familia de 3 hijos de las edades entre 5 y 14 años de edad, vive en una comunidad de San Pablo Jocopilas.
Velentin  es un padre de familia muy trabajador y dedicado, el desde hace 10 años se dedica a la albañilería construyendo casas, muros y todo lo relacionado con construcción pero según cuenta Valentin esta actividad para él no es suficiente para sus ingresos, es por eso que hace algún tiempo tiene en su casa un molino de nixtamal, y este pequeño negocio para él es bastante rentable, pero el en este momento quiere mejorar sus servicios de nixtamal entonces quiere construir un lugar más específico para el molino pero con lo que le gana y sus ganancias no le alcanza, entonces él ha decidido realizar un préstamo que lo utilizara para comparar cemento, arena bloc y hierro.
El gran anhelo de Valentin es poder realizar esta inversión y que sus ingresos mejoren para seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Valentin is a 35 year old man. He is married and has a beautiful family of 3 children, aged 5 to 14. He lives in a community of San Pablo Jocopilas.

Valentin is a very hard working and dedicated husband and father. For 10 years, he has worked in bricklaying, building houses, walls and everything related to construction. However, according Valentin, this activity isn't enough for his income. That is why for some time he has had a nixtamal mill in his house. This little business is very profitable for him. At this time, he wants to improve his nixtamal services, so he wants to build more specific place for the mill. However, his earnings aren't enough, so he has decided to take out a loan which he will use to buy cement, sand, blocks and iron. 

Valentin's biggest wish is to be able to make this investment and for his income to improve so he can keep helping his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, blocks and iron.

loans.name: Yanelis Candelaria

texts.es: Yanelis de 42 años de edad, conforma su hogar con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 7 11 y 17 años. Desde el año 2000, se dedica a la comercialización de artículos de uso doméstico,  cosméticos y perfumería en general, mediante guías especializadas de productos o catálogos, a través de los cuales promueve los artículos, ofreciendo créditos todos los días, sin tener un horario definido pues es a la medida de las necesidades de su clientela. Sus compras las hace en laboratorios, y a empresas multinacionales, y vende a una clientela que ha construido poco a poco y está conformada por amigos, vecinos, familiares y cada vez más nuevos clientes referenciados.  Su meta más adelante es lograr un mayor crecimiento de su mercado,  y que su clientela aumenten las solicitudes de pedidos, para Yanelis en todos los días hay grandes desafíos y lo importante es no desfallecer y afrontarlos en cada momento.   En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, ´primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará colonias, talcos, perfumes, útiles de aseo para el hogar, todo esto con el fin de incrementar sus ventas, para generar un éxito importante en su inversión.
texts.en: Yanelis is 42 years old. Her home is shared by her spouse and their 3 children, aged 7, 11 and 17. Since 2000, she has worked selling domestic use items, cosmetics and perfume in general, via specialized product guides or catalogues. With these, she promotes the products, offers credit every day, and works without a set schedule but according to her customers' needs. She makes her purchases in laboratories and multinational companies, and she sells to a clientele that she has built up little by little and which is made up of friends, neighbors, relatives and more and more customers that have been referred to her. Her goal in the future is to have more growth in her market, and for her clientele to increase the amount of their orders. For Yanelis there are big challenges every day and the important thing is not to falter and to face them every time. Right now, she is asking for a Kiva loan, the first loan she has taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will buy colognes, perfumes, powders, and cleaning supplies for the home. All of this is to increase her sales to generate an important success in her investment.

loans.use: to buy colognes, perfume, and cleaning supplies for the home.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel, de 43 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad, su pareja es ama de casa.

Miguel, se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos, tiene 5 años dedicándose a eso, tiene su puesto de venta en el parqueo de la ciudad.

Miguel, necesita el crédito para comprar más mercadería para su negocio, él quiere tener más variedad de producto y así ofrecer más a sus clientes y obtener más ingresos.
 
Los sueños de Miguel, son que su negocio crezca, conseguir un local más formal y en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
43-year old Miguel is married and has a 4-year old son. His wife works in their home.

To earn his living Miguel sells clothing and footwear, a job he’s had for five years. His stall is located in the town’s parking lot.

He now needs a loan to buy more merchandise for his business as he wishes to carry a greater variety of items to offer his customers and earn more money.

Miguel’s greatest wishes are to see his business grow, and to obtain more permanent premises in better repair for his business.

loans.use: buy a greater variety of clothing for his business

loans.name: Abdirasul

texts.ru:
Абдирасул жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина  в возрасте 40 лет. Он женат и имеет 4-ех детей. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Сам Абдирасул живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Жена Абдирасула также не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей.
Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание,Абдирасул занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. От данного бизнеса он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Абдирасулу в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота.  Сейчас Абдирасул хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Абдирасул очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Abdirasul is a happy and hardworking 40-year-old man. He is married and has 4 children. He comes to Arvand for the first time, after finding out that there was an opportunity to receive financial support. Abdirasul lives with his family in a rural area. He does not have a college education because he did not have an opportunity to study at a university due to financial difficulties in his family. Abdirasul's wife also does not have education and is a homemaker; she is involved in house work and raising the children.

To provide income and support his family, Abdirasul is involved in his own business. He is involved in fattening up and selling cattle. He earns a good income from this business. His wife also helps him with the business. She sells milk obtained from the livestock. Now Abdirasul wants to increase his livestock quantities in order to expand his business. This is why he came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy livestock. Abdirasul really hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to expand his business

loans.name: Cendrine

texts.en:
Cendrine is 35 years old. She is married and has four children between the ages of 2 and 11. Two of them go to school. She is a farmer and he has been producing rice for 16 years. Her husband is a business man. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine is 24 years old. She is married. She is a farmer and has been producing rice for 9 years. Her husband is a businessman. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers.

loans.name: Valens

texts.en:
Valens is 24 years old. He is married with one child age of 2 years. He is a farmer and he has been producing rice for 6 years. His wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers.

loans.name: Azamjon

texts.ru: Аъзамчон жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 26 лет. Он женат и имеет одного ребенка. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку. Сам Аъзамчон живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Жена Аъзамчона также не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей. Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Аъзамчон занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Также Аъзамчон  подрабатывает мастером. От данного бизнеса он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Аъзамчону в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота. Сейчас Аъзамчон хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Аъзамчон очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Azamjon is a happy and hardworking 26-year-old man. He is married and has one child. He comes to Arvand for the first time, upon finding out that there was an opportunity to receive financial support. Azamjon lives with his family in a rural area. He does not have a college education because he did not have an opportunity to study at a university due to financial difficulties in his family. Azamjon's wife also does not have education and is a homemaker; she is involved in house work and raising the children. To provide income and support his family, Azamjon is involved in his own business. He is involved in fattening up and selling cattle. Azamjon also works part-time as a contractor. He earns a good income from this business. His wife also helps him with the business. She sells milk obtained from the livestock. Now Azamjon wants to increase his livestock quantities in order to expand his business. This is why he came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy livestock. Azamjon really hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to expand his business

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 47 years old. She is married with seven children aged between 4 and 25 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been producing rice for 21 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a male Ugandan aged 41 years. He is married with 6 children between 15 and 5 years of age. Four of his children attend school. He has struggled to get where he is. He attributes his success to UGAFODE having supported him. He started small but with a continuous financial boost he has graduated to a trading center.

Joseph is a businessman who deals in phone accessories at a street in town. He also does agriculture to supplement the income from the business since it is meager and his family is big.

Joseph is applying for a loan of UGX 4,500,000 to buy phone accessories to add to his stock to get better returns.

Joseph's dream for the future is to expand his business and to educate all his children up to university level.

Joseph describes himself as a hardworking and honest person in business and society as a whole. He appreciates the support from Kiva lenders and prays to God to bless them.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories.

loans.name: Maria Simona

texts.es:
María, de 38 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 4 hijos, es una mujer muy luchadora.

María, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero también es comerciante de productos de belleza de mujer, este negocio le permite obtener ingresos económicos adicionales, de los que recibe por el apoyo de su compañero de vida.

Con el préstamo María comprará productos de belleza para su negocio.

María, desea apoyar a sus hijos, para que puedan optar por una carrera universitaria y cumplir el sueño de toda madre en el mundo, que es ver triunfar a sus  hijos.
texts.en: Maria is 38 years old. She has a domestic partner and four children. She is a very hardworking woman. Maria does household chores, but she also works selling women's beauty products. With this business she earns additional income to the earnings brought in by her life partner. With the loan Maria will buy beauty products for her business. Maria wants to support her children so that they opt for a college education, and fulfill the dream of every mother: to see her children succeed.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Hurshed

texts.ru:
Хуршед жизнерадостный мужчина 31 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. У него среднее образование. Хуршед    зарабатывает разнорабочим себе и жене на проживание.  Он очень  хороший , добрый  и в своей  семье  любящий муж.  Он очень стремительный и трудолюбивый .
В данное время Хуршед хочет построить дом, где будут хорошие условия для проживания. Для этого Хуршед обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для построения дома. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Hurshed is a happy 31-year-old man. He is married and has two children. He has a secondary education. Hurshed earns a living for himself and his wife working as a laborer. He is very good, kind and loving husband in his family. He is very driven and hardworking. At the present time, Hurshed wants to build a house with good living conditions. This is why Hurshed came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy construction materials to build a house. He hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to build a house

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en:
Augustin is 37 years old. He is married with 4 children aged between 1 and 10 years. Two of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been producing rice for 18 years. His wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers.

loans.name: Panorwanzou Group

texts.en: Lucia is a single mother of 3 children. She is in the business of selling groceries and has had a road side stall which she has been operating for 2 years now. Lucia and her group members all have small businesses which they are running in order to provide for their families. Although they are all hardworking women, Lucia faced challenges in growing her business after her husband left her. Lucia was unable to manage her business and take care of her children. This led to her business crumbling as most funds were diverted to her household consumption needs. After hearing about Thrive, Lucia and her friends took part in the training. She is now able to make the necessary changes to her business. By starting to save, completing her daily record sheet, and budgeting, Lucia hopes to see a positive change in her business. She is also grateful for the loan she received from Thrive as she can now grow her business. Her hope is to be able to provide her children with proper education to make a solid foundation for their future.

loans.use: to increase her range of stock.

loans.name: Simuka Mudzimai Group

texts.en:
Simuka Mudzimai, meaning 'Women, Rise up', is a group of three ladies in Mufakose, a suburb of Harare. They formed a group and attended training sessions at Thrive which helped them start a savings plan. They cherish their group relationship and, as a team, they have been helping each other to achieve, more mainly through motiving each other and sharing ideas.

Kimilatu lives with her two daughters and her younger sister. She is divorced and the only breadwinner for her family. For the past seven years, she has been surviving with a cross border trading business selling clothes, blankets and electrical appliances which she buys from Botswana and South Africa.

Her business started improving after she took a loan from Thrive and enabled her to generate enough income to sustain her family needs. With high hopes, she looks forward to setting up her own boutique in the community, which will not only meet the high demand for local fashion, but also create employment.

With her profits she is aiming to extend two more bedrooms for her house, to cater for the accommodation needs of her family. She hopes that a loan of $500 from Kiva will help her achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy more goods for resale.

loans.name: Goshen Group

texts.en:
Eunice, 37, is a member of the Goshen group. Eunice specialises in buying and selling chickens and she has been in the business for 4 years now. She and her group members joined Thrive in 2013 and are now on their third loan. They recall that before they joined Thrive, their businesses were very small. They had constant challenges with lack of adequate capital to grow their businesses. After joining Thrive, they have since grown their businesses. Eunice is now able to buy and re-sell various kinds of chickens which include broilers and layers. She is now able to sell up to 200 birds every week.

This improvement in her business has enabled Eunice to help taking care of her children. She highlights that their quality of life has been greatly enhanced. Eunice also has been able to buy various assets which include a motor vehicle. This has increased the effectiveness and efficiency of her business.

Eunice and her group members are very grateful for the lessons they received at Thrive. She is now a strong business woman who keeps daily records of her business transactions as well as keeping regular savings. Her future plans are to increase her business by buying a stand where she can operate freely.

loans.use: to continue the expansion of her poultry wholesale business.

loans.name: Posiano

texts.en:
Posiano is a 42-year-old client married with six children, having four attending school. He does coffee trade as his major source of income, and he has been doing this business for a period of 15 years, however, limited capital has hindered the expansion of his business. 

Posiano decided to join UGAFODE for financial assistance so as to expand his business. He applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to buy more coffee to make a profit from coffee sales. Posiano hopes to expand his business using the loan facility from UGAFODE. He appreciates UGAFODE and Kiva lenders in their support to fight poverty.

loans.use: To buy coffee to sell

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en:
Jovia lives in Masindi-Uganda, she is married with 2 children.

Jovia does cattle fattening alongside selling clothes to cater for her increasing family needs. As a loving mother, she dreams of educating her children to high learning institutions, however inadequate capital is still a challenge hindering her business returns.

Jovia needs a loan to buy cows for fattening.

loans.use: to buy cows to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a MIGS (member in good standing) member of PMPC. She is 40 years old and married. She has a snack vending business in Gala, Ozamiz City. This is how she supports her family with a meager income of PHP 6,000 per month. Recently, Jocelyn obtained a loan to buy paint and building materials. She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy paint and building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new maize-milling machine.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 28 years old. She resides in Calatunan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and blessed with children. She joined PMPC in January of 2014 in order to access its programs and services. Recently, she's accessing her 2nd loan in the amount of PHP 7,000 for additional working capital for her existing business which is selling a variety of food and vegetables in the local community. Mercy is on her way to renovating her house out of her savings.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is aged 46, a hard-working head teacher, married with four children of ages ranging from 7 to 20 years old. All attend school in Hoima, Uganda. She deals in produce, mainly buying and selling maize, rice, and beans to earn additional income on top of her monthly salary. She desires to expand and diversify her business and buy a vehicle to aid her in service delivery. She has asked for a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock like sugar, salt, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Jose Adrian

texts.en: Jose Adrian is 40 years old and describes himself as a hard working, happy person who enjoys reading, watching soccer and spending time with his family. He has a grocery store located inside of a Mexico City market. He opens everyday from 7 am to 7 pm. He is asking for a loan to restock his grocery store.
