He wants to grow his business and believes he needs to have many different items. Jose Adrian says that his challenge is to grow his store and then open another one in a separate location.

loans.use: to buy products and restock his grocery store.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.en: Juan Carlos is 26 years old. He is single and lives in his grandparents' house. He works in a car repair shop. With his savings, he also buys used cars, fixes them, and then resells them for profit. He is asking for a loan to buy some spare parts to repair a car that he intends to resell. He started these lines of work 10 years ago because his father taught him and he enjoys it. He will be able to repay the loan with both his salary and the profit that he will make when he sells the car.

loans.use: to buy car parts.

loans.name: Santos Vicente

texts.es:
Santos, de 71 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casado, tiene 4 hijos, pero ninguno está con él.

Santos, tiene 55 años de experiencia en trabajar con cultivo de maíz y maicillo, está actividad la aprendió de su padre, también se dedica a la carpintería, en lo cual tiene 26 años de experiencia, está otra actividad la aprendió por iniciativa propia. 

Santos, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para sembrar maíz y maicillo y comprará una bomba achicadora para sacar agua del rio, para sembrar hortalizas.

Santos, en un futuro cercano desea poder cultivar hortalizas y obtener un ingresos adicional para su familia.
texts.en:
71-year old Santos has a grade 6 education, is married and has four children although none of them still live at home. He has 55 years of experience growing maize and sorghum. He learned about farming from his father. He also has worked for 26 years as a carpenter, a skill he learned on his own.

Santos needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies for his maize and sorghum crops. He also plans to buy a water pump to get water from the river so he can start to grow vegetables and earn extra money for his family.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies for his maize and sorghum crops, and a water pump so he can grow vegetables

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Hilda works hard to support her family.

Hilda has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from rice retailing. Hilda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Hilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough money so that she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Henry Jeovany

texts.es:
Henry, de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta  bachillerato, está acompañado, tiene una hija de 14 meses de nacida y su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar.

Henry, se dedica a la venta de pan, tiene 7 meses de haber iniciado esta actividad, lo cual fue iniciativa propia, viaja en motocicleta a la ciudad, para comprar el pan, se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. para ir a comprarlo, estos ingresos que obtiene, le permiten darle sustento a su familia.

Henry, necesita el crédito para compra una motocicleta, para salir a vender el pan, ya que la motocicleta que tiene, tiene muchas fallas, con la nueva motocicleta, tendrá mayor seguridad a la hora de conducirse, a los caseríos para ofrecer el pan.

En el futuro sueña con comprar un pequeño terreno, para construir su propia casa, ya que actualmente está alquilando.
texts.en:
Henry is 22 years old, studied up until his high school diploma, lives with his partner, has a 14-month-old daughter, and his life partner is a homemaker.

Henry makes a living selling bread. He started this work 7 months ago on his own initiative. He travels by motorcycle in the city to buy bread. He gets up at 4:30am to go buy it. This income that he obtains permits him to provide sustenance for his family. 

Henry needs the loan to buy a motorcycle to go out and sell bread, since the motorcycle he has now has a lot of defects. With the new motorcycle, he will be safer when he drives it to the villages to offer bread. 

In the future, he dreams of buying a small plot of land to construct his own house, since right now he is renting.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle, to be able to go out and sell bread

loans.name: Las Exitosas Group

texts.es:
Elvira es una mujer de 37 años de edad, casada, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de queso.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, constante, amable, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘El Torno’ un área rural caracterizada por agrupar a productores campesinos de carne, leche, verduras, granos, etc., y comerciantes distribuidores mayoristas que se encargan de repartir esos productos en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo; con una temperatura ambiente de aproximadamente 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Elvira es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada en la silla). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo. Su deseo por mejorar su negocio la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; tienda de barrio, venta de carne, venta de desayunos, mototaxi, comercio de quinua, venta de chinelas y venta de comida, para solicitar un préstamo y prosperar en sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de queso; ella se encarga de comprar queso por mayor a los productores lugareños para venderlos al menudeo, por unidad y por peso, labor que realiza todos los días de la semana de forma ambulante empujando un carrito de 2 ruedas cargado de queso y una balanza. “el queso se puede comer a cualquier momento del día, como desayuno, se raya para la sopa del almuerzo, a la hora de te con pan o sólo y también como acompañamiento en la cena, busco a mis clientes empujando mi carrito y tengo clientes constantes que me hacen pedidos diarios…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda fija dónde pueda vender queso en mayor cantidad, ella desea realizar la compra de variedad de quesos para aumentar su oferta y generar mejores ventas. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos en la institución en 7 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Elvira solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedades de queso por mayor para aumentar sus ventas y tener una tienda fija.
texts.en:
Elvira is a 37 year-old woman who is married.  She does not have children. She has a business selling cheese.  Elvira is an enterprising, independent, reliable, kind, responsible, and hardworking person.  She is developing her business in the town of El Torno in a rural area known for its clusters of farmers who produce meat, milk, vegetables, grains, etc., and also for its wholesale distributors who transport these products to the various markets in the city.  This area has a warm tropical climate that is very humid.  The temperature remains at about 30 degrees centigrade throughout the year.  

Elvira has a dark complexion, long black hair that she wears pulled back, dark eyes, a short stature, and a robust physique. Her native language is Guarani and she also speaks Spanish in her daily life and in her business.  In the photo, she is the one seated in the chair.  She shares her life with her husband, who is a farmer.  They live in their own home, which is made of brick and has a metal roof.  Their house has electricity and well water.

Elvira's desire to improve her business led her to form a communal bank with others who have businesses such as: neighborhood store, meat sales, breakfast sales, moto-taxi transportation services, quinoa sales, trinket sales, and food sales, so that they could request a loan and prosper with their businesses.  Elvira has a business selling cheese.  She buys cheese at wholesale from the nearby producers to sell at retail, by unit and by weight.  She does this work every day of the week, and she works from place to place pushing a 2-wheeled cart loaded with cheese and a scale.  

"One can eat cheese at any time of day, for breakfast, in soup at lunch, at tea with bread, or by itself, and also to accompany a dinner.  I look for my customers pushing my cart, and I have regular customers who make daily orders with me," she comments. 

Elvira's dream is to have a store where she could sell a greater quantity of cheese.  She wants to buy a variety of cheese to increase the products she has for sale and generate more sales.  This is her second loan cycle with the institution in the 7 years that she has been developing her business.  These are the reasons why Elvira is requesting a loan: to buy a variety of cheeses at wholesale to expand her sales so that she can get a store.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cheese at wholesale

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Juanita works hard to support her family.

Juanita has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tricycle passengers. Juanita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of charcoal to sell to customers.

Juanita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Oscar Misael

texts.es:
Oscar, de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casado y su esposa trabaja en una pastelería, tienen una hija de tres años.

Oscar, desde hace varios años trabaja de empleado, en una gasolinera de su domicilio, el lugar de trabajo está a quince minutos de su casa.

Oscar, solicita el préstamo para comprar arena, cemento y pagar la mano de obra que hará la acera de su casa.
El sueño de Oscar es, terminar su casa y pasarse rápido, porque actualmente está viviendo en casa de su suegra.
texts.en:
Oscar is 22 years old. He studied under he earned his degree. He is married, and his wife works in a bakery. They have a three-year-old daughter. 

For many years, Oscar has worked as an employee in a gas station. His place of work is located fifteen minutes away from his house.

Oscar requests the loan to buy sand and cement and to pay for workers that will build the sidewalk of his house.

Oscar’s dream is to finish his house and for it to go quickly because at present, he is living in his mother-in-law’s house.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement and to pay for workers to make the sidewalk of his house.

loans.name: Wilyn Rose

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Wilyn Rose works hard to support her family.

Wilyn Rose has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from fattening pigs and a plastic-wares retail business. Wilyn Rose is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Wilyn Rose has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Zeny

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Zeny works hard to support her family.

Zeny has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from selling charcoal. Zeny is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell to customers.

Zeny has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for agricultural supplies and for workers to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Cacao Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Cacao, es uno de los pocos grupos mixtos, integrado por un varón y 2 mujeres emprendedoras (JAVIER NICASIO, JIMILIA y RAYDAMILIA), viven en Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas, se organizaron hace 4 meses, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus pequeños negocios de venta de chiverías, de mariscos y bastimentos. Tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus ingresos que les permita poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

Con el primer crédito otorgado por Pana Pana y financiado con KIVA, le permitió a Javier Nicasio, coordinador del grupo solidario a poyar a su esposa, para que estableciera su pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su casa de tambo de madera.

RAYDAMILIA: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una señora cordial de 42 años de edad, madre soltera de 6 hijos: 2 son mayores de edad y tres adolescentes que estudian su primaria y secundaria. Desde hace 7 años dedica a la venta de mariscos y bastimentos en su casa de tambo de madera, de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar. Está solicitando préstamo para comprar más productos de mariscos, pescados, verduras y bastimentos, para incrementar sus ingresos y atender a más personas que demandan este producto que constituye uno de los alimentos básicos en Bilwi. Ella sueña con llegar a contar con suficiente capital para establecer una pulpería.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Cacao is one of the few mixed groups, made up of one male and two women entrepreneurs (Javier Nicasio, Jimilia and Raydamilia).  They live in Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas.  They organized 4 months ago with the purpose of accessing funding in order to improve their small businesses --the sale of snacks, seafood and food accompaniments--and to have the opportunity to improve their income which would enable them to cover the basic necessities of home, to secure the education of their children and to expand their businesses.

The first loan granted by Pana Pana and financed with Kiva permitted Javier Nicasio, coordinator of the solidarity group, to help his wife establish a small grocery store in the roofed open-sided veranda that runs the length of their house on wooden stilts.

Raydamilia is a member of the solidarity group.  She is a warm 42-year-old woman, the single mother of 6 children: two are adults and three are adolescents who are studying in primary and secondary school.  She has worked for 7 years selling seafood and food accompaniments in her house on wooden stilts.  In this way she has generated her own income and contributed to the household expenses. 

She is asking for this loan to by more shellfish, fish, vegetables and food accompaniments in order to increase her earnings and serve more people who demand this product which constitutes one of the basic foods in Bilwi.  Her dream is to have enough capital to establish a small grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more shellfish, fish, vegetables and food accompaniment products.

loans.name: Noel

texts.es:
Noel, de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está soltero y vive con su madre.

Noel, se dedica a la albañilería, su padre desde pequeño le enseño varios trabajos y este fue uno de ellos.

El préstamo lo necesitará para comprar laminas, para arreglar el techo de su casa, porque actualmente tiene teja y cuando llueve se moja, de esa forma él y su mamá ya no tendrán que preocuparse, vivirán en mejores condiciones.

El sueño de Noel, es poco a poco arreglar la casa de su mamá.
texts.en:
Noel is 32 years old. He studied until the third grade. He is single and lives with his mother.

Noel is dedicated to construction. From a young age, his father taught him many jobs, and this was one of them.

He will need the loan to buy metal sheets to repair the roof of his house, because at present it is made of tile, and when it rains, the house gets wet. With this improvement, he and his mother will not have to worry. They will live in better conditions.

Noel’s dream is, little by little, to repair his mother’s house.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura, de 64 años de edadm solo estudio primer grado, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, ya son mayores de edad y ya no están con ella.

Maura, se dedica al negocio de elaboración de hamacas para vender, también hace matates para halar bultos grandes, como maíz, tuza ó repollos.- Ella tiene experiencia en está actividad desde que tenia 8 años de edad, ella vende el producto en las plazas y mercados de los municipios cercanos.

Necesita el crédito para comprar madera y teja y pagar el albañil para que le arreglen su humilde casa, quiere repararla porque en invierno se moja demasiado.

El sueño de Maura, es arreglar su casita.
texts.en:
Maura, age 64, only went to first grade.  She is a single mother, and she has two children.  They are grown now, and they are not with her.

Maura has a business of making hammocks to sell.  She also makes ‘matates’ [rustic nets in the shape of a bag used to transport fruits and other loads] to pull large bundles like corn, husks, or cabbages.  She has had experience in this business since she was eight years old.  She sells the product at the plazas and markets in nearby municipalities. 

She needs the loan to buy wood and tiles and to pay the construction worker to fix her humble house.  She wants to repair it because it gets too wet during the winter.

Maura’s dream is to fix her house.

loans.use: to buy wood and tiles and to pay the construction worker to fix her humble house.

loans.name: Corona Group

texts.es: JENNY JORLENY: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una joven trabajadora de 26 años de edad, con deseos de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, con cualidades de líder. Está casada, tiene 4 hijos: El mayor de 10  años de edad estudia su cuarto grado de primaria, dos adolescentes que estudian su primaria y una pequeña de 9 meses. Su esposo trabaja en las embarcaciones brindándole mantenimiento y servicios generales a los barcos. Tiene varios años de experiencia como pequeña comerciante, vende en las afueras de un colegio público de Bilwi, chiverías, gaseosas, fritos, vigoron, también de manera ambulante por la tarde vende cajetas y confecciona ropa para niños y niñas y los vende en las comunidades a precios accesibles, de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar y en los estudios de su hijo Solicita financiamiento para comprar insumos e ingredientes para elaborar frito, vigoron, cajetas, refrescos naturales: azúcar, bolsas plásticas, yuca, chicharon, repollo, tomate, cebolla, vinagre, sal, filipitas, pollo, aceite, entre otros productos. Ella sueña cn establecer una pulpería y dedicarse a la confección de ropa.
texts.en: JENNY JORLENY: She is the coordinator of the solidarity group. She is a young working woman, age 26, with a desire to improve her family quality of life. She has leader qualities, she is married with 4 children: the oldest is 10 years old and he is in fourth grade; two teenagers enrolled in elementary school, and a little girl, age 9 months old. Her husband works servicing and maintaining boats. She has several years of experience as a small entrepreneur. She sells outside of a public school in Bilwi, snacks, soda pop, deep fried snacks, vigoron (cabbage and cassava salad with pork rind snack.) In the afternoons, she sells cajeta (milk caramel) as a street vendor,  and she also sews clothing for boys and girls. She sells in the community at affordable prices, this way she generates income and contributes to the expenses of the household and her son's studies. She is asking for a loan to buy inputs and ingredients to make deep fried snacks, vigoron, cajeta, and natural drinks: sugar, plastic bags, cassava, pork rind, cabbage, tomatoes, onions, vinegar, salt, filipitas, chicken, oil, among other products. She dreams of opening a snack bar and to work sewing clothing.

loans.use: To purchase inputs and ingredients to make deep fried snacks, vigoron (cabbage and cassava salad with pork rind snack,) cajeta (milk caramel,) natural drinks.

loans.name: Seangnai

texts.en:
Seangnai, 35, resides in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has three children. 

To make a living and support her family, Seangnai opened a grocery store which is located in her community. So far, she has been in this type of business for three years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 7.00 a day. 

Currently, Seangnai would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of travelling. 

Seangnai would like to thank all lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis, de 53 años de edad, no estudio,  está soltero, pero tiene 5 hijos, pero solo 2 dependen economicamente de él. 

Luis, se dedica a la agricultura desde muy pequeño y cuando obtiene una buena cosecha, vende maíz, la distancia en la que se encuentra el lugar de trabajo está a un kilómetro de su casa.

Con el crédito pagará el alquiler del terreno donde sembrará.

El sueño de Luis, es darle el estudio a sus hijos y darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis is 53 years old. He never studied, he is single, and he has five children, two of whom depend on him economically.

Luis has made a living from agriculture since he was very young, when he gets a good harvest he sells corn. The distance between his home and his work is one kilometer.

With this loan Luis can pay the rent for the land where he grows crops.

Luis's dream is to see his children study and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the rent for the land where he grows crops.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Domingo es casado tiene 58 de edad, tiene una linda familia de 11 hijos de las edades entre 3 y 30 años de edad, vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Domingo es un padre de familia que a pesar de su avanzada edad es dedicado a su familia y para generar sus ingresos desde hace 14 años se dedica a la agricultura, para el ser agricultor es algo muy privilegiado porque a esto se ha dedicado su familia, por lo que para él es algo muy emotivo hacerlo, Domingo  para que su familia tenga una mejor comodidad a decidido construir su casa pero con los altos precios que tienen los materiales de construcción el ya no está dentro de sus posibilidades poder adquirirlas, es por eso que el solicita un préstamo para comprar cemento, arena, piedrín  y hierro y construir su casa.
El sueño de Domingo es que este año él pueda terminar de construir su casa, y poder brindarle a su familia una mejor vida
texts.en:
Domingo is married and 58 years old. He has a beautiful family of 11 children between the ages of 3 and 30. He lives in the community of Sololá. Domingo is the head of his household and despite his advanced age he is dedicated to his family. In order to generate income he has worked in agriculture for 14 years. Being a farmer is very special because his family has dedicated itself to this business, which is why for him it is a very moving thing to do. 

In order for his family to have greater comfort, Domingo has decided to build his house. However, with the high prices of construction materials, it is no longer within his means to acquire them. That is why he requests a loan to buy cement, sand, gravel, and iron to build his house. 

Domingo’s dream is that he will finish building his house this year and be able to provide his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, and iron.

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en: Forty year old Heang is a mother and a wife. She has two children who are dependents. One of the children is still in school. They are residing in Ub Dambae district, Kampong Cham province.  Her main source of income is from cassava plantation, which she has been doing for 24 years. Her child also helps out with the plantation. She manages to earn approximately 11 USD daily. Heang has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) once before and she is a creditable client. Leading her group, she is applying for a 1,000,000 KHR loan to buy potash and insecticide, and to hire workers to work on the plantation. She wishes that her plantation will be fruitful so that she can buy a plot of land to grow cassava in one year's time.

loans.use: to buy potash and insecticide, and to hire workers to work on the plantation.

loans.name: Hat's Group

texts.en: A resident of Tbaung Khmum district, Kampong Cham province, Hat is a 48-year-old married woman with three children. Two of the children are still living with her, although they already have their own job as a car repairman and a hairdresser. Her main sources of income are from farming rice and making sewage drains, for 30 years. Together they manage to save 10 USD a day. This is her first cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, and she is leading her group.  Hat is applying for a 1,400,000 KHR loan to buy potash and rice seed for her farm and to buy materials to make a sewage drain. She hopes both of her businesses will be profitable.

loans.use: to buy potash and rice seed for her farm and to buy materials to make a sewage drain.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sinnoy

texts.en: A resident of Thala Barivat district, Steung Treng province, 43-year-old Sinnoy is married with two children who are still her dependents. To support the family, Sinnoy has been planting cassava for 23 years. Her secondary source of income is from a cashew nut plantation. Sinnoy has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for 4 cycles including this time. She is seeking a loan to send her son to study management at the university. She hopes that he will have a better paying job in the future with a bachelor degree.

loans.use: to send her son to study management at thte university

location.town: Steung Treng Province, Thala Barivat District

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Agée de 33 ans, Akossiwa est une femme mariée et mère de trois enfants. Akossiwa habite à Sokpekopé et vend des mèches dans un atelier. Pour disposer du stock en permanence, Akossiwa s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au grand marché. Akossiwa souhaite répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients qui désirent ses produits. Elle  demande ce crédit pour acheter des mèches et avoir une marge de bénéfice pour couvrir ses charges quotidiennes.
texts.en: Akossiwa is a 33-year old woman, married and the mother of three. She lives in Sokpekopé and sells hair extensions in a hair salon. In order to keep merchandise on hand, Akossiwa stocks up twice a month at the main market. Akossiwa would like to meet her customers' needs. She is requesting this loan in order to buy hair extension and earn a profit margin which would cover her everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy 30 hair extensions.

loans.name: Monica De Los Angeles

texts.es: Mónica es una joven emprendedora que a sus 20 años de edad se dedica a elaborar y vender pan en el mercado de la municipalidad, su mayor motivación es su hijo y demuestra que el estar soltera no es impedimento para lograr superarse, es el tercer ciclo que solicita el financiamiento en ADIM para invertir en capital de trabajo. El crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de quintal de harina, azúcar, levadura, flete de leña, etc., con los créditos anteriores ha logrado la compra de utensilios para su negocio y así ofrecer productos de calidad.
texts.en:
Mónica is an enterprising young woman who, at 20 years of age, works making and selling bread in her town’s market. Her greatest motivation is her son and she demonstrates that being single is not a hindrance to being able to improve one’s self. 

This is the third cycle in which she requests funding from ADIM to invest in working capital. She requests the current loan to buy a quintal of flour, sugar, yeast, a load of firewood, etc. With the previous loans she has been able to buy tools for her business and in that way offer quality products.

loans.use: to buy wholesale flour, sugar, firewood, butter, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Rogelyn

texts.en:
Rogelyn is 25 years old and lives in Sindangan, Philippines. She is married and has been blessed with 2 kids. Her husband is a farmer who plants rice, corn, and other agricultural commodities. 

Rogelyn has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious member helps her husband with plowing the rice fields and planting corn and other crops. 

In need of additional working capital, Rogelyn decided to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She has received 2 loans already and recently has requested 12,000 PHP to both buy farm inputs and pay for the labor to cultivate their land. 

Rogelyn has been able to manage her income and to provide for her family's daily needs. She is very thankful because, if it were not for Paglaum, she might not be able to obtain the working capital she needs. She hopes to one day own a land tractor to use for land cultivation.

loans.use: to both buy farm inputs and pay for the labor to cultivate their land.

location.town: Sindangan-R.J. Macias, Sindangan, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cheese, cream, vegetables, side dishes, beans, rice, oil, and sugar

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 51 years old. She works very hard to provide for her daily needs.

Betty runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Betty has been in this business for 4 years now. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as eggs, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve one of the rooms that she rents, to thus offer a better quality of life to the renters.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de tortillas su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su hijo y su madre, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal para seguir con la elaboración de las tortillas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young woman, whose face is pixelated because she is 27 years old and lives in a high risk area, makes a living selling tortillas. Her business is located in her home. With the earnings she obtains from her sales, she manages to settle some costs of her home. The young woman lives in her own house with her son and her mother. 

She is asking for a loan to buy wholesale corn and lime to continue making tortillas, and in that way be able to have a better income.

loans.use: To buy wholesale corn and lime

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is 61 years old and married; she lives in Sindangan, Zamboangadel Norte. For a living,  Anita and her husband have cultivated a rice land; she is also engaged in swine production business.  Anita mastered doing these activities for twenty years now. She joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative on May of 2012. She is hardworking and has strong determination to pursue her goals to sustain her family needs.  Anita requested a loan to purchase fertilizers to increase crop yield on her rice farm, and purchase bags of feeds and vitamins for her pigs. This will greatly help Anita to boost her income. Someday, she wishes to buy rice land to cultivate and hopes to venture into rice retailing business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to increase crop yield on her rice farm, and to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

location.town: Sindangan - Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Nort

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en: Charlita is engaged in running a grocery store. She has been operating her business for 7 years and earns a monthly net income of 3,500 PHP. Charlita is 55 years old, married and has four children. She is from the village of Motibot, Sindanagan. In 2012, Charlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and develop her skill in business engagements. Charlita has successfully repaid previous loans from PMPC. The previous loan was used for personal purposes. Now, Charlita is requesting her 4th loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used for the expansion of her existing business. She wants to buy more inventories to sell in her store.

loans.use: to buy more inventories to sell in her store.

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Emelinda is 47 years old with eight children. With four children in school, Emelinda works very hard to provide for them.

Emelinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits and canned goods.

Emelinda has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Emelinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits and canned goods.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a 45-year old married woman with six children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Evangeline has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy item to sell like clothes and shoes.

Evangeline has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy item to sell like clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Sar

texts.en: Sar is a villager of Chhloung district, Kratie province. At 47 years of age, she is married and has eight children. Seven of her children are living under the same roof as her. Four of them had to drop out of school. She has been planting cassava for 27 years in order to make a living. She is also a paid-worker in order to earn extra. Sar has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) 2 cycles now. She is requesting for a 2,000,000 KHR loan to buy potash and cassava stems to grow. She hopes that her business will keep expanding so that her family finance status will be improved.

loans.use: to buy potash and cassava stems to grow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to assist her coffee crops.

loans.name: Gildardo

texts.es:
Lo que pueden ver en la foto es una fábrica de producción de panela el cual inicio el señor Gildardo gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre, Gildardo es un hombre soltero de 34 años de edad, muy trabajador junto a su empleado trata de hacer que la empresa progrese, aumentar la producción, darle empleo a más personas, proyectarse para ser reconocidos en el mercado, que comerciantes de otros lugares vengan y se enamoren de su forma de trabajar y su calidad de producto.
Gildardo en el momento presenta una necesidad, requiere comprar una maya para las ventanas de cuarto de moldeo y utensilios de fabricación, por esta razón solicita un pequeño monto para comprar estos implementos, hay que tener en cuenta que su empresa no tiene mucho tiempo de haberla abierto y de momento no tiene mucho capital.
texts.en:
What you can see in this photo is a sugar cane production factory that Gildardo started thanks to his father's instructions.

Gildardo, 34, is a hardworking single man who, with his employee, is trying to make progress with his business.  He's trying to increase production, employ more people, and be recognized in the market so businessmen from other places will come and fall in love with his way of working and the quality of his product.

Now Gildardo needs to buy a screen for the windows in the molding room as well as fabrication tools.  That's why he's requesting a small amount to buy these implements.  It's important to keep in mind that his business hasn't been open very long and at the moment he doesn't have a lot of capital.

loans.use: to buy a screen for the windows in the molding room as well as fabrication tools

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocio decidida a apoyar a su cónyuge con los gastos de su hogar, pues sus ingresos no eran suficientes para lograr que obtuvierasn  estudios superiores, viendolo desesperado, se ideó su propia forma de ganar dinero hace 5 años, vendiendo productos en plata,  asesorada por una amiga que tenia experiencia en ello y consiguiendo un pequeño prestamo de un particular.  Los productos los ofrece en forma directa de contado y a crédito, vendiendo semanalmente desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde, comprando en almacenes del centro de la ciudad y comercializandolos principalmente entre profesionales de la medicina, policias, y personal administrativo de instituciones que se encuentran cerca a su vivienda. Su meta es extenderlo, ubicandolo en un local, que tenga una mayor visibilidad , para impactar mucho mas sus ventas, generar  ingresos superores a los actuales y así conseguir que sus hijos sean profesionales exitosos y que  hoy se encuentran en las edades de 18 a 21 años. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará prendas de acero, calzado, jeans, sueteres, etc, para responder a encargos que le han hecho sus clientes, haciendo así de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Rocio decided to give her husband support with the household expenses, since his income wasn't sufficient to allow them [their children] to obtain higher educations.  Seeing that he was desperate, she came up with her own way of earning money five years ago, selling silver products. She was advised by a friend who has experience in this, and she obtained a small loan from an individual. She offers products directly for cash and on credit, selling weekly from 9 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon. She buys her products in warehouses in the center of the city and sells them principally among professionals in medicine, police personnel, and administrative personnel from the institutions that are located near her residence. Her goal is to extend her business, locating it in a shop so that it has better visibility in order to impact her sales much more and generate income that is better than what she has now, thus allowing her children, who are now between the ages of 18 and 21, to become successful professionals.

She is now applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that she has had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy steel accessories, footwear, jeans, sweaters, etc., in order to respond to orders that her customers have placed with her, thus making her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy steel accessories, footwear, jeans, sweaters, etc.

loans.name: Jose Efraín

texts.es:
José, de 41 años de edad, está casado y tiene 2 hijos varones.

José, tiene una gran experiencia en el sector agropecuario y agrícola, fue heredada por su padre, que hoy adolece de una enfermedad, que le impide realizar las actividades productivas y comerciales, motivo por el cual José, está comprometido con mantener el patrimonio de la familia. 

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar más ganado, además de preparar las tierras, para la nueva cosecha que ya se aproxima. 

José, planea seguir comprando ganado para venderlo y que le genere un buen margen de ganancias, también, desea comprar ganado que le proporcione mucha leche, para comercializarla.
texts.en:
Jose is 41 years old.  He is married and has two sons.

Jose has much experience in the agriculture, fishing and farming sectors that was inherited by his father, who now is suffering from an illness that stops him from carrying out his productive and business occupations.  It is for this reason that Jose has committed to maintaining the family patrinomy. 

Jose needs the loan to buy more livestock, besides preparing the land for the new harvest that already is approaching.

Jose plans to continue buying livestock to sell and that will generate a good margin of earnings.  He also wishes to buy livestock that will supply milk in order to market it.

loans.use: to buy more livestock

loans.name: Kao's Group

texts.en: Kao is 33 years old and married with one son. They are living in a rural village of Dambae district, in Kampong Cham province. Her main source of income is from a cassava plantation, which she has been doing for 15 years. She also owns a rice farm. She is able to keep 5 USD for saving per day. This is Kao's third loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now leading her group, she is seeking a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to rent a plot of land for growing cassava, as well as to hire worker to plow the field and to buy fertilizer and cassava stems. Her goal is to increase her plantation land so that she can have a higher yield and return more profit.

loans.use: to rent a plot of land for growing cassava, as well as to hire worker to plow the field and to buy fertilizer and cassava stems

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
As a parent of six children, Florencia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Florencia is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Florencia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 48 years old with one child.

Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, cigarettes, groceries, etc..

Gina has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Gina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, cigarettes, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Rath's Group

texts.en: Rath’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Rath makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sokhim Group

texts.en: Sokhim’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokhim makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Muhiddin

texts.ru:
Мухиддин мужчина в возрасте 42 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Он очень  трудолюбивый и добропорядочный человек. Онон зарабатывает строителем. Он хочет накопит денег для своего будущего. В помощь отцу хочет  построит новый   коровник.  Для достижение своих целей всего этого нахватает.    
Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, поэтому Мухиддин хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Для этого он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Мухиддин заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Muhiddin is a 42-year old man. He is married and has two children. He is a very hard-working and conscientious person. He works in construction. He would like to save up for the future. He would also like to help his father build a new cow shed. He lacks the means to achieve these goals.

Raising livestock is a profitable business, and so Muhiddin would like to develop it and increase his headcount. This is why he has reached out to Arvand for a loan to buy livestock. Muhiddin thanks Arvand for its support in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.ru: Мунаввар женщина в возрасте 50 лет. У Мунаввар 3 взрослых детей. Она проживает в сельской местности и занимается животноводством. Дополнительно Мунаввар занимается продажей молочной продукции, которую сама изготавливает. Мунаввар начала это занятие после замужества, чтобы хоть как то помогать мужу в обеспечении семьи. Таким образом Мунаввар постепенно начала развивать свой бизнес и через несколько лет она расширила свое стадо до 6 дойных коров. Вскоре ее бизнес стал основным источником дохода ее семьи. Муж Мунаввар занимается выращиванием зерновых культур. Дети работают в России и помогают родителям отправляя деньги каждый месяц. Но на данный момент из за политических ситуаций бизнес у Мунаввар идет на спад. Причиной этому является упадок цен и спроса на скот. С этой проблемой Мунаввар решила обратиться в МДО "АРВАНД" за финансовой поддержкой. На полученные деньги Мунаввар хочет купить корм для скота и скот. Мунаввар выражает благодарность за предоставление финансовой помощи сельским жителям.
texts.en:
Munavvar is 50 years old and the mother of three grown children.  She lives in a rural area and raises livestock.  She also makes and sells dairy products.  She became involved in animal husbandry after she got married and in order to help her husband provide for the family.  Over time, Munavvar gradually expanded her business and, after a few years, her herd comprised six head of cattle.  Soon, her business became the family's main source of income.  Munavvar's husband grows crops.  The children work in Russia and help their parents by sending money home every month.  

Unfortunately, Munavvar's business is currently in decline because of the political situation.  The reason for this lies in falling prices and a reduced demand for livestock.  Faced with this problem, Munavvar has decided to turn to MDO Arvand to receive some financial support.  She wants to use her loan to buy fodder for her cattle and smaller livestock.  She is grateful that such financial support is being made available to rural residents.

loans.use: to fatten and breed cattle.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée et âgée de 36 ans. Afi vit à Adidogomé avec ses deux enfants et exerce son activité pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Couturière, Afi coud des habits qu’elle met en vente pour ses clients et suscite leur désir à passer assez de commandes. Afi s’approvisionne au marché deux fois par mois et demande ce prêt pour acheter de nouveaux pagnes qu’elle pourra coudre. Afi souhaite avoir une bonne rentabilité et aider son mari à soutenir les charges de la famille.
texts.en: Afi is a 36-year old married woman. She lives in Adidogomé with her two children and runs her own business to support her family. Afi is a seamstress. She makes ready-to-wear clothing she puts up for sale, also encouraging customers to place custom orders with her. Afi stocks up at the market twice month. She is requesting these loan to stock up on traditional colorful "pagnes" fabric she uses for sewing. Afi would like to have a good profit margin and help her husband with family expenses.

loans.use: to buy five sets of traditional fabric.

loans.name: Gloria Jeaneth

texts.es: Gloria de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda terminando de construir un muro en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero con lo que gana no le alcanza por esa razón solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena, hierro y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en:
Gloria is 33 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and her son. She makes a living selling clothing and cosmetics. With what she earns from her sales, she manages to pay some household expenses. 

She wants to improve her house by finishing construction of a wall in the location shown in the photograph, but with what she earns she does not have enough. For this reason, she is soliciting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron, and to pay for labor so that she and her family can live more comfortably and securely.

loans.use: To buy bricks, cement, sand, iron, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
El socio Virgilio se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia,el socio tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra maiz y papa el socio por medio de estos trabajos quiere salir adelante ya que el socio es una persona trabajadora, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de agricultura. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Virgilio continues to make a living in the livestock business. He has a plot of land where he grows corn and potatoes. He wants to get ahead by means of his business since he is a hardworking person. Virgilio's dream is to expand his agriculture business. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. He is happy about the loan and promises to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 36 years old and married with two children; one child is still in school. Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, spices, noodles, coffee, milk, etc.

Mary Ann has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, spices, noodles, coffee, and milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new body for her husband's Moto Rickshaw.

loans.name: Leonel Antonio

texts.es:
Leonel, de 41 años de edad, está casado, tiene dos hijos, solo estudio hasta bachillerato, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos. 

Leonel, por más de 10 años se ha dedicado a trabajar como taxista.

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar un taxi, porque el que actualmente maneja es de otra persona, que se lo alquila para que Leonel trabaje.

Leonel, desea que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Leonel is 41 years old. He is married and has two children. 

He only completed High School. His wife does the household chores. Leonel has worked as a taxi driver for over 10 years. He'll use the loan to buy a taxi, because the one he drives currently belongs to somebody else. Leonel rents it so he can work.

Leonel wishes his kids go to school and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy a taxi.

loans.name: Yadi

texts.en:
For Yadi, 2014 was a year of surviving through careful budgeting. Her last loan through the Kiva program enabled her to maintain stability for her family in the face of dropping corn prices and fluctuating hammock orders. She is the main money earner for her family, so she always feels pressure to keep their income secure. 

The financial training she undertook as part of the Kiva program helped her to keep the family well-fed and stable during these tough times. This year, she wants to increase the amount of her loan so that she can focus on her weaving work without being distracted by stress over where the money is going to come from.

loans.use: to jump-start her weaving operations by investing in raw materials ahead of the busy spring and summer hammock sales period.

loans.name: Abdul Waheed

texts.en: Abdul Waheed has been running a school for the last 13 years. There are over 230 students in his school, out of which over 100 are girls. He believes in the education prospects of the children in his community and this is what made him start a school. There are only female teachers in his school, and all are from the same community. He requires a loan of PKR 110,000 to purchase furniture for his students and to buy a computer so that his students can practice computer skills.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his students and to buy a computer so that his students can practice computer skills.

loans.name: Aun's Group

texts.en:
Aun’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province, Cambodia.  She earns a living cultivating rice and working as a tailor to support her family.  In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ros's Group

texts.en: Ros’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. Ros makes a living cultivating rice and also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr: Siaka est l’homme  assis  qui a levé  sa main sur la photo. Il est  malien, âgé de 41 ans marié, père de 7 enfants, âgés de 16 à 2 ans dont 4 vont à l’école. Ayant quitté l’école en 6 années fondamentale, Siaka est un agriculteur, de plus il fait l’embouche  en saison sèche depuis plus de 6 ans. Le prêt RMCR lui permet d’acheter plus d’animaux (moutons, bœufs) pour l’embouche. Les animaux sont achetés sur le marché local et environnants et la vente aussi est effectuée sur les même marchés en espèces .Le profit ainsi tiré de l’activité permet à Siaka de subvenir aux dépenses familiaux (frais de condiment, frais scolaire des enfants et l’habillement).
texts.en:
Siaka, sitting with a hand raised in the group photo, is a 41-year-old man from Mali who is married with 7 children ages 2 to 16, four of them in school. 

Having quit school in the 6th grade, Siaka became a farmer and started to practice animal fattening during the dry season over 6 years ago. 

The RMCR loan will allow him to acquire more animals (sheep, cattle) to fatten. He buys them at local and nearby markets, and he later sells them at the same locations for cash. 

The profits earned through this activity help Siaka to provide for his family (food, children’s tuition, and clothing).

loans.use: to buy sheep and cattle to fatten and resell.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Dori est l'homme qui est au milieu des 4  autres et la main sur le belier sur la photo.Dori est un malien agé de 35 ans, marié père de 8 enfants,  âgés de 17 à 2 ans dont 2 vont à l’école. N’ayant pas été à l’école, Dori fait l’élevage depuis plus de10 ans.  Sa femme est ménagère. Il prend le prêt  au RMCR pour acheter  plus de moutons sur le marché local pour l’élevage et les  revend après un cycle moyen de six mois. Les bénéfices ainsi tirés de l’activité permet à Dori de prendre en charge les dépenses de la famille .Les déchets des animaux sont utilisés comme fumier organique pour fertiliser les champs. 
La cinquième personne sur la photo est le président du groupe mais cette fois ci il n'a pas pris le prêt, il a souhaiter accompagner les membres de son groupe dans la photo. Sur la photo c'est l' homme arrêté au bout vers la tête du bélier.
texts.en:
Dori is the man in the middle of the four others in the photo, with his hand on the ram. He comes from Mali, is aged 35, married, and the father of eight children aged 17 to 2 years old. Two of them go to school. 

Not having attended school himself, Dori has been raising livestock for more than 10 years. His wife is a housewife. He is taking out a loan from RMCR to buy more sheep at the local market to raise and sell after about six months. The profits from this activity will permit Dori to cover family expenses. The manure from the animals is used as organic fertilizer to fertilize the fields. 

The fifth person in the photo is the president of the group, but this time he did not take out the loan but wanted to accompany his group members in the photo. Dori is the man stepping out towards the head of the ram.

loans.use: to buy sheep to fatten and resell.

loans.name: Murodgul

texts.en: Murodgul is a modest, 49-year-old woman. She lives in the Khuroson district with her husband, son and daughter-in-law. Murodgul engages in animal husbandry and plant growing. She learned her skills from her parents. Her son and daughter-in-law help her in the business. Murodgul requested a loan to renovate her home, which is breaking down. She wants to take care of her family and worries about their health. Therefore, Murodgul wants to create comfort and warmth in her home. She believes that with the help of Kiva lenders she can solve her difficulty.

loans.use: To renovate her home

loans.name: Roger Amilkar

texts.es:
Roger  es un hombre joven 21 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de diseño gráfico. 
Él es inteligente, atento, de buen trato al cliente, responsable y trabajador. Sus estudios lo realiza en un instituto técnico de educación comercial en la zona de ‘Villa fátima’, un área caracterizada por recibir la hoja de Coca procedente del norte del departamento y por la terminal de transporte público con destino a poblaciones del norte, de clima frío y ventoso, vientos que llegan de la cordillera a una altura de 3600 metros sobre el nivel del mar.  
Roger es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará el cual ya no utiliza porque estudia inglés como segunda lengua. Su vida la realiza junto a sus padres que trabajan como comerciantes, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. El cursa la carrera de diseño gráfico y se encuentra en 3 año de 3 años que dura la carrera; disfruta diseñando bocetos, pancartas, afiches, le gusta entender las combinaciones de los colores, su carácter es de servicio, paralelamente a sus estudios trabaja en una imprenta dónde aplica todo lo aprendido. Su sueño es ser profesional para ayudar con los gastos a su familia y desea realizar la compra de una computadora portátil y pagar los gastos de titulación de su carrera. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica al estudio profesional. 
Es por esos motivos que Roger solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora portátil, pagar los gastos de titulación y terminar su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Roger is 21 years old, single and has no children. He is studying for a career in graphic design. He is intelligent, attentive, responsible, hardworking and customer-service oriented.

He studies in a technological institute of commercial education in the "Villa fátima" area, an area characterized for receiving the cocoa leaf from a northern department, for its public transportation terminal bound for northern populations, and for cold and windy weather with winds coming from a mountain range at an altitude of 3600 meters above the sea.

Roger has a dark complexion, short black hair, dark eyes, short stature and a thin physique. His native language is Aymara, which he no longer speaks now that he studies English as a second language. He lives with his parents who work as merchants. They live in a home constructed of brick with a corrugated, iron roof. The house has water, electricity, gas and a sewage system.

He is in his third year of a three-year academic graphic design program. He enjoys designing booklets, banners, and posters. He likes understanding color combinations and is service-oriented. While in school, he is working at a printing press where he applies all he is learning.

Roger's dream is to work professionally to help with his family's expenses. He wants to buy a laptop computer and pay for professional certification expenses. This is his first loan with the institution in his three years of professional study.

It is for these reasons Roger is requesting a loan to buy a laptop computer, pay for certification expenses and to finish his professional education.

loans.use: to buy a laptop, pay for certification expenses, and finish his studies.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: María tiene 59 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su hijo. Ella es una mujer emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de pan francés desde hace mucho tiempo. Ella recorre todas las localidades de su localidad para ofrecer el delicioso pan que tanto prefieren sus clientes. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de pan para la venta. Además, desea vender pan dulce y de esta forma aprovechar los clientes que ya tiene.
texts.en:
Maria is 59 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and son. She is a very enterprising woman and for a long time she has been making a living selling french baguettes. She goes all over her town offering the delicious bread that her customers prefer.
 
In the hope of improving her living conditions Maria is requesting this loan from FUSAI to purchase a larger quantity of bread to sell. In addition, she would like to sell pastries and make the most of the customer base she already has.

loans.use: to buy pastries and french baguettes to sell.

loans.name: Hosea

texts.en:
Hosea has provided motorcycle transport services to the residents of Nyahururu town in Kenya for more than six years now. He is now 32 years old and has used his previous loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy a motorcycle for his business. It has been profitable. 

Right now, Hosea makes a monthly income of 10,000 KES and this has enabled him to provide for his family's needs. He has requested another loan from VisionFund to buy another motorcycle. This will enable him to serve more customers and generate more income, which he will use to pay school fees for his children and buy food for the family. Hosea's future hopes and dreams are to expand his transport business and to be successful.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle and provide transport services to more customers.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is grateful that she was granted a 35,000 PHP loan to purchase various electronic items to sell in her store. Through her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan to buy more televisions, DVDs, and speaker units to sell in her store. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help. It will surely help pay for her everyday needs and the school needs of her children. 

Grace dreams of having a bigger electronic store someday and aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for televisions, DVDs, and speakers to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 61 years old, married and has eight children.

Lolita is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Lolita has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. Lolita is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 56 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more merchandise to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, sugar, etc.

Lucia has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purcahse more merchandise to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 51 years old and married and has seven children. One child is still in school.

Luz is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Luz has been farming for 20 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.  Josephine is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Luzviminda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell coconut wine business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from running a general store.  Luzviminda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell for her buy and sell coconut wine business.

Luzviminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 64 years old and widowed with five children. Veronica works very hard to provide for them.

Veronica runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

Veronica has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, Veronica would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Mauricio Jose

texts.es:
Se dice que desde pequeño cada persona va descubriendo lo que quiere ser de grande, Mauricio se sintió atraído por los químicos desde su niñez. Al ir creciendo este joven de 18 años de edad, además de no perder esa curiosidad de conocer sobre los resultados de los químicos, descubrió que mediante esto que siempre le ha apasionado, puede contribuir a la salud médica de la sociedad. Razón por la cual ya lleva el segundo año de estudiar bioanálisis clínico.
Mauricio siempre se ha sentido respaldado con el apoyo de su madre que es conserje y de su padre que es maestro de obra. A medida que pasan los años se siente más emocionado por sus estudios, por lo que desea tener todas las herramientas necesarias para seguir siendo un excelente estudiante. Por esta razón solicita un crédito para la compra de una computadora, la que le facilitará la elaboración de trabajos de la universidad.  En sus planes está estudiar una carrera técnica al terminar su licenciatura.
texts.en:
They say that from a young age, every person discovers what they want to do when they grow up. Mauricio was drawn to chemicals since his childhood. As he grew up, this young 18-year-old man, in addition to not losing this curiosity for learning the results of the chemicals, he discovered that through this subject he had always been passionate about, he could contribute to the medical health of society. For that reason, he is in his second year of studying clinical bioanalysis.

Mauricio always has felt supported with the help of his mother, who is a janitor, and his father, who is a mason. As the years go on, he feels more excited about his studies, for which he wants to have all of the necessary tools to continue being an excellent student. For this reason, he is asking for a loan to buy a computer, which will facilitate writing university papers. In his plans is to study a technical career upon finishing his undergraduate degree.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Chiv's Group

texts.en:
Chiv’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Chiv makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Moeun's Group

texts.en:
Moeun’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Moeun makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is grateful that she was granted a PHP 26,000 loan which she used to buy sacks of rice for her general store business. Her store earnings helped support her family's basic needs and the schooling of her children. 

She would now like to apply for another PHP 10,000 loan which she will use to buy several sacks of rice to sell wholesale or retail. Rice is a main staple in the Philippines; it constitutes a dominant portion of the standard diet of Filipinos. Her earnings from selling rice will help cover her family’s daily needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her for it will surely fund her children's education.

Milagros hopes to have a bigger General Store someday. She dreams that all her children will finish College and she will see them become professionals. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

 All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of rice to sell at her small general store.

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
Roy is from Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. He is a very responsible father when it comes to the welfare of his family, since he has always been known to provide the best for it. 

He is earning a living in his retailing business. To generate more income, Roy decided to expand his resources after he learned that he can access financial assistance from PMPC. Consequently, he requested a loan to restock more inventory for his store to increase sales. 

Roy smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing his family with a better life.

loans.use: to restock more inventory for his store to increase sales

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 46 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Marilou works very hard to provide for them.

Marilou runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, eggs, soap, groceries, etc.

Marilou has been in this business for 4 years now. 

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, eggs, soap, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Mechelle

texts.en:
Mechelle is 33 years old and married with six children. With four children in school, Mechelle works very hard to provide for them.

Mechelle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase item to sell like coffee, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Mechelle has been in this business for 3 years now. 

In the future, Mechelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase item to sell like coffee, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 57 years old and married. Mila works very hard to provide for them.

Mila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc..

Mila has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Mila would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 43 years old and married with three children.

Virginia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as coffee, eggs, condiments and groceries.

Virginia has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from bicycle transport.

Virginia aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as coffee, eggs, condiments and groceries

loans.name: Son's Group

texts.en: Son’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province, Cambodia. Son makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Son's Group

texts.en: Son’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Son makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Maria Nohemy

texts.es:
María, de 43 años de edad, está casada y su esposo trabaja como motorista, ella solo tiene un hijo. 

María, tiene venta de tortillas en el mercado, se levanta desde  muy temprano a coser el maíz,  luego tiene que ir al molino que está a una distancia de 5 kilómetros de recorrido y termina su jornada a las 2:00 de la tarde.- Ella se dedica a esta actividad desde que tenía 25 años de edad, es un oficio que emprendió gracias su mamá, quien fue  la que la motivo, para que iniciara este negocio.

María, necesita el crédito para comprar maíz, cal y leña para continuar con su negocio.

El sueño de ella es darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y lo logrará ampliando sus fuentes de ingresos.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old, married, and her husband works as a driver. She only has one son.

María sells tortillas in the market. She gets up very early to cook the corn, then she has to go to the mill which is at a distance of 5 kilometers, and she finishes her day at 2 in the afternoon. She has made a living with this work since she was 25 years old. It is a job that she learned thanks to her mom, who was the one who motivated her to start this business.

María needs the loan to buy corn, lime, and firewood to continue with her business. 

Her dream is to give her son a better quality of life, and she will achieve it by increasing her sources of income.

loans.use: To buy corn, lime, and firewood to continue her business.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is 61 years old and married with one child. 

Natividad runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Natividad has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Natividad would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine is 32 years old and married. Kristine works very hard to provide for her family.

Kristine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as soap, shampoo, eggs and groceries.

Kristine has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, soap, soft drinks, mineral water, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Kristine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as soap, shampoo, eggs and groceries

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy, 45 years old, is a married woman who comes from a rural area of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business on a small farmland which is located near her house. On her farmland, she grows rice and sells her agricultural products to the local dealers. So far, she has been involved with this type of business for around twenty years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 2.00 a day.
