Her husband, Lonh, 46, invests in a buy-and-sell scrap business, and earns on average, an income of USD 5.00 a day. Currently her husband’s business is running badly because of insufficient capital. That is why she is applying for a Kiva loan for her husband to invest more in the buy-and-sell scrap business. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to invest more in a buy-and-sell scrap business.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is a tailor from Liloy. She supported her family doing this type of work. She has a business producing school uniforms and carrying out repairs to clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive.
She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her generate more income and be able to cater tailoring services.

loans.use: buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en: Marjorie, 34, is separated with two school-age children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 5 years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already availed loans previously to purchase for additional stocks and now she is re-applying a loan for her store.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

location.town: Ozamis-P Malinawon, Tinago, Ozamiz City, Misamis O

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 41 years old and married with two children who are both in school.

Analiza earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from rice retailing. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 52 years old and married with six children.

Salvacion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, eggs, beverages, groceries, etc.

Salvacion has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Salvacion aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, eggs, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 38 years old and married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Cheryl has a frozen food retail business in the Philippines. Cheryl requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of frozen foods to sell.

Cheryl has been in this business for five years. In the future, Cheryl would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Shirlyna

texts.en:
Shirlyna is 35 years old and has three children. Shirlyna is married and has one child in school.

Shirlyna is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Shirlyna requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Shirlyna has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Shirlyna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Ana works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen foods business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store.  Ana is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of frozen foods to sell.

Ana has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 41 years old. Nenita works very hard to provide for her daily needs.

Nenita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, candies, groceries, etc.

Nenita has been in this business for 4 years now. 

In the future, Nenita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, candies, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Nida works hard to support her family.

She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Nida is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy interior equipment and other items for her bicycle transport business.

Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy interior equipment and other items.

loans.name: Roneth

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Roneth works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling coconut wine. Roneth is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her fishing business.

Roneth has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed

loans.name: Lucas Armando

texts.es: Lucas de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el trabaja vendiendo medicina popular y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, el quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando piso cerámico, pintar la casa y cambiar el techo, pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo solicita un crédito para comprar todo los materiales necesarios como piso cerámico, cemento, pintura, laminas, polines y pago de mano de obra  para que el y su familia puedan vivir más seguros y cómodos.
texts.en:
Lucas is 30 years old and lives in his own home along with his wife and daughter. His work involves selling popular medicines. With the income he generates from his sales, Lucas has been able to move forward.

He wants to improve his home by installing a ceramic floor, painting the house, and replacing the roof. However, Lucas does not earn enough from his sales to complete this project. He is requesting a loan in order to buy all of the necessary materials such as ceramic floor tiles, cement, paint, metal roofing sheets, and beams. Lucas will also pay for labor. All of this will be done so that his family can live more securely and comfortably.

loans.use: to pay for ceramic floor tiles, cement, paint, metal roofing sheets, beams, and labor.

loans.name: Las Piedras Group

texts.es:
Manuela es una mujer de 29 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos de 10, 5 y 1 año, y su negocio es la venta de refrigerios.
Ella es buena madre, amable, feliz, generosa, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en el ‘plan 3000’ de la ciudad, un área caracterizada por la colonización de migrantes como; tribus ayoreas nativas del lugar y mineros relocalizados de occidente, se apoderaron del lugar y su siguiente generación inicio el comercio y manufactura en todas las áreas, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-35 grados centígrados.
Manuela es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (la 4 contando de la derecha, viste polera blanca y bermuda azul de jean). sus deseos de superación y la necesidad de alimentar a sus hijos la hicieron formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de gaseosas, venta de tarjetas telefónicas, venta de jugos naturales, venta de poleras de mujer, comercio de frutos secos, venta de material escolar, venta de comida y venta de artículos de ferretería, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de refrigerios, como; sándwiches de carnes frías, de tomate, de pollo, y otros, labor que realiza 2 veces al día; durante media mañana y a media tarde, el resto del tiempo lo ocupa en la preparación de su comida y en el cuidado de sus hijos. “encontré un nicho de mercado el cual no estaba cubierto, inicie vendiendo ambulantemente, aún sigo así pero ya tengo pedidos diarios a los que les entrego la comida en 2 turnos…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un kiosko propio y fijo dónde pueda preparar los refrigerios y mandar los pedidos mediante delivery, ella desea realizar la compra de insumos de cocina como; jamón, pollo, huevos y otros por mayor para almacenarlos refrigerados y preparar refrigerios todo el tiempo. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de manera independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Manuela solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos por mayor para preparar variedad de refrigerios para ofertar a sus clientes y generar mayores ventas.
texts.en:
Manuela is a 29-year old woman, who has 3 children, ages 10, 5 and 1. She makes a living selling snacks. She is a good mother, kind, cheerful, generous, responsible and hard-working. Her business is located in "plan 3000", an area known for the amount of immigrants, such as native tribes and miners coming from the West. These groups colonized the area and the following generation started a life of trading and manufacturing. The area has tropical weather, warm and humid, with temperatures varying between 18 and 35ºC.

Manuela has tanned skin, long dark hair in a pony tail, dark eyes, short height and robust complexity. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she uses with her family. She also speaks Spanish for general culture and to be used in her business. She is the forth one in the picture from the right, and wears a white polo and blue jeans. Her wish of self-improvement and the need to feed her children led her to put together a group of people in different businesses, such as sodas, phone cards, natural juices, women t-shirts, dry fruits, school material, food and hardware products, to request a loan and expand their activities. She sells snacks, such as cold meat, tomato or chicken sandwiches, something that she does twice a day, in the morning and in the afternoon. She spends the rest of the time cooking for her family and taking care of the kids. "I found a market niche that was not covered and started selling in the streets; I already have daily orders and deliver the food in 2 shifts", she says. 

Her dream is to have her own store to prepare the snacks and send out orders for delivery. She wants to buy ingredients, such as ham, chicken, eggs and others in bulk to be refrigerated and keep cooking all the time. This is her third loan with the institution in the 3 years she is been in the business independently. 

This is why she is requesting a loan to buy a variety of ingredients in bulk to prepare snacks for her clients and improve sales.

loans.use: to buy ingredients in bulk to prepare a variety of snacks for her clients and increase sales.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer La Rinconada Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER LA RINCONADA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Isabel ella es soltera y tiene 26 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de ganadería y también la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de chicha, la socia los hace engordar y crecer a los ganados y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar ganado.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank named “Nuevo Amanecer La Rinconada”. The bank is located in the District of Andahuaylillas in Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. Isabel. She is 26 years old, single, and works at her livestock business. Isabel also continues to manage her business of selling “chicha” [a traditional beverage made from corn]. She raises and fattens the livestock before selling them at different fairs. Isabel works from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. She is able to get ahead through her work. Her dream is to expand her business of selling livestock. Therefore, she is requesting a loan in order to buy livestock.

The other members engage in businesses such as selling snacks, selling clothes, managing a grocery store, and operating a restaurant.

Isabel is grateful to those who have helped her to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 27 years old and lives in Aguada, Ozamiz City. She is married with two school age children. She has a shop that sells a variety of flowers. She has had this business for two years. Now, she requested a loan to buy paint and pay for labor. She has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Mercy hopes that she can financially provide for the studies of her children.

loans.use: to buy paint and pay for labor.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Antonia heads up for the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well, especially the much needed land and seedbed preparations. She wants to have enough supply of corn fertilizer for which she applied for a loan from the Cooperative. Antonia hopes to save enough for the repair and extension of her house.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for more produce

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income in addition to her husband. She is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. She has a business producing and selling durable sacks in the local community. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive. She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional materials and sewing supplies. This will allow her to generate more income and be able to supply durable sacks in neighboring towns.

loans.use: buy additional materials and sewing supplies

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 45 years old and married with five children.

Rosemarie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, eggs, groceries, etc.

Rosemarie has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Rosemarie aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 62 years old and widowed with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rosenda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like toothpaste, canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Rosenda has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Rosenda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like toothpaste, canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario, de 42 años de edad, no fue a la escuela, se dedico a trabajar en la agricultura junto a su padre, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Mario, desde hace varios años tiene molino en su casa, también se dedica  a la agricultura y sus hijos le ayudan cuando
no van a la escuela, trabaja de lunes a viernes.
  
Mario, solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para el molino y para comprar insumos para preparar el terreno donde cultivara maíz, de esa manera logrará que su familia tenga mejor calidad de vida.

El sueño de Mario, es tener su propio negocio para obtener siempre los ingresos necesarios para su familia.
texts.en:
Mario is 42 years old and did not attend school. He works in agriculture alongside his father. Mario is married and his wife takes care of the household duties. For the past several years, Mario has operated a grain mill at his house. He also works in agriculture and his children help him when they are not in school. Mario works Monday through Friday.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy spare parts for his grain mill and supplies for preparing the land where he will grow corn. This will allow his family to have a better quality of life. Mario’s dream is to have his own business so that he can always generate needed income for his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his grain mill and supplies for preparing the land where he will grow corn.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a businesswoman from Liloy. She is 54 years old, a widow and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Erlinda is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Erlinda continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo de 57 años de edad se dedica desde hace 20 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su esposa en casa propia, Pablo está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Pablo is 57 years old and has worked in agriculture for 20 years by growing corn and beans. He sells his products at different markets located near his house. Pablos lives in his own home along with his wife.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, and other supplies so that he can improve the land that is shown in the photograph. As a result, he can continue his work and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, and other supplies so that he can improve his land.

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna is 37 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Johna has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Johna has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Viminda

texts.en:
Viminda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Viminda is 29 years old and has two children who are in school.

Viminda has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Viminda has been in this business for three years. In the future, Viminda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos s un hombre muy recursivo e inteligente, aprovecho sus conocimientos en reparación de electrodomésticos para iniciar su propia empresa en el año 2010 la cual se trata de venta de electrométricos de segunda mano, su negocio funciona de la siguiente manera; el compra mercancía en mal estado la repara y la oferta. 
Con este negocio ha logrado mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia conformada por él, su pareja y sus tres hijos, dos mujeres y un hombre. 
La Idea de Carlos es ofrecer sus productos en zonas más vulnerables que no tienen como acceder a estos productos pero con su ayuda se los dejara a un buen costo al alcance de su mano.
Pensando en esta bonita labor y obviamente negocio Carlos quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar específicamente neveras, lavadoras, computadoras.
texts.en:
Carlos is a resourceful and intelligent man who took advantage of his knowledge of household appliance repair to start his own business of selling secondhand appliances in 2010. His business functions in the following manner: he buys products that are in bad condition, repairs them, and sells them.

Through this business he has been able to improve his quality of life and that of his family, which includes his partner and their three children, two daughters and a son. Carlos states that his idea is to offer his merchandise in the most vulnerable areas where people do not have access to these products. With the help of this loan, he will be able to acquire products at a good cost right at his fingertips.

Having belief in his work and business, Carlos is requesting a loan with the specific intention of buying refrigerators, washing machines, and computers.

loans.use: to buy refrigerators, washing machines, and computers that he can repair and resell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 44 years old and married with eight children, one of whom is in school.

Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Evelyn has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and earns additional income from rice retailing.

Evelyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Sorn, 61, is residing in Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia. She has three children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small farm, primarily growing rice, and sells her agricultural product to local dealers and customer at the market. So far, she has been in this type of business for 35 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 3.00 a day. Currently, she would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of travelling. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 55 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Helen has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Helen has been in this business for five years. In the future, Helen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 40 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school.

Analiza is in the agricultural business, raising goats in the Philippines. Analiza requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her goat.

Analiza has been in this business for one year now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Analiza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her goat

loans.name: Trabajadoras De Higachi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TRABAJADORAS DE HIGACHI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alicia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de queso, servicio de construcción, taller de carpintería, venta de ganado, venta de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alicia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de queso; da a conocer que este negocio aprendió de sus padres, ya que desde niña trabaja con este negocio, recuerda que inicio con la venta de sus ovejas para la adquisición de ganado vacuno, con el cual desarrolla su producción.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado vacuno) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente a la crianza lo utilizará  como medio de producción. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.

Se identifica la ausencia de una de las clientes, la misma se marcho con premura a su domicilio, por razones personals
texts.en:
The “Trabajadoras de Higachi” loan group is beginning its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer’s Achacachi regional office. The group has ten members and is led by a board of directors that has Alicia as its president. The members have different types of businesses, including: selling cheese, building services, a carpentry workshop, selling cattle, and selling blankets.

This loan will benefit small businesses in Alicia’s group. Alicia herself tells us that this is the first time that she has worked with Pro Mujer, having joined following an invitation at a promotional campaign that the organisation did in her local area. Alicia currently has a business selling cheese. She says that she learned this trade from her parents and worked with the business as a girl. She remembers started by selling sheep, then bought bovine cattle. She was able to use the cattle to produce her cheese products.

Alicia will use this loan to buy more cattle from bulk sellers at the community market. She will then raise the cattle and use them in her production process. This work allows Alicia to earn an income to support her family financially; Alicia is married and has three children.

When asked what it is that she likes about Pro Mujer, Alicia replies by saying that she likes the training courses offered by the organisation.

In the photo, one borrower is missing as she had to leave the meeting early owing to personal reasons.

loans.use: to buy bovine cattle.

loans.name: Chamroeun

texts.en:
Chamroeun lives in a community in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has only one child. To make a living and support the family, she manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing rice, and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers and customers in the market. So far, she has been in this business for almost 10 years. On average, she is able to earn USD 5.00 a day.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her mango plantation. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.  She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 48 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Letecia works very hard to provide for them.

Letecia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for five years now. 

In the future, Letecia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is a woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Belinda is 49 years old and three of her children are in school.

Belinda has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy containers of coconut wine to sell.

Belinda has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Belinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Herdeliza

texts.en:
Herdeliza is 44 years old and has eight children. She is married and six of her children are in school.

Herdeliza is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Herdeliza requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Herdeliza has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Herdeliza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 61 years old and has nine children. She is a married woman.

Jessie is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Jessie requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jessie has been in this business for 12 years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jessie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Banco Mujer Cabécar Group

texts.es: Marleni es una mujer de 23 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive en unión libre. Humilde, sencilla y trabajadora. Es socia del Banco Mujer Cabécar, y escogieron éste nombre debido a que todas las integrantes son indígenas cabécares. Ella se enteró de los servicios que ofrece la Fundación por medio de otras socias de su comunidad. Inició su actividad productiva con el fin de ayudar en su hogar con los gastos, debido a que la zona en la que viven es muy rural y las fuentes de empleo son mínimas. Su compañero  es jornalero y lo que percibe es muy poco, entonces ella tuvo la necesidad de generar ingresos y poder ayudar a su familia. Es una joven q no cuenta con familia materna ni paterna, por lo que se refugia en la familia de su compañero. Es primera vez que solicita financiamiento para reforzar su negocio. Ella va invertir en comprar bolsas y químicos que necesita la siembra del plátano para darl mejor calidad a su producto. Una de sus metas es que sus hijos si puedan estudiar, ya que ella no pudo hacerlo, debido a ésto ella trabaja fuerte para salir adelante con su familia, asi crecer y mejorar la calidad de vida. Junto con Marleni trabajan  nueve socias más, las cuales van a invertir en agricultura y comercio.
texts.en:
Marleni is 23 years old and has a partner and two children. Humble, simple and hard-working, Marleni is a member of the “Mujer Cabécar” (“Cabécar Woman” in English) communal bank. The members chose this name as they are all indigenous Cabécar women.

Marleni learned about Fundación Mujer from other borrowers in her community. 

Marleni started working growing plantains in order to help with household costs. She lives in a very rural area and employment opportunities are scant. Marleni’s partner is a labourer and earns very little money. Marleni therefore had to earn an income and support her family.

Marleni does not have her own family on her mother’s or father’s side and so takes solace in her partner’s family.

This is the first time that Marleni has applied for a loan to strengthen her business. She will invest this loan in bags and chemicals that she needs to grow bananas. This will increase the quality of her product.

One of Marleni’s goals is for her children to be able to study. She herself could not study as she had to work hard to move forward with her family, to grow, and to improve her quality of life.

Marleni works with nine other borrowers, who will invest in farming and trade work.

loans.use: to buy supplies to grow plantains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Ayda

texts.es: Hace 3 años Ayda, mujer de 57 años de edad, llegó a su retiro jubiloso y la empresa donde trabajaba la pensionó; ella mujer muy activa, decidió no quedarse con los brazos cruzados (desocupada) y por eso emprendió su negocio con sus ahorros, mediante el cual hoy elabora ropa, accesorios femeninos y para el hogar, entre otros artículos que comercializa y son de interés de las familias. Ayda trabaja 12 horas diarias, para aumentar cada vez más la calidad de vida de su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 19, 28 y 32 años. Su mayor desafío antes de recibir un crédito de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  era lograr fuentes de financiación, para mejorar la imagen de su negocio, incrementando sus inventarios y  su crédito la ayudó a lograrlo parcialmente. Hoy está acudiendo a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar materia prima para elaborar ropa y accesorios con el fin de aumentar sus inventarios  y sus ventas.
texts.en:
Three years ago, 57-year-old Ayda retired and was given a pension by her former employer. Being an active woman, however, Ayda decided not to sit at home twiddling her thumbs but instead used her savings to start a business. She now produces clothes, and accessories for women and for the home, as well as selling other items for families.

Ayda works 12 hours every day in order to increase her family’s quality of life. Ayda’s family comprises a partner and three children, ages 32, 28, and 19 years old.

Before receiving this loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, Ayda’s biggest challenge was finding sources of financing to improve the image of her business and increase stock. A loan has partly helped her to do this. Today, Ayda is applying for a second loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through Kiva, in order to buy supplies for producing clothes and accessories. With this loan, Ayda can increase her stock and her sales.

loans.use: to buy supplies for producing clothes and accessories.

loans.name: Phlly

texts.en:
Phlly, 31, is residing in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has three children. To make a living and support her family, she works as a phone seller for one private company. So far, she has been in this career for one year. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 6.00 a day. Phlly would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of travelling. 

She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 40 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Perla works very hard to provide for them.

Perla runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as rice, noodles, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Perla would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Yudis Margot

texts.es:
Como podemos observar en la foto la señora Yudis una mujer de 39 años, una ama de casa que destina un espacio de su vivienda a atender un negocio de venta de mercancía de uso personal como lo es, cremas de manos, productos para el cuerpo, gel, artículos de manicura, y algunos accesorios, que presenta un pequeño problema y es que como se observa en la foto su vitrina carece de surtido y es por ello que solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos como lo son desodorantes, talco, barnice, diademas entre otros.
La necesidad del préstamo radica en que gracias a este negocio Yudis puede generar el sustento para sus dos hijso de 12 y 5 años, en los cuales centra todos sus esfuerzos para que estudien y sean personas de bien para la sociedad.
texts.en:
Here in the photo we can see señora Yudis, a 39-year-old woman, a housewife who has a space set aside in her house to run a business selling personal products such as hand cream, body care products, manicure sets and other accessories. 

As the photo shows, she has a small problem in that her display cabinet is lacking in stock. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy products such as deodorants, talc, nail varnish and hair bands amongst other things.  

Yudis requires a loan because, thanks to this business, she is able to support her two children of 12 and 5 years of age. All her efforts are concentrated on her children's studies and ensuring that they are brought up to be decent people.

loans.use: to buy products like deodorants, talc, nail varnish, hair bands amongst other things.

loans.name: San Valentín Group

texts.es: Tres mujeres trabajadoras y con espíritu de superación decidieron unirse y formar un grupo al que llamaron “San Valentín” para solicitar un financiamiento en ADIM y así aumentar el capital de sus negocios, quien lo coordina es Manuela una señora de 25 años, casada y madre de un hijo quien se ha convertido en su mayor fuerza para su superación, se dedica a la venta de quesillos y enchiladas en las escuelas cercanas a su comunidad, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de vinagre, cebolla, queso quesillo, repollo, leña, etc., una de sus metas es tener un local donde pueda ofrecer sus productos. El resto de los integrantes son, Ruth que tiene la edad de 22 años y comercializa ropa de manera ambulante en su comunidad, y Gladys de 20 años de edad, quien comercializa en su domicilio refrescos, hielos y tajadas con queso. Estas jóvenes saben que con esfuerzo y dedicación pueden llegar a conseguir lo que se planteen si perseveran.
texts.en:
Three hardworking, spirited women decided to get together and form a group that they called "San Valentin" to be able to request financing through ADIM and therefore increase the capital in their businesses. 

The coordinator is Manuela, a 25-year-old woman, married with a child who is her major driving force to get on in life. She sells curd cheese and enchiladas in local schools where she lives. She is requesting the loan to buy vinegar, onions, curd cheese, cabbage and firewood etc. One of her aims is to have premises where she can sell her products. 

The other members are Ruth, who is 22 years old and sells clothes around the streets, and Gladys who is 20 years old and sells soft drinks, ices and fried plantain with cheese from her home. These young women know that with effort and determination they can achieve what they set out to do if they persevere.

loans.use: to buy vinegar, onions, curd cheese, cabbage etc.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: Maria, tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija a su cargo, reside en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Hace 10 años que cultiva su propio café para vender, el cual ofrece en grano en pergamino en el mercado local. Ha solicitado un prestamo por 10,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y pago de trabajadores para darle mantenimiento a su finca. Su propósito es poderle dar mejor asistencia a sus cultivos y obtener ganancias para sacar adelante a su hija y dejarle como herencia una finca de café.
texts.en:
Maria is 39 years old, she is a single mother and has one daughter to support. She lives in a village in the municipality of Gracias, Lempira. 

For the past ten years, she has been growing her own coffee that she sells as parchment coffee beans at the local market. 

She has requested a loan of 10,000 lempiras to buy fertilisers and pay workers for the upkeep of her plantation. Her intention is to boost crop growth and obtain profits to enable her to help her daughter to get ahead and leave her a coffee planatation as her inheritance.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers and pay workers for the upkeep of her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es una morena muy trabajadora, emprendedora que quiere salir adelante, quiere progresar, tiene ambición de cosas grandes, una madre de 3 hijos de 10, 8 y 1 año de edad (ver foto hijo de 1  año de edad), que trabaja diariamente hasta 12 horas para conseguir los recursos para mantener a su familia. 
Ella se desempeña como vendedora de bebidas y se ha trazado tres metas en su vida: la primera es pagar la educación de sus hijos, la segunda es comprar una vivienda propia y por ultimo consolidar una empresa estable y rentable para dejar como herencia a sus hijos.
Francisca solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de cajas de cerveza en cantidad ya que en su zona de residencia hace mucho calor y es el producto con mayor rotación y que le está permitiendo alimentar sus hijos.
texts.en:
Francisca is a hard-working entrepreneur who wants to get ahead.  Her ambition is to do great things.  She is the mother of three children, ages ten, eight, and a one-year-old (shown in the photo).  She works as many as 12 hours a day to earn the income the support her family.

She sells beverages and has been able to consolidate her business making a stable, profitable company for her children to inherit.

Francisca is requesting a loan to buy a variety of beer crates in bulk since where she lives it is very hot and there is much product turnover.  This will allow her to feed her children.

loans.use: To buy beer crates in bulk.

loans.name: Hilda Gloria

texts.es: Gracias a su primer financiamiento Doña Hilda compro los insumos y abonos necesarios con los que pudo asistir su propiedad de café la cual pudo proteger de plagas, enfermedades entre otros que pudieron de no tratarse a tiempo dañar la planta y el grano. Ella agradece el apoyo brindado por los inversionistas en KIVA y la cooperativa COMIXMUL ya que gracias al apoyo financiero sus cultivos no se perdieron. Gracias a su primer financiamiento logro comprar abono, abono de nitrato y el pago de mano de obra para poder asistir un poco más rápido su plantación. En la actualidad Doña Hilda solicita su segundo crédito con el cual comprara nuevamente insumos agrícolas los cuales ayudaran a volver a dar protección a sus cultivos de café ya que estos están floreciendo y es el momento adecuado para dar la asistencia y protección que necesitan por lo cual espera ser apoyada nuevamente.
texts.en:
Thanks to her first loan, Hilda bought supplies and the necessary fertilizers to protect her coffee plantation from pests and disease that otherwise would have harmed the plant and coffee bean.  She is grateful for the support from KIVA lenders and the COMIXMUL co-op because thanks to their support her efforts were not in vain.

With her first loan she was able to buy manure, nitrate fertilizer and hire workers to attend to her plantation more quickly.  Hilda is currently requesting her second loan to buy more farm supplies to help protect her coffee crop which is now in bloom and at the right time for care and protection.  She trusts she will receive the support once again.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis, es una persona muy luchadora, que por la falta de recursos económicos, solo estudio hasta tercer grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y tiene dos hijos.

Luis, es agricultor desde los 12 años y fue su padre quien lo incentivo para que aprendiera, además, se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, este negocio lo realiza en su localidad y en los alrededores de su municipio.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar cerdos y una vaca, de esta manera aumentara sus ingresos económicos, ya que el posee experiencia en esta actividad.
 
Su mayor sueño es, que todo le salga bien en este nuevo negocio, así como también, que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que sean profesionales y así mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
Luis is a determined man who, for lack of resources, was only able to get a third grade education.  He is married and his wife does the domestic tasks.  They have two children.

Luis has worked as a farmer for 12 years and learned the trade from his father.  He also buys and sells cattle in and around where he lives.

He is in need of a loan to buy pigs and a cow to increase his income, since he has experience in the business.

His greatest dream is for his new business to prosper and for his children to continue their education, becoming professionals to improve their economic situation.

loans.use: To buy pigs and a cow.

loans.name: Cruz Del Sur De Viacha Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CRUZ DEL SUR DE VIACHA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mariela es la Secretaria Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, tienda de barrio, venta de perfumes, venta de ropa deportiva, venta de salchipapas, servicio de construcción, venta de juguetes, venta de enaguas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mariela es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de sombreros; da a conocer que este negocio aprendió de su madre, ya que desde ayudo en el negocio familiar, es por eso que con el ahorro de un pequeño capital decidió emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de sombreros por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que es casada y tiene tres hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "CRUZ DEL SUR DE VIACHA" is starting its first loan cycle through Pro Mujer at the social center in Cascada.  The group consists of eight members and the secretary of the managing board is Mariela.  The members are involved in different businesses, including: blanket sales, a convenience store, perfume sales, sportswear sales, hot dog sales, construction services, toy sales and underskirt sales.

Their loan will benefit small business owners, including Mariela.  This is her first through Pro Mujer which she joined by invitation through a mass promotion conducted by the institution in the area.  She currently sells hats and learned the business from her mother and by helping out in the family business.  With a small amount of savings she decided to start her independent activity.

The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital to buy hats, wholesale, from dealers in the city of La Paz.  Then she will sell them at her sales space.  Through her work she has been able to earn an income to help cover household expenses.  She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she enjoys the health area and training offered by the institution.

loans.use: To buy hats, wholesale.

loans.name: Jose Joaquin

texts.es:
Él es José un carismático y trabajador hombre de 65 años de edad, toda su vida ha mostrado gusto por el trabajo independiente, manejar sus tiempos, ser su propio jefe y no rendirle cuentas a nadie.
José ya a su edad ha pensado en dedicarle lo que pueda tener de vida a su negocio de cafetería y bar, donde oferta bebidas alcohólicas, cervezas y tiene una mesa de billar.
La razón de que se encuentre el señor José ante ustedes es porque necesita tu ayuda, un auxilio crediticio para comprar surtido de cervezas, aguardiente, ron, tequila y whisky, bebidas de mayor consumo en su negocio.
Con tu apoyo José abastecerá su negocio por un buen periodo de tiempo y no tendrá más la preocupación de quedarse sin existencias para vender a los clientes ya que al ser un hombre soltero tiene muchos gastos.
texts.en:
Jose, 65, is a charismatic, hard-working man who always has enjoyed working independently, managing his time, being his own boss and not having to report to anyone.

At his age, Jose believes he will dedicate the rest of his life to his pub where he sells alcoholic beverages and beer, and has a pool table.

The reason Jose requests your help is that he needs a loan to buy a variety of beers, liquor, rum, tequila, whisky and popular beverages for his business.

With your support Jose will be able to stock the business for a good deal of time and will not have to worry about running out of a given product to sell to his customers.  He is a single man with many expenses.

loans.use: To buy a variety of beers, liquor, rum, tequila, whisky, and popular drinks for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy windows and a door with the aim of obtaining security and tranquility in his home for his family

loans.name: Andres Felipe

texts.es:
Andres Felipe es un hombre, sonriente, de esa personas que te alegras de conocer por la buena vibra que irradian de su cuerpo.
Tiene 29 años de edad es padre de dos hermosas princesas de 10 y 8 años, e inicio un negocio de distribución de alimentos en el año 2012 como alternativa económica para generar el sustento de su familia.
Andres en el momento se encuentra más feliz que de costumbre, la razón es que con la ayuda de un préstamo que se encuentra solicitando podrá comprar un carro como el que se ve en la foto, y surtido de snacks (ver foto), para brindarle empleo a otra persona  y abarcar un mayor espacio.
Este hombre sueña con tener el almacén distribuidor más grande de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Andres Felipe is a smiley man, one of those people that make you happy to be around because of the good energy that radiates from their body.

Andres is 29 years old and father to two beautiful princesses of 10 and 8 years of age. He started a business distributing food in 2012 as a financial alternative to generate an income for his family.

At the moment Andres is even happier than usual because with the help of the loan he has applied for he will buy a cart such as the one you can see in the photo and stock it with snacks (see photo) to offer employment to another person and take on a larger space.

This man dreams of having the largest distribution warehouse in the city.

loans.use: to buy a cart and stock it with snacks to offer employment to another person

loans.name: Maria Carolina

texts.es:
María Carolina es una abuelita, adorable muy laboriosa, ella sola se mantiene, con su negocio de tienda de productos de la canasta familiar ella es separa de su esposo con él tuvo tres hijos, pero vive sola y le gusta ser autosuficiente.
Como pueden observar su tienda es muy básica y muy humilde, pero le es suficiente para vivir tranquila y compartir junto con sus vecinos.
La señora María Carolina Solicita un préstamo para abastecer su negocio y demostrar que a pesar de su edad es lo suficiente para seguir generando su propio sustento.
texts.en:
Maria Carolina is an adorable and very hardworking grandma. She supports herself with her business selling products to meet families' daily needs. She has separated from her husband with whom she had three children and though she lives alone she likes being self sufficient. 

As you can see, Maria Carolina's store is very basic and humble, but it is enough for her to live peacefully and spend time with her neighbours. 

Maria Carolina is applying for a loan to restock her store and show that in spite of her age, she has enough to continue generating her own income.

loans.use: to restock groceries in her store

loans.name: Las Mañanitas Group

texts.es: Hace quince ciclo dos mujeres y un varón decidieron unirse y formar un grupo solidario denominado “Las Mañanitas”, planteándose como meta invertir cada uno en capital de trabajo y así pagar las cuotas de pagos en el tiempo establecido para lograr un buen récord crediticio. Quien lo coordina es la señora María que tiene la edad de 44 años y se dedica a la hecha y venta de comida y tortilla además compra al por mayor y vende gaseosas y golosinas, todo esto lo comercializa contiguo al pozo de su comunidad, esta señora asegura que el estar soltera le permite dedicar más tiempo a su negocio para ofrecer los recursos necesarios a su familia, anteriormente se dedicaba a la comercialización de ropa, negocio que ha tenido que dejar para cubrir la demanda que tiene de los alomentos, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de quintal de maíz arroz, frijol, bidón de aceite, etc., ya que ella sale a comprar al mercado de la municipalidad al por mayor para así obtener mayores márgenes de ganancias. El resto de los integrantes son, la señora Paubla que tiene la edad de 49 años y es propietaria de una pulpería desde hace dos años, y el señor Jorge que a sus 56 años se dedica a la agricultura, esto lo aprendió desde que era joven, ya que su papá le enseñó y heredó este negocio. Este grupo ha demostrado que la comunicación es la base para cumplir con los objetivos planteados como grupo.
texts.en:
Fifteen cycles ago two women and a man decided to get together and form a solidarity group called 'Las Mañanitas', establishing the goal of each person investing in working capital and making their repayments within the allocated time to obtain a good credit rating. 

The person who coordinates the group is Maria. She is 44 years old and works making and selling meals and tortillas, as well as buying soft drinks and lollies in bulk which she then resells. Everything is sold by the well in their community. Maria assures us that since she is single she is able to dedicate more time to her business to offer her family everything they need. Before she used to sell clothing, a business she had to give up to meet the demand for her food. 

The current loan that Maria has applied for will be used to buy corn, rice, drums of oil etc. by the quintal, as she makes her purchases in bulk at the council market to gain a higher profit margin. 

The other members are Pauba, who is 49 years old and has been the owner of a grocery store for two years, and Jorge, who at 56 years of age works as a farmer, a line of work he learnt when he was young since his father taught him and he inherited the business. 

This group has demonstrated that communication is the key to achieving the goals that they as a group set out to achieve.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, beans, a large drum of oil, etc. by the quintal

loans.name: Danelia Del Carmen

texts.es: Danelia es una mujer esforzada que a sus 52 años ha dedicado más de veinte años a su negocio, lo que hoy es un taller de bordado. Ella empezó con capital propio y luego con los financiamientos obtenidos ha logrado aumentar la producción lo que ha hecho crecer su negocio. Es el sexto ciclo que solicita en ADIM el financiamiento para su negocio con el objetivo de incrementar el capital de trabajo, de modo que invertirá en tela de dacron, gabardina, gabardina estampado, conos de hilo, ziper, etc., y darle mantenimiento a la maquinaria utilizada, su meta es mantener el negocio ya que es el que le permite aportar a los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Danelia is a hard-working woman who, at 52 yeas old, has worked for more than 20 years in her business, which is now an embroidery workshop. She began with her own capital and later with the loans she got, she has managed to expand her production which has made her business grow. This is her sixth loan cycle that she has applied for from ADIM. The loan is for her business with the objective to increase her working capital. She will invest in Dacron fabric, gabardine, printed gabardine, thread cones, zippers, etc. and do some maintenance on the machinery she uses. Her goal is to maintain her business since it is what allows her to support the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase Dacron, gabardine, printed gabardine, thread cones, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Ivonne Adeli

texts.es:
Ivonne, de 35 años de edad, es una joven trabajadora, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casada y su esposo se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas y tiene una niña de 3 años de edad.

Ivonne, siempre se ha dedicado a los oficios del hogar, pero actualmente está trabajando en un lugar, donde están construyendo una represa de retención de agua, en dicho lugar se encarga de la limpieza.- A su niña la cuidan sus padres, mientras ella está trabajando.

Ella necesita el crédito para construir una pared en la casa donde vive, pues está construyendo su casa y le falta una pared de los lados.

Ella desea ayudara a su hijo en los estudios para que sea un profesional y que tengan un empleo digno.
texts.en:
Ivonne is 35 years old and a young worker who studied up until the end of high school. She is married and her husband works as a farmer. Together they have a three year old daughter.

Ivonne has always worked doing household duties, but at the moment she is working in a place where they are constructing a retaining wall in a dam. In this place she takes care of the cleaning and her parents take care of her daughter while she is working.

Ivonne needs this loan to build a wall in the house where they live as they are building their home and they are missing a sidewall.

Ivonne would like to help her son with his studies so he can be a professional and have a decent job.

loans.use: to build a wall in the house where she lives

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena, 36, is married with four children, two of whom are in school.

Lorena is in the agricultural business.  She farms rice in the Philippines. Lorena has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lorena has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lorena would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, lard and cheese.

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
Luis un vendedor de mercancía de muy trabajador y honrado, se gana la vida luchando en la calle soñando un día poder tener un local y evitar algo que pasa muy a menudo que son los robos, pues tiene su mercancía y la gente pasa por un lado, Luisa vende manzanas, películas en formato DVD, sombreros cantinfleras.
Luis es un hombre divorciado, pero con su exmujer tiene 3 hijos de 4, 10 y 12 años de edad los cuales les manda dinero cada 15 días y lo ve con una frecuencia de una vez por semana.
Luis quiere comprar surtido, abastecerse, incentivar las ventas tener productos que los clientes se antojen pero de momento no cuenta con el capital para realizar la operación, por ello solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de accesorios como lo son bolsos, correas y sombreros, pero de igual manera comprar manzanas pues es el negocio con el que empezó en el año 1995.
texts.en:
Luis is a very hard-working and honest merchandise vendor. He earns his living struggling in the street and dreaming of one day being able to have a retail location and avoid something that happens very frequently, which is thefts, since he has his merchandise and people go by. Luis sells apples, movies on DVD, and hats.

Luis is a divorced man, but with his ex-wife he has three children, ages 4, 10, and 12, to whom he sends money every two weeks and he sees them once a week.

Luis wants to purchase an assortment, stock up, and stimulate sales having products that his customers fancy but at the moment he doesn't have the capital to do it. For this, he is asking for a loan to purchase an assortment of accessories such as bags, belts, and hats, but also to purchase apples since it is the business with which he started in 1995.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of accessories such as bags, belts, and hats.

loans.name: Victor Ruben

texts.es:
Victor es un hombre solitario de 54 años de edad, su tienda es lo único que tiene para generar el sustento, las personas que diariamente van y le comprar algún producto son las que lo hacen sentir vivo, con ellas son las únicas que interactúa.
Victor hace un tiempo se separó de su mujer pero este negocio lo ha ido sacando de la soledad por ello su sostenimiento se ha convertido en algo prioritario aparte de que gracias a sus ingresos puede tener un alimento en su mesa.
Victor solicita un préstamo para abastecer su negocio con aceite, panela, refrescos, arepas, chocolate, snack y parte del dinero lo destinara para mejoras locativas como lo son pintura y arreglo de estanterías.
texts.en:
Victor is a single 54 year old man. His shop is his sole source of income. The people who visit his shop everyday to buy something are the people who make him feel alive as they are the only people that he interacts with.
Victor separated from his wife some time ago but his business has kept him from being alone and so his work has become something of a priority from which, thanks to his income, he is able to put food on the table.
Victor is asking for a loan to stock up his business with oil, raw cane sugar, soft drinks, corn tortillas, chocolate and snacks and part of the money will go towards remodelling his shop, for example, painting and fixing shelves.

loans.use: to stock up his business with oil, raw cane sugar, soft drinks, corn tortillas, chocolate and snacks.

loans.name: Maximiliano

texts.es:
Maximiliano, proviene de una familia con principios cristianos y de escasos recursos económicos, no cuenta con ningún nivel académico, está casado y su esposa se dedica  a los oficios domésticos. 

Maximiliano, se dedica a la agricultura, está actividad la realiza desde que era un niño, su padre le enseño a trabajar muy arduamente, tiene que levantarse a las cuatro de la mañana para iniciar su jornada de trabajo, además de la agricultura, tiene conocimientos sobre la caficultura y es de estas actividades que obtiene los ingresos para su familia.  

El crédito será destinado para comprar más árboles de café para sembrarlos y aumentar su cosecha.
texts.en:
Maximiliano comes from a family with Christian principles and low income. He doesn't have any level of schooling. He is married and his wife takes care of the home. 

Maximiliano works in agriculture. He has done this activity since he was a child. His father taught him to work very hard. He has to get up at four in the morning to start his work day. In addition to the agriculture, he has knowledge about growing coffee, and from these activities he obtains income for his family. 

The loan will be used to buy more coffee plants to plant them and increase his harvest.

loans.use: to buy more coffee plants to plant them and increase his harvest.

loans.name: Sinar Group

texts.en:
The Sinar Group is led by the 46 year-old farmer Adam, who is wearing red trousers and standing with hands on hips, second row. The other Farmers in the group are Ukir, Fuad, Nono, Adi, Ageng, Ari, Alit, Zam and Asar. They are standing in front of a cow-house. Fiki, Adam’s cousin (who wear black t-shirt, second row) is also posed in the group photo and he has agreed to be displayed on Kiva. Adam has a family with two children. All of them live in Sinar Negeri, a small village in Pubian, Lampung Tengah, Indonesia.

Adam has high hopes for his family and he strives to improve his economic conditions. He has been running a small-scale vegetable farming for more than five years. His business runs well. A year ago, he and his friends started to run a small cow-fattening business. However, he was troubled with the high price of chemical fertilizers. He is also get protested by the neighbors because the cow dungs, which is not used as fertilizer, is causing a pungent odor.

After socialized by Yayasan Rumah Energi and Lembaga Pengembangan Pertanian Nahdatul Ulama/LPPNU (a local NGO – biogas construction partner of YRE) about Household Biogas (BIRU) program, Adam saw the biogas program is a solution of his problem. He saw opportunity to reduce his dependence on non- renewable cooking gas. In addition, he also wants to use bio-slurry (biogas residue) as organic fertilizer for his plants or sell it to increase revenue. Adam is keen to purchase a bio-digester, but he does not have sufficient capital for it. A loan from Kiva will help him and other group members to make it possible.

Adam hopes that if he can build bio-digester, he can use the bio-gas for cooking, and bio-slurry (biogas residue) as fertilizers for his plantation. He also want to sell the remaining bio-slurry to increase income.

loans.use: to build bio-digester and utilization of biogas residue as organic fertilizer

loans.name: Fortuna Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FORTUNA” iniciará el vigésimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Susana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, tienda de barrio, venta de perfumes, venta de ropa deportiva, venta de salchipapas, servicio de construcción, venta de juguetes, venta de enaguas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Susana es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanía en madera; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años en un negocio al que apoyaba como trabajadora, con el pasar del tiempo aprendió a tornear la madera y decidió empezar su negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de madera por mayor) que adquirirá de las barracas mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.

Se identifica la ausencia de una de las clientes, la misma se fue presurosa a su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
The “FORTUNA” communal bank will begin its twenty-first cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Centro Focal de Los Andes. It is made up of nine members and led by a board of directors, of which Susana is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied, Among them are selling blankets, a neighborhood store, selling perfume, selling sports clothing, selling salchipapas, construction services, selling toys and selling underskirts.

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, including Susana. She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago of a friend who is a client of the institution. Right now, she has a business selling handmade crafts out of wood. She says that she learned this business several years ago in a business she worked at as an employee. Over time, she learned to work the wood and decided to open her own business.   

The loan she will take out now is to increase capital by buying wood wholesale, which she will acquire from lumber wholesalers in the city of La Paz. After making them, she will sell them in her sales space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, as she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the area of health that her institution offers. 

The absence of one of the clients is noted. She was needed at her sales stall.

loans.use: to buy wood wholesale.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de tamales desde hace varios años, con las ventas que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logra salir adelante, Virginia quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo, encementando el piso y construyendo unas fosa séptica, pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no el alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillos, laminas nuevas, polines y pago de mano de obra y así ella y su esposo puedan vivir más seguros y cómodos.
texts.en:
Virginia is 37 years old and lives in her own house with her husband.  She's been selling tamales for a few years and with the sales and the help of her husband she manages to get ahead.  
Virginia wants to improve her home by changing the roof, adding a cement floor, and building a septic tank but with what she gets from the sale of tamales it is not enough.  It is for this reason that she's requesting a loan to buy cement, sand, bricks, zinc sheets, and pay for labor.  In this way her husband and her can live safely and more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, zinc sheets, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Milluni Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MILLUNI” iniciará el septimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lourdes es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de faldas, venta de masitas, venta de mantas de vicuña, venta de cordones escolares, venta de chamarras, venta de accesorios. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lourdes es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas de vicuña; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años al apoyar a su madre en su negocio familiar, con el pasar del tiempo decidió emprender un negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana de vicuña) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Milluni” will start its seventh cycle with Pro Mujer, at the satellite office “Centro Focal Panamericana.” The group is comprised of eight members and led by a board, where Lourdes is the president. The members have different activities, such as making skirts, selling bakery products, selling vicuña wool blankets, selling shoe laces, selling jackets and selling accessories.

This loan will be of help to small entrepreneurs such as Lourdes. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for a year, and that she joined invited by a friend, who is a client of the institution. She runs a vicuña blankets business she started years ago to help her mother with her family business. With time, she decided to work on her own.

With this loan, she will increase her working capital by buying vicuña wool from saleswomen at the city of El Alto. She will then sell it in her store. Thanks to this business, she can receive an income that helps her to support her family, since she is single.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training sessions and the healthcare programs offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy vicuña wool.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita, 63, is married with four adult-age children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for many years. 

The business helps her meet her family's financial needs. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers.

Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her family. She already has taken and repaid loans to purchase additional stocks for her store.  She is now re-applying for a loan for her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado a cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 4 años a la venta de comida como: pupusa, tacos, trotas, desayunos, etc. su esposa le ayuda con las ventas, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa y está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, frijoles, queso, chicharrón, huevos, carne, pollos, verduras, frutas y demás productos que utiliza para una mejor calidad y cantidad de comida y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young man whose face has been blurred because he is 24 years old and lives in a high risk zone, has been selling food for the last 4 years, including breakfasts, pupusas, tacos, and sandwiches. His wife also helps with the sales and with the income he's able to cover many of his house expenses.  He owns his house and lives with his wife.  
He's requesting a loan to buy flour, beans, cheese, pork rinds, eggs, meat, chickens, vegetables, fruits and other products that he uses for his food stall so he can have a better quality and quantity of food and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy flour, beans, cheese, pork rinds, eggs, meat, chickens, vegetables, fruits and other products.

loans.name: Ay

texts.en:
Ay is 50 years old and is a married man who lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He has two children. 

To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business on a small piece of farmland which is located near his house. On his farmland, he grows rice and sells his agricultural products to the local dealers. He has been in this type of business for sixteen years. On average, he can generate earnings of USD 5 per day.

Recently he has come up with a new business idea. He wants to run a buy-and-sell rice business. However, his limited capital doesn't allow him to do this, so he is applying for a Kiva loan to use as capital to run his new business. This loan will allow him to have one more source of income which will help to remove poverty from his life. 

He is thankful to all lenders for their financial support towards poor people.

loans.use: to run a buy-and-sell rice business

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 54 years old and lives in Tudela,Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with 3 school aged children. 

She has a shop that sells a variety of fruits, with the income helping provide for her family. She has had this business for 15 years. 

To finish her dream house, she has requested for a loan for housing renovation. She has been a member of PMPC for 12 years. In the future, Fe hopes that she would be successful in renovating her dream house.

loans.use: to pay for housing renovations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood and machinery for his carpentry shop.

loans.name: G.s. Productoras Del Palmar #2 Group

texts.es: María Catalina, tiene 28 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos y reside en el municipio de Morazán, Yoro junto a su esposo e hijos. Hace dos años que ella tiene su propio cultivo de maíz para obtener sus propios ingresos y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Esta producción de maíz la vende en la misma zona. Y para mantener el cultivo en buen estado ha solicitado otro préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar abonos e insumos para fertilizar su cultivo de maíz y poder mejorar la cosecha. Su meta es seguir cultivando, ampliar el cultivo y darle mejor vida a su familia. el préstamo es en forma grupal y se llama Productoras del Palmar #2, integrado por 3 personas que se dedican al cultivo de maíz y viven en la misma zona. El  préstamo total es por L.30,000 para comprar insumos, abonos y darle mantenimiento al cultivo. En la foto a la izquierda esta  Dunia, María Catalina y María Facilita a la derecha.
texts.en: María Catalina is 28 years old; she is married and lives in the town of Morazán, in the Yoro department, along with her husband and children. She has had corn crops for the last two years to generate her own income and help her husband with the household expenses. She sells her corn in the same area. In order to keep the crops in good condition, she has asked for another loan of 10,000 Lempiras to buy fertilizers and supplies to fertilize her corn crops and improve the harvest. Her aim to keep growing crops, increase production and give her family a better life. The loan is a group loan, and is called Productoras del Palmar #2, which is made up or 3 people who make a living growing corn and live in the same area. The total loan is for L.30,000 to buy fertilizers and supplies, and increase growth. In the photo, Dunia is on the left, and María Catalina and María Facilita are on the right.
